&#x27;text-destructive&#x27;,\n        className\n      )}\n      htmlFor={formItemId}\n      {...props}\n    /&gt;\n  )\n})\nFormLabel.displayName = &#x27;FormLabel&#x27;\n\nconst FormControl = React.forwardRef&lt;\n  React.ElementRef&lt;typeof Slot&gt;,\n  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef&lt;typeof Slot&gt;\n&gt;(({ ...props }, ref) =&gt; {\n  const { error, formItemId, formDescriptionId, formMessageId } = useFormField()\n\n  return (\n    &lt;Slot\n      ref={ref}\n      id={formItemId}\n      aria-describedby={\n        !error\n          ? `${formDescriptionId}`\n          : `${formDescriptionId} ${formMessageId}`\n      }\n      aria-invalid={!!error}\n      {...props}\n    /&gt;\n  )\n})\nFormControl.displayName = &#x27;FormControl&#x27;\n\nconst FormDescription = React.forwardRef&lt;\n  HTMLParagraphElement,\n  React.HTMLAttributes&lt;HTMLParagraphElement&gt;\n&gt;(({ className, ...props }, ref) =&gt; {\n  const { formDescriptionId } = useFormField()\n\n  return (\n    &lt;p\n      ref={ref}\n      id={formDescriptionId}\n      className={cn(&#x27;text-sm text-muted-foreground&#x27;, className)}\n      {...props}\n    /&gt;\n  )\n})\nFormDescription.displayName = &#x27;FormDescription&#x27;\n\nconst FormMessage = React.forwardRef&lt;\n  HTMLParagraphElement,\n  React.HTMLAttributes&lt;HTMLParagraphElement&gt;\n&gt;(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) =&gt; {\n  const { error, formMessageId } = useFormField()\n  const body = error ? String(error?.message) : children\n\n  if (!body) {\n    return null\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;p\n      ref={ref}\n      id={formMessageId}\n      className={cn(&#x27;text-sm font-medium text-destructive&#x27;, className)}\n      {...props}\n    &gt;\n      {body}\n    &lt;/p&gt;\n  )\n})\nFormMessage.displayName = &#x27;FormMessage&#x27;\n\nexport {\n  useFormField,\n  Form,\n  FormItem,\n  FormLabel,\n  FormControl,\n  FormDescription,\n  FormMessage,\n  FormField,\n}\n```\n\n### Form Validation\n```typescript\n// lib/validations/auth.ts\nimport * as z from &#x27;zod&#x27;\n\nexport const loginSchema = z.object({\n  email: z.string().email({\n    message: &#x27;Please enter a valid email address&#x27;,\n  }),\n  password: z.string().min(8, {\n    message: &#x27;Password must be at least 8 characters long&#x27;,\n  }),\n})\n\nexport type LoginInput = z.infer&lt;typeof loginSchema&gt;\n\n// components/LoginForm.tsx\nimport { useForm } from &#x27;react-hook-form&#x27;\nimport { zodResolver } from &#x27;@hookform/resolvers/zod&#x27;\nimport { loginSchema, type LoginInput } from &#x27;@/lib/validations/auth&#x27;\nimport {\n  Form,\n  FormControl,\n  FormField,\n  FormItem,\n  FormLabel,\n  FormMessage,\n} from &#x27;@/components/Form&#x27;\nimport { Input } from &#x27;@/components/Input&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;@/components/Button&#x27;\n\nexport function LoginForm() {\n  const form = useForm&lt;LoginInput&gt;({\n    resolver: zodResolver(loginSchema),\n    defaultValues: {\n      email: &#x27;&#x27;,\n      password: &#x27;&#x27;,\n    },\n  })\n\n  const onSubmit = async (data: LoginInput) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      // Handle form submission\n      console.log(data)\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(error)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;Form {...form}&gt;\n      &lt;form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)} className=&quot;space-y-8&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;FormField\n          control={form.control}\n          name=&quot;email&quot;\n          render={({ field }) =&gt; (\n            &lt;FormItem&gt;\n              &lt;FormLabel&gt;Email&lt;/FormLabel&gt;\n              &lt;FormControl&gt;\n                &lt;Input placeholder=&quot;m@example.com&quot; {...field} /&gt;\n              &lt;/FormControl&gt;\n              &lt;FormMessage /&gt;\n            &lt;/FormItem&gt;\n          )}\n        /&gt;\n        &lt;FormField\n          control={form.control}\n          name=&quot;password&quot;\n          render={({ field }) =&gt; (\n            &lt;FormItem&gt;\n              &lt;FormLabel&gt;Password&lt;/FormLabel&gt;\n              &lt;FormControl&gt;\n                &lt;Input type=&quot;password&quot; {...field} /&gt;\n              &lt;/FormControl&gt;\n              &lt;FormMessage /&gt;\n            &lt;/FormItem&gt;\n          )}\n        /&gt;\n        &lt;Button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Sign In&lt;/Button&gt;\n      &lt;/form&gt;\n    &lt;/Form&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## State Management\n\n### Zustand Store\n```typescript\n// stores/useStore.ts\nimport { create } from &#x27;zustand&#x27;\nimport { persist } from &#x27;zustand/middleware&#x27;\n\ninterface User {\n  id: string\n  email: string\n  name: string\n}\n\ninterface AuthState {\n  user: User | null\n  token: string | null\n  setUser: (user: User | null) =&gt; void\n  setToken: (token: string | null) =&gt; void\n  logout: () =&gt; void\n}\n\nexport const useAuthStore = create&lt;AuthState&gt;()(\n  persist(\n    (set) =&gt; ({\n      user: null,\n      token: null,\n      setUser: (user) =&gt; set({ user }),\n      setToken: (token) =&gt; set({ token }),\n      logout: () =&gt; set({ user: null, token: null }),\n    }),\n    {\n      name: &#x27;auth-storage&#x27;,\n    }\n  )\n)\n```\n\n## API Integration\n\n### API Client\n```typescript\n// lib/api.ts\nimport axios from &#x27;axios&#x27;\nimport { useAuthStore } from &#x27;@/stores/useStore&#x27;\n\nconst api = axios.create({\n  baseURL: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL,\n})\n\napi.interceptors.request.use((config) =&gt; {\n  const token = useAuthStore.getState().token\n  \n  if (token) {\n    config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`\n  }\n  \n  return config\n})\n\napi.interceptors.response.use(\n  (response) =&gt; response,\n  async (error) =&gt; {\n    if (error.response?.status === 401) {\n      useAuthStore.getState().logout()\n    }\n    return Promise.reject(error)\n  }\n)\n\nexport { api }\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### Component Testing\n```typescript\n// components/Button/Button.test.tsx\nimport { render, screen } from &#x27;@testing-library/react&#x27;\nimport userEvent from &#x27;@testing-library/user-event&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;./Button&#x27;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;Button&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const handleClick = vi.fn()\n    render(&lt;Button onClick={handleClick}&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    \n    const button = screen.getByRole(&#x27;button&#x27;, { name: /click me/i })\n    await userEvent.click(button)\n    \n    expect(handleClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1)\n  })\n\n  it(&#x27;renders in disabled state&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    render(&lt;Button disabled&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    \n    const button = screen.getByRole(&#x27;button&#x27;, { name: /click me/i })\n    expect(button).toBeDisabled()\n    expect(button).toHaveClass(&#x27;disabled:opacity-50&#x27;)\n  })\n})\n```\n\n### Hook Testing\n```typescript\n// hooks/useDebounce.test.ts\nimport { renderHook, act } from &#x27;@testing-library/react&#x27;\nimport { useDebounce } from &#x27;./useDebounce&#x27;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;useDebounce&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  beforeEach(() =&gt; {\n    vi.useFakeTimers()\n  })\n\n  afterEach(() =&gt; {\n    vi.useRealTimers()\n  })\n\n  it(&#x27;returns initial value immediately&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const { result } = renderHook(() =&gt; useDebounce(&#x27;initial&#x27;, 500))\n    expect(result.current).toBe(&#x27;initial&#x27;)\n  })\n\n  it(&#x27;debounces value updates&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const { result, rerender } = renderHook(\n      ({ value }) =&gt; useDebounce(value, 500),\n      { initialProps: { value: &#x27;initial&#x27; } }\n    )\n\n    rerender({ value: &#x27;updated&#x27; })\n    expect(result.current).toBe(&#x27;initial&#x27;)\n\n    act(() =&gt; {\n      vi.advanceTimersByTime(500)\n    })\n\n    expect(result.current).toBe(&#x27;updated&#x27;)\n  })\n})\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Memoization\n```typescript\n// components/ExpensiveComponent.tsx\nimport { memo, useMemo, useCallback } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  data: Array&lt;{ id: string; name: string }&gt;\n  onItemClick: (id: string) =&gt; void\n}\n\nexport const ExpensiveComponent = memo(function ExpensiveComponent({\n  data,\n  onItemClick,\n}: Props) {\n  const sortedData = useMemo(\n    () =&gt; [...data].sort((a, b) =&gt; a.name.localeCompare(b.name)),\n    [data]\n  )\n\n  const handleClick = useCallback(\n    (id: string) =&gt; {\n      onItemClick(id)\n    },\n    [onItemClick]\n  )\n\n  return (\n    &lt;ul&gt;\n      {sortedData.map((item) =&gt; (\n        &lt;li key={item.id} onClick={() =&gt; handleClick(item.id)}&gt;\n          {item.name}\n        &lt;/li&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/ul&gt;\n  )\n})\n```\n\n### Code Splitting\n```typescript\n// app/routes.tsx\nimport { lazy, Suspense } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { Routes, Route } from &#x27;react-router-dom&#x27;\nimport { LoadingSpinner } from &#x27;@/components/LoadingSpinner&#x27;\n\nconst Dashboard = lazy(() =&gt; import(&#x27;@/pages/Dashboard&#x27;))\nconst Profile = lazy(() =&gt; import(&#x27;@/pages/Profile&#x27;))\nconst Settings = lazy(() =&gt; import(&#x27;@/pages/Settings&#x27;))\n\nexport function AppRoutes() {\n  return (\n    &lt;Suspense fallback={&lt;LoadingSpinner /&gt;}&gt;\n      &lt;Routes&gt;\n        &lt;Route path=&quot;/&quot; element={&lt;Dashboard /&gt;} /&gt;\n        &lt;Route path=&quot;/profile&quot; element={&lt;Profile /&gt;} /&gt;\n        &lt;Route path=&quot;/settings&quot; element={&lt;Settings /&gt;} /&gt;\n      &lt;/Routes&gt;\n    &lt;/Suspense&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Type Safety\n1.             <div class="prompt-content">
                <div class="prompt-text"># TypeScript React NextUI Supabase Integration Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides a comprehensive approach to building full-stack applications using TypeScript, React, NextUI for UI components, and Supabase for backend services.\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### 1. Initial Setup\n```bash\n# Create new React project with TypeScript\nnpx create-react-app my-app --template typescript\n\n# Navigate to project\ncd my-app\n\n# Install dependencies\nnpm install @nextui-org/react framer-motion @supabase/supabase-js\n```\n\n### 2. Supabase Configuration\n```typescript\n// lib/supabase.ts\nimport { createClient } from &#x27;@supabase/supabase-js&#x27;\nimport { Database } from &#x27;./database.types&#x27;\n\nconst supabaseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL!\nconst supabaseKey = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY!\n\nexport const supabase = createClient&lt;Database&gt;(supabaseUrl, supabaseKey)\n```\n\n### 3. NextUI Setup\n```typescript\n// App.tsx\nimport { NextUIProvider } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\n\nfunction App() {\n  return (\n    &lt;NextUIProvider&gt;\n      {/* Your app content */}\n    &lt;/NextUIProvider&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Authentication\n\n### 1. Auth Context\n```typescript\n// contexts/AuthContext.tsx\nimport { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { User } from &#x27;@supabase/supabase-js&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\ninterface AuthContextType {\n  user: User | null\n  loading: boolean\n  signIn: (email: string, password: string) =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;\n  signOut: () =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;\n}\n\nconst AuthContext = createContext&lt;AuthContextType&gt;({} as AuthContextType)\n\nexport function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {\n  const [user, setUser] = useState&lt;User | null&gt;(null)\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    // Check active sessions and subscribe to auth changes\n    supabase.auth.getSession().then(({ data: { session } }) =&gt; {\n      setUser(session?.user ?? null)\n      setLoading(false)\n    })\n\n    const { data: { subscription } } = supabase.auth.onAuthStateChange(\n      (_event, session) =&gt; {\n        setUser(session?.user ?? null)\n        setLoading(false)\n      }\n    )\n\n    return () =&gt; subscription.unsubscribe()\n  }, [])\n\n  const signIn = async (email: string, password: string) =&gt; {\n    const { error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({\n      email,\n      password,\n    })\n    if (error) throw error\n  }\n\n  const signOut = async () =&gt; {\n    const { error } = await supabase.auth.signOut()\n    if (error) throw error\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, loading, signIn, signOut }}&gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/AuthContext.Provider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport const useAuth = () =&gt; useContext(AuthContext)\n```\n\n### 2. Auth Components\n```typescript\n// components/auth/SignInForm.tsx\nimport { useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { Button, Input } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { useAuth } from &#x27;@/contexts/AuthContext&#x27;\n\nexport function SignInForm() {\n  const { signIn } = useAuth()\n  const [email, setEmail] = useState(&#x27;&#x27;)\n  const [password, setPassword] = useState(&#x27;&#x27;)\n\n  const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault()\n    try {\n      await signIn(email, password)\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Error signing in:&#x27;, error)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit}&gt;\n      &lt;Input\n        type=&quot;email&quot;\n        label=&quot;Email&quot;\n        value={email}\n        onChange={(e) =&gt; setEmail(e.target.value)}\n      /&gt;\n      &lt;Input\n        type=&quot;password&quot;\n        label=&quot;Password&quot;\n        value={password}\n        onChange={(e) =&gt; setPassword(e.target.value)}\n      /&gt;\n      &lt;Button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Sign In&lt;/Button&gt;\n    &lt;/form&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Data Management\n\n### 1. Database Types\n```typescript\n// lib/database.types.ts\nexport interface Database {\n  public: {\n    Tables: {\n      profiles: {\n        Row: {\n          id: string\n          username: string\n          full_name: string\n          avatar_url: string\n          created_at: string\n        }\n        Insert: {\n          id: string\n          username: string\n          full_name?: string\n          avatar_url?: string\n        }\n        Update: {\n          username?: string\n          full_name?: string\n          avatar_url?: string\n        }\n      }\n      posts: {\n        Row: {\n          id: number\n          title: string\n          content: string\n          author_id: string\n          created_at: string\n        }\n        Insert: {\n          title: string\n          content: string\n          author_id: string\n        }\n        Update: {\n          title?: string\n          content?: string\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Data Hooks\n```typescript\n// hooks/useProfiles.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/lib/database.types&#x27;\n\ntype Profile = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;profiles&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\nexport function useProfile(userId: string) {\n  const [profile, setProfile] = useState&lt;Profile | null&gt;(null)\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    async function fetchProfile() {\n      try {\n        const { data, error } = await supabase\n          .from(&#x27;profiles&#x27;)\n          .select(&#x27;*&#x27;)\n          .eq(&#x27;id&#x27;, userId)\n          .single()\n\n        if (error) throw error\n        setProfile(data)\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(&#x27;Error fetching profile:&#x27;, error)\n      } finally {\n        setLoading(false)\n      }\n    }\n\n    fetchProfile()\n  }, [userId])\n\n  return { profile, loading }\n}\n```\n\n## UI Components\n\n### 1. Layout Components\n```typescript\n// components/layout/AppLayout.tsx\nimport { Navbar, Container } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { useAuth } from &#x27;@/contexts/AuthContext&#x27;\n\ninterface AppLayoutProps {\n  children: React.ReactNode\n}\n\nexport function AppLayout({ children }: AppLayoutProps) {\n  const { user, signOut } = useAuth()\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div&gt;\n      &lt;Navbar&gt;\n        &lt;Navbar.Brand&gt;\n          &lt;h1&gt;My App&lt;/h1&gt;\n        &lt;/Navbar.Brand&gt;\n        &lt;Navbar.Content&gt;\n          {user ? (\n            &lt;Navbar.Item&gt;\n              &lt;Button onClick={signOut}&gt;Sign Out&lt;/Button&gt;\n            &lt;/Navbar.Item&gt;\n          ) : (\n            &lt;Navbar.Item&gt;\n              &lt;Button as={Link} href=&quot;/signin&quot;&gt;Sign In&lt;/Button&gt;\n            &lt;/Navbar.Item&gt;\n          )}\n        &lt;/Navbar.Content&gt;\n      &lt;/Navbar&gt;\n      &lt;Container&gt;\n        {children}\n      &lt;/Container&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Data Display Components\n```typescript\n// components/posts/PostCard.tsx\nimport { Card, Text } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/lib/database.types&#x27;\n\ntype Post = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;posts&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\ninterface PostCardProps {\n  post: Post\n}\n\nexport function PostCard({ post }: PostCardProps) {\n  return (\n    &lt;Card&gt;\n      &lt;Card.Header&gt;\n        &lt;Text h3&gt;{post.title}&lt;/Text&gt;\n      &lt;/Card.Header&gt;\n      &lt;Card.Body&gt;\n        &lt;Text&gt;{post.content}&lt;/Text&gt;\n      &lt;/Card.Body&gt;\n      &lt;Card.Footer&gt;\n        &lt;Text small&gt;Posted on {new Date(post.created_at).toLocaleDateString()}&lt;/Text&gt;\n      &lt;/Card.Footer&gt;\n    &lt;/Card&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Real-time Features\n\n### 1. Subscription Setup\n```typescript\n// hooks/useRealtimePosts.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/lib/database.types&#x27;\n\ntype Post = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;posts&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\nexport function useRealtimePosts() {\n  const [posts, setPosts] = useState&lt;Post[]&gt;([])\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    // Fetch initial data\n    fetchPosts()\n\n    // Set up real-time subscription\n    const subscription = supabase\n      .channel(&#x27;public:posts&#x27;)\n      .on(\n        &#x27;postgres_changes&#x27;,\n        {\n          event: &#x27;*&#x27;,\n          schema: &#x27;public&#x27;,\n          table: &#x27;posts&#x27;\n        },\n        (payload) =&gt; {\n          if (payload.eventType === &#x27;INSERT&#x27;) {\n            setPosts((current) =&gt; [...current, payload.new as Post])\n          } else if (payload.eventType === &#x27;UPDATE&#x27;) {\n            setPosts((current) =&gt;\n              current.map((post) =&gt;\n                post.id === payload.new.id ? payload.new as Post : post\n              )\n            )\n          } else if (payload.eventType === &#x27;DELETE&#x27;) {\n            setPosts((current) =&gt;\n              current.filter((post) =&gt; post.id !== payload.old.id)\n            )\n          }\n        }\n      )\n      .subscribe()\n\n    return () =&gt; {\n      subscription.unsubscribe()\n    }\n  }, [])\n\n  async function fetchPosts() {\n    try {\n      setLoading(true)\n      const { data, error } = await supabase\n        .from(&#x27;posts&#x27;)\n        .select(&#x27;*&#x27;)\n        .order(&#x27;created_at&#x27;, { ascending: false })\n\n      if (error) throw error\n      setPosts(data)\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Error fetching posts:&#x27;, error)\n    } finally {\n      setLoading(false)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return { posts, loading }\n}\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### 1. Error Boundary\n```typescript\n// components/ErrorBoundary.tsx\nimport { Component, ErrorInfo, ReactNode } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { Card, Text, Button } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  children: ReactNode\n}\n\ninterface State {\n  hasError: boolean\n  error: Error | null\n}\n\nexport class ErrorBoundary extends Component&lt;Props, State&gt; {\n  public state: State = {\n    hasError: false,\n    error: null\n  }\n\n  public static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error): State {\n    return { hasError: true, error }\n  }\n\n  public componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo) {\n    console.error(&#x27;Uncaught error:&#x27;, error, errorInfo)\n  }\n\n  public render() {\n    if (this.state.hasError) {\n      return (\n        &lt;Card&gt;\n          &lt;Card.Header&gt;\n            &lt;Text h4&gt;Something went wrong&lt;/Text&gt;\n          &lt;/Card.Header&gt;\n          &lt;Card.Body&gt;\n            &lt;Text&gt;{this.state.error?.message}&lt;/Text&gt;\n          &lt;/Card.Body&gt;\n          &lt;Card.Footer&gt;\n            &lt;Button\n              onClick={() =&gt; this.setState({ hasError: false, error: null })}\n            &gt;\n              Try again\n            &lt;/Button&gt;\n          &lt;/Card.Footer&gt;\n        &lt;/Card&gt;\n      )\n    }\n\n    return this.props.children\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Memoization\n```typescript\n// components/posts/PostList.tsx\nimport { memo } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { PostCard } from &#x27;./PostCard&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/lib/database.types&#x27;\n\ntype Post = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;posts&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\ninterface PostListProps {\n  posts: Post[]\n}\n\nexport const PostList = memo(function PostList({ posts }: PostListProps) {\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;grid gap-4&quot;&gt;\n      {posts.map((post) =&gt; (\n        &lt;PostCard key={post.id} post={post} /&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n})\n```\n\n### 2. Query Optimization\n```typescript\n// hooks/usePostsWithAuthors.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/lib/database.types&#x27;\n\ntype Post = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;posts&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\ntype Profile = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;profiles&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\ninterface PostWithAuthor extends Post {\n  author: Profile\n}\n\nexport function usePostsWithAuthors() {\n  const [posts, setPosts] = useState&lt;PostWithAuthor[]&gt;([])\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    async function fetchPosts() {\n      try {\n        const { data, error } = await supabase\n          .from(&#x27;posts&#x27;)\n          .select(`\n            *,\n            author:profiles(*)\n          `)\n          .order(&#x27;created_at&#x27;, { ascending: false })\n\n        if (error) throw error\n        setPosts(data)\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error(&#x27;Error fetching posts:&#x27;, error)\n      } finally {\n        setLoading(false)\n      }\n    }\n\n    fetchPosts()\n  }, [])\n\n  return { posts, loading }\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n1.                 <div class="prompt-text"># NextUI and Supabase Integration Guide\n\n## Core Principles\n- Modern UI components\n- Type-safe backend\n- Real-time features\n- Authentication\n- Database management\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### Environment Configuration\n```typescript\n// .env.local\nNEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your-project-url\nNEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key\n```\n\n### NextUI Setup\n```typescript\n// app/providers.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { NextUIProvider } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { ThemeProvider as NextThemesProvider } from &#x27;next-themes&#x27;\n\nexport function Providers({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {\n  return (\n    &lt;NextUIProvider&gt;\n      &lt;NextThemesProvider attribute=&quot;class&quot; defaultTheme=&quot;system&quot;&gt;\n        {children}\n      &lt;/NextThemesProvider&gt;\n    &lt;/NextUIProvider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\n// app/layout.tsx\nimport { Providers } from &#x27;./providers&#x27;\n\nexport default function RootLayout({\n  children,\n}: {\n  children: React.ReactNode\n}) {\n  return (\n    &lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot; suppressHydrationWarning&gt;\n      &lt;head /&gt;\n      &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;Providers&gt;{children}&lt;/Providers&gt;\n      &lt;/body&gt;\n    &lt;/html&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### Supabase Client\n```typescript\n// lib/supabase.ts\nimport { createClient } from &#x27;@supabase/supabase-js&#x27;\nimport { Database } from &#x27;@/types/supabase&#x27;\n\nconst supabaseUrl = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL!\nconst supabaseKey = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY!\n\nexport const supabase = createClient&lt;Database&gt;(supabaseUrl, supabaseKey)\n\n// types/supabase.ts\nexport type Json =\n  | string\n  | number\n  | boolean\n  | null\n  | { [key: string]: Json | undefined }\n  | Json[]\n\nexport interface Database {\n  public: {\n    Tables: {\n      profiles: {\n        Row: {\n          id: string\n          username: string\n          full_name: string\n          avatar_url: string\n          created_at: string\n        }\n        Insert: {\n          id: string\n          username: string\n          full_name?: string\n          avatar_url?: string\n          created_at?: string\n        }\n        Update: {\n          id?: string\n          username?: string\n          full_name?: string\n          avatar_url?: string\n          created_at?: string\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Authentication\n\n### Auth Components\n```typescript\n// components/auth/SignInForm.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport {\n  Card,\n  CardHeader,\n  CardBody,\n  CardFooter,\n  Input,\n  Button,\n} from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\nexport function SignInForm() {\n  const [email, setEmail] = useState(&#x27;&#x27;)\n  const [password, setPassword] = useState(&#x27;&#x27;)\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)\n\n  const handleSignIn = async (e: React.FormEvent) =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault()\n    setLoading(true)\n\n    try {\n      const { error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({\n        email,\n        password,\n      })\n\n      if (error) throw error\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Error signing in:&#x27;, error)\n    } finally {\n      setLoading(false)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;Card className=&quot;max-w-sm mx-auto&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;CardHeader&gt;\n        &lt;h2 className=&quot;text-2xl font-bold&quot;&gt;Sign In&lt;/h2&gt;\n      &lt;/CardHeader&gt;\n      &lt;CardBody&gt;\n        &lt;form onSubmit={handleSignIn} className=&quot;space-y-4&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;Input\n            type=&quot;email&quot;\n            label=&quot;Email&quot;\n            value={email}\n            onChange={(e) =&gt; setEmail(e.target.value)}\n            required\n          /&gt;\n          &lt;Input\n            type=&quot;password&quot;\n            label=&quot;Password&quot;\n            value={password}\n            onChange={(e) =&gt; setPassword(e.target.value)}\n            required\n          /&gt;\n          &lt;Button\n            type=&quot;submit&quot;\n            color=&quot;primary&quot;\n            isLoading={loading}\n            className=&quot;w-full&quot;\n          &gt;\n            Sign In\n          &lt;/Button&gt;\n        &lt;/form&gt;\n      &lt;/CardBody&gt;\n    &lt;/Card&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### Auth Provider\n```typescript\n// contexts/AuthContext.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport {\n  createContext,\n  useContext,\n  useEffect,\n  useState,\n  type ReactNode,\n} from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { User } from &#x27;@supabase/supabase-js&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\ninterface AuthContextType {\n  user: User | null\n  loading: boolean\n}\n\nconst AuthContext = createContext&lt;AuthContextType&gt;({\n  user: null,\n  loading: true,\n})\n\nexport function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: ReactNode }) {\n  const [user, setUser] = useState&lt;User | null&gt;(null)\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    // Check active sessions\n    supabase.auth.getSession().then(({ data: { session } }) =&gt; {\n      setUser(session?.user ?? null)\n      setLoading(false)\n    })\n\n    // Listen for auth changes\n    const {\n      data: { subscription },\n    } = supabase.auth.onAuthStateChange((_event, session) =&gt; {\n      setUser(session?.user ?? null)\n      setLoading(false)\n    })\n\n    return () =&gt; subscription.unsubscribe()\n  }, [])\n\n  return (\n    &lt;AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, loading }}&gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/AuthContext.Provider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport const useAuth = () =&gt; {\n  const context = useContext(AuthContext)\n  if (context === undefined) {\n    throw new Error(&#x27;useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider&#x27;)\n  }\n  return context\n}\n```\n\n## Database Integration\n\n### Data Hooks\n```typescript\n// hooks/useProfiles.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\nimport type { Database } from &#x27;@/types/supabase&#x27;\n\ntype Profile = Database[&#x27;public&#x27;][&#x27;Tables&#x27;][&#x27;profiles&#x27;][&#x27;Row&#x27;]\n\nexport function useProfiles() {\n  const [profiles, setProfiles] = useState&lt;Profile[]&gt;([])\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n  const [error, setError] = useState&lt;Error | null&gt;(null)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const fetchProfiles = async () =&gt; {\n      try {\n        const { data, error } = await supabase\n          .from(&#x27;profiles&#x27;)\n          .select(&#x27;*&#x27;)\n          .order(&#x27;created_at&#x27;, { ascending: false })\n\n        if (error) throw error\n\n        setProfiles(data)\n      } catch (error) {\n        setError(error as Error)\n      } finally {\n        setLoading(false)\n      }\n    }\n\n    fetchProfiles()\n\n    // Subscribe to changes\n    const subscription = supabase\n      .channel(&#x27;profiles&#x27;)\n      .on(\n        &#x27;postgres_changes&#x27;,\n        {\n          event: &#x27;*&#x27;,\n          schema: &#x27;public&#x27;,\n          table: &#x27;profiles&#x27;,\n        },\n        (payload) =&gt; {\n          console.log(&#x27;Change received!&#x27;, payload)\n          fetchProfiles()\n        }\n      )\n      .subscribe()\n\n    return () =&gt; {\n      subscription.unsubscribe()\n    }\n  }, [])\n\n  return { profiles, loading, error }\n}\n```\n\n### Data Components\n```typescript\n// components/ProfileList.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport {\n  Card,\n  CardBody,\n  Avatar,\n  Spinner,\n} from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { useProfiles } from &#x27;@/hooks/useProfiles&#x27;\n\nexport function ProfileList() {\n  const { profiles, loading, error } = useProfiles()\n\n  if (loading) {\n    return (\n      &lt;div className=&quot;flex justify-center&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;Spinner /&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    )\n  }\n\n  if (error) {\n    return (\n      &lt;div className=&quot;text-center text-red-500&quot;&gt;\n        Error loading profiles: {error.message}\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    )\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;grid gap-4 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3&quot;&gt;\n      {profiles.map((profile) =&gt; (\n        &lt;Card key={profile.id}&gt;\n          &lt;CardBody className=&quot;flex flex-row items-center gap-4&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;Avatar\n              src={profile.avatar_url}\n              name={profile.full_name}\n              size=&quot;lg&quot;\n            /&gt;\n            &lt;div&gt;\n              &lt;h3 className=&quot;text-lg font-semibold&quot;&gt;\n                {profile.full_name}\n              &lt;/h3&gt;\n              &lt;p className=&quot;text-sm text-gray-500&quot;&gt;\n                @{profile.username}\n              &lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n          &lt;/CardBody&gt;\n        &lt;/Card&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## File Storage\n\n### Storage Hooks\n```typescript\n// hooks/useStorage.ts\nimport { useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\nexport function useStorage() {\n  const [uploading, setUploading] = useState(false)\n\n  const uploadFile = async (\n    bucket: string,\n    path: string,\n    file: File\n  ) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      setUploading(true)\n\n      const { error } = await supabase.storage\n        .from(bucket)\n        .upload(path, file)\n\n      if (error) throw error\n\n      return supabase.storage\n        .from(bucket)\n        .getPublicUrl(path)\n        .data.publicUrl\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Error uploading file:&#x27;, error)\n      throw error\n    } finally {\n      setUploading(false)\n    }\n  }\n\n  const deleteFile = async (bucket: string, path: string) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      const { error } = await supabase.storage\n        .from(bucket)\n        .remove([path])\n\n      if (error) throw error\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Error deleting file:&#x27;, error)\n      throw error\n    }\n  }\n\n  return {\n    uploadFile,\n    deleteFile,\n    uploading,\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Upload Component\n```typescript\n// components/FileUpload.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;@nextui-org/react&#x27;\nimport { useStorage } from &#x27;@/hooks/useStorage&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  bucket: string\n  path: string\n  onUpload: (url: string) =&gt; void\n}\n\nexport function FileUpload({ bucket, path, onUpload }: Props) {\n  const { uploadFile, uploading } = useStorage()\n  const [error, setError] = useState&lt;string | null&gt;(null)\n\n  const handleUpload = async (e: React.ChangeEvent&lt;HTMLInputElement&gt;) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      const file = e.target.files?.[0]\n      if (!file) return\n\n      const url = await uploadFile(bucket, path, file)\n      onUpload(url)\n    } catch (error) {\n      setError((error as Error).message)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div&gt;\n      &lt;Button\n        as=&quot;label&quot;\n        color=&quot;primary&quot;\n        isLoading={uploading}\n        className=&quot;cursor-pointer&quot;\n      &gt;\n        {uploading ? &#x27;Uploading...&#x27; : &#x27;Upload File&#x27;}\n        &lt;input\n          type=&quot;file&quot;\n          className=&quot;hidden&quot;\n          onChange={handleUpload}\n          disabled={uploading}\n        /&gt;\n      &lt;/Button&gt;\n      {error &amp;&amp; (\n        &lt;p className=&quot;mt-2 text-sm text-red-500&quot;&gt;{error}&lt;/p&gt;\n      )}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Real-time Features\n\n### Presence\n```typescript\n// hooks/usePresence.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { useAuth } from &#x27;@/contexts/AuthContext&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\ninterface PresenceState {\n  [key: string]: {\n    user_id: string\n    online_at: string\n  }\n}\n\nexport function usePresence() {\n  const { user } = useAuth()\n  const [presence, setPresence] = useState&lt;PresenceState&gt;({})\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    if (!user) return\n\n    const channel = supabase.channel(&#x27;online-users&#x27;)\n\n    channel\n      .on(&#x27;presence&#x27;, { event: &#x27;sync&#x27; }, () =&gt; {\n        const state = channel.presenceState&lt;{\n          user_id: string\n          online_at: string\n        }&gt;()\n        setPresence(state)\n      })\n      .subscribe(async (status) =&gt; {\n        if (status === &#x27;SUBSCRIBED&#x27;) {\n          await channel.track({\n            user_id: user.id,\n            online_at: new Date().toISOString(),\n          })\n        }\n      })\n\n    return () =&gt; {\n      channel.unsubscribe()\n    }\n  }, [user])\n\n  return presence\n}\n```\n\n### Chat Implementation\n```typescript\n// hooks/useChat.ts\nimport { useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { supabase } from &#x27;@/lib/supabase&#x27;\n\ninterface Message {\n  id: string\n  user_id: string\n  content: string\n  created_at: string\n}\n\nexport function useChat(roomId: string) {\n  const [messages, setMessages] = useState&lt;Message[]&gt;([])\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    // Fetch existing messages\n    const fetchMessages = async () =&gt; {\n      const { data, error } = await supabase\n        .from(&#x27;messages&#x27;)\n        .select(&#x27;*&#x27;)\n        .eq(&#x27;room_id&#x27;, roomId)\n        .order(&#x27;created_at&#x27;, { ascending: true })\n\n      if (error) console.error(&#x27;Error fetching messages:&#x27;, error)\n      else setMessages(data || [])\n    }\n\n    fetchMessages()\n\n    // Subscribe to new messages\n    const channel = supabase\n      .channel(`room:${roomId}`)\n      .on(\n        &#x27;postgres_changes&#x27;,\n        {\n          event: &#x27;INSERT&#x27;,\n          schema: &#x27;public&#x27;,\n          table: &#x27;messages&#x27;,\n          filter: `room_id=eq.${roomId}`,\n        },\n        (payload) =&gt; {\n          setMessages((current) =&gt; [...current, payload.new as Message])\n        }\n      )\n      .subscribe()\n\n    return () =&gt; {\n      channel.unsubscribe()\n    }\n  }, [roomId])\n\n  const sendMessage = async (content: string, userId: string) =&gt; {\n    const { error } = await supabase.from(&#x27;messages&#x27;).insert({\n      room_id: roomId,\n      user_id: userId,\n      content,\n    })\n\n    if (error) console.error(&#x27;Error sending message:&#x27;, error)\n  }\n\n  return {\n    messages,\n    sendMessage,\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Type Safety\n1. Reusability patterns\n\n## Setup and Configuration\n\n### Installation\n```bash\n# Using npm\nnpm install styled-components\nnpm install -D @types/styled-components\n\n# Using yarn\nyarn add styled-components\nyarn add -D @types/styled-components\n```\n\n### TypeScript Configuration\n```typescript\n// src/types/styled.d.ts\nimport &#x27;styled-components&#x27;\n\ndeclare module &#x27;styled-components&#x27; {\n  export interface DefaultTheme {\n    colors: {\n      primary: string\n      secondary: string\n      background: string\n      text: string\n      error: string\n    }\n    spacing: {\n      xs: string\n      sm: string\n      md: string\n      lg: string\n      xl: string\n    }\n    breakpoints: {\n      mobile: string\n      tablet: string\n      desktop: &lt;/StyledThemeProvider&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Component Patterns\n\n### Basic Styling\n```typescript\n// src/components/Button/Button.tsx\nimport styled, { css } from &lt;CardTitle&gt;{title}&lt;/CardTitle&gt;\n      &lt;/CardHeader&gt;\n      &lt;CardContent&gt;{children}&lt;/CardContent&gt;\n    &lt;/CardContainer&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### Responsive auto;\n  `)}\n`\n```\n\n## Advanced Patterns\n\n### Global Styles\n```typescript\n// src/styles/GlobalStyles.ts\nimport { createGlobalStyle } from &#x27;styled-components&#x27;\n\nexport const             <div class="prompt-content">
                <div class="prompt-text"># React Components Development Guide\n\n## Core Principles\n- Component architecture\n- Reusability patterns\n- Type safety\n- Performance optimization\n- Testing strategies\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### Directory Structure\n```\nsrc/\n├── components/\n│   ├── common/\n│   │   ├── Button/\n│   │   │   ├── Button.tsx\n│   │   │   ├── Button.test.tsx\n│   │   │   └── Button.module.css\n│   │   └── Input/\n│   │       ├── Input.tsx\n│   │       ├── Input.test.tsx\n│   │       └── Input.module.css\n│   ├── layout/\n│   │   ├── Header/\n│   │   └── Footer/\n│   └── features/\n│       ├── Auth/\n│       └── Dashboard/\n├── hooks/\n│   ├── useForm.ts\n│   └── useAuth.ts\n├── utils/\n│   ├── validation.ts\n│   └── formatting.ts\n└── types/\n    └── index.ts\n```\n\n### Component Template\n```typescript\n// src/components/common/Button/Button.tsx\nimport { forwardRef } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport styles from &#x27;./Button.module.css&#x27;\n\nexport interface ButtonProps\n  extends React.ButtonHTMLAttributes&lt;HTMLButtonElement&gt; {\n  variant?: &#x27;primary&#x27; | &#x27;secondary&#x27; | &#x27;outline&#x27;\n  size?: &#x27;small&#x27; | &#x27;medium&#x27; | &#x27;large&#x27;\n  isLoading?: boolean\n}\n\nexport const Button = forwardRef&lt;HTMLButtonElement, ButtonProps&gt;(\n  (\n    {\n      variant = &#x27;primary&#x27;,\n      size = &#x27;medium&#x27;,\n      isLoading = false,\n      children,\n      className,\n      disabled,\n      ...props\n    },\n    ref\n  ) =&gt; {\n    return (\n      &lt;button\n        ref={ref}\n        className={[\n          styles.button,\n          styles[variant],\n          styles[size],\n          className\n        ].filter(Boolean).join(&#x27; &#x27;)}\n        disabled={disabled || isLoading}\n        {...props}\n      &gt;\n        {isLoading ? (\n          &lt;span className={styles.loader} /&gt;\n        ) : children}\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n    )\n  }\n)\n\nButton.displayName = &#x27;Button&#x27;\n```\n\n## Component Patterns\n\n### Compound Components\n```typescript\n// src/components/common/Select/Select.tsx\nimport {\n  createContext,\n  useContext,\n  useState,\n  type ReactNode\n} from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface SelectContextType {\n  value: string\n  onChange: (value: string) =&gt; void\n  isOpen: boolean\n  setIsOpen: (isOpen: boolean) =&gt; void\n}\n\nconst SelectContext = createContext&lt;SelectContextType | null&gt;(null)\n\ninterface SelectProps {\n  value: string\n  onChange: (value: string) =&gt; void\n  children: ReactNode\n}\n\nexport function Select({ value, onChange, children }: SelectProps) {\n  const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false)\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;SelectContext.Provider\n      value={{ value, onChange, isOpen, setIsOpen }}\n    &gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;select&quot;&gt;{children}&lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/SelectContext.Provider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\ninterface TriggerProps {\n  children: ReactNode\n}\n\nSelect.Trigger = function Trigger({ children }: TriggerProps) {\n  const context = useContext(SelectContext)\n  if (!context) throw new Error(&#x27;Must be used within Select&#x27;)\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;button\n      onClick={() =&gt; context.setIsOpen(!context.isOpen)}\n      className=&quot;select-trigger&quot;\n    &gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/button&gt;\n  )\n}\n\ninterface OptionProps {\n  value: string\n  children: ReactNode\n}\n\nSelect.Option = function Option({ value, children }: OptionProps) {\n  const context = useContext(SelectContext)\n  if (!context) throw new Error(&#x27;Must be used within Select&#x27;)\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div\n      onClick={() =&gt; {\n        context.onChange(value)\n        context.setIsOpen(false)\n      }}\n      className=&quot;select-option&quot;\n    &gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### Render Props\n```typescript\n// src/components/common/List/List.tsx\nimport { type ReactNode } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface Item {\n  id: string\n  [key: string]: any\n}\n\ninterface ListProps&lt;T extends Item&gt; {\n  items: T[]\n  renderItem: (item: T) =&gt; ReactNode\n  keyExtractor?: (item: T) =&gt; string\n}\n\nexport function List&lt;T extends Item&gt;({\n  items,\n  renderItem,\n  keyExtractor = (item) =&gt; item.id\n}: ListProps&lt;T&gt;) {\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;list&quot;&gt;\n      {items.map((item) =&gt; (\n        &lt;div key={keyExtractor(item)} className=&quot;list-item&quot;&gt;\n          {renderItem(item)}\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Custom Hooks\n\n### Form Management\n```typescript\n// src/hooks/useForm.ts\nimport { useState, useCallback } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface FormState {\n  [key: string]: any\n}\n\ninterface ValidationRules {\n  [key: string]: (value: any) =&gt; string | undefined\n}\n\ninterface UseFormOptions {\n  initialValues: FormState\n  validationRules?: ValidationRules\n  onSubmit: (values: FormState) =&gt; void | Promise&lt;void&gt;\n}\n\nexport function useForm({\n  initialValues,\n  validationRules = {},\n  onSubmit\n}: UseFormOptions) {\n  const [values, setValues] = useState(initialValues)\n  const [errors, setErrors] = useState&lt;FormState&gt;({})\n  const [isSubmitting, setIsSubmitting] = useState(false)\n  \n  const validateField = useCallback(\n    (name: string, value: any) =&gt; {\n      const validate = validationRules[name]\n      if (!validate) return undefined\n      return validate(value)\n    },\n    [validationRules]\n  )\n  \n  const handleChange = useCallback(\n    (event: React.ChangeEvent&lt;HTMLInputElement&gt;) =&gt; {\n      const { name, value } = event.target\n      setValues((prev) =&gt; ({ ...prev, [name]: value }))\n      \n      const error = validateField(name, value)\n      setErrors((prev) =&gt; ({\n        ...prev,\n        [name]: error\n      }))\n    },\n    [validateField]\n  )\n  \n  const handleSubmit = useCallback(\n    async (event: React.FormEvent) =&gt; {\n      event.preventDefault()\n      \n      const newErrors: FormState = {}\n      Object.keys(values).forEach((key) =&gt; {\n        const error = validateField(key, values[key])\n        if (error) newErrors[key] = error\n      })\n      \n      if (Object.keys(newErrors).length &gt; 0) {\n        setErrors(newErrors)\n        return\n      }\n      \n      setIsSubmitting(true)\n      try {\n        await onSubmit(values)\n      } finally {\n        setIsSubmitting(false)\n      }\n    },\n    [values, validateField, onSubmit]\n  )\n  \n  return {\n    values,\n    errors,\n    isSubmitting,\n    handleChange,\n    handleSubmit\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Data Fetching\n```typescript\n// src/hooks/useQuery.ts\nimport { useState, useEffect } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface QueryOptions&lt;T&gt; {\n  queryFn: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;\n  initialData?: T\n  onSuccess?: (data: T) =&gt; void\n  onError?: (error: Error) =&gt; void\n}\n\nexport function useQuery&lt;T&gt;({\n  queryFn,\n  initialData,\n  onSuccess,\n  onError\n}: QueryOptions&lt;T&gt;) {\n  const [data, setData] = useState&lt;T | undefined&gt;(initialData)\n  const [error, setError] = useState&lt;Error | null&gt;(null)\n  const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(true)\n  \n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    let isMounted = true\n    \n    async function fetchData() {\n      try {\n        const result = await queryFn()\n        if (isMounted) {\n          setData(result)\n          onSuccess?.(result)\n        }\n      } catch (err) {\n        if (isMounted) {\n          const error = err instanceof Error ? err : new Error(String(err))\n          setError(error)\n          onError?.(error)\n        }\n      } finally {\n        if (isMounted) {\n          setIsLoading(false)\n        }\n      }\n    }\n    \n    fetchData()\n    \n    return () =&gt; {\n      isMounted = false\n    }\n  }, [queryFn, onSuccess, onError])\n  \n  return { data, error, isLoading }\n}\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### Component Testing\n```typescript\n// src/components/common/Button/Button.test.tsx\nimport { render, screen, fireEvent } from &#x27;@testing-library/react&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;./Button&#x27;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;Button&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  it(&#x27;renders children correctly&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    render(&lt;Button&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    expect(screen.getByText(&#x27;Click me&#x27;)).toBeInTheDocument()\n  })\n  \n  it(&#x27;handles click events&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const handleClick = jest.fn()\n    render(&lt;Button onClick={handleClick}&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    \n    fireEvent.click(screen.getByText(&#x27;Click me&#x27;))\n    expect(handleClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1)\n  })\n  \n  it(&#x27;shows loading state&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    render(&lt;Button isLoading&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    expect(screen.queryByText(&#x27;Click me&#x27;)).not.toBeInTheDocument()\n    expect(screen.getByRole(&#x27;button&#x27;)).toBeDisabled()\n  })\n  \n  it(&#x27;applies variant classes correctly&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const { container } = render(\n      &lt;Button variant=&quot;secondary&quot;&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;\n    )\n    expect(container.firstChild).toHaveClass(&#x27;secondary&#x27;)\n  })\n})\n```\n\n### Hook Testing\n```typescript\n// src/hooks/useForm.test.ts\nimport { renderHook, act } from &#x27;@testing-library/react&#x27;\nimport { useForm } from &#x27;./useForm&#x27;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;useForm&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  const initialValues = { email: &#x27;&#x27;, password: &#x27;&#x27; }\n  const validationRules = {\n    email: (value: string) =&gt;\n      !value.includes(&#x27;@&#x27;) ? &#x27;Invalid email&#x27; : undefined,\n    password: (value: string) =&gt;\n      value.length &lt; 6 ? &#x27;Password too short&#x27; : undefined\n  }\n  \n  it(&#x27;initializes with initial values&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const { result } = renderHook(() =&gt;\n      useForm({\n        initialValues,\n        validationRules,\n        onSubmit: jest.fn()\n      })\n    )\n    \n    expect(result.current.values).toEqual(initialValues)\n  })\n  \n  it(&#x27;updates values on change&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const { result } = renderHook(() =&gt;\n      useForm({\n        initialValues,\n        validationRules,\n        onSubmit: jest.fn()\n      })\n    )\n    \n    act(() =&gt; {\n      result.current.handleChange({\n        target: { name: &#x27;email&#x27;, value: &#x27;test@example.com&#x27;                 <div class="prompt-text"># Linux NVIDIA CUDA Python Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides detailed instructions for setting up and using NVIDIA CUDA with Python on Linux systems, enabling GPU acceleration for deep learning and scientific computing applications.\n\n## Prerequisites\n\n### 1. System Requirements\n```bash\n# Check GPU compatibility\nlspci | grep -i nvidia\n\n# Check Linux distribution\ncat /etc/os-release\n\n# Check kernel version\nuname -r\n```\n\n### 2. NVIDIA Driver Installation\n```bash\n# Add NVIDIA repository\nsudo add-apt-repository ppa:graphics-drivers/ppa\nsudo apt update\n\n# Install NVIDIA driver\nsudo apt install nvidia-driver-535  # Replace with latest version\nsudo reboot\n\n# Verify installation\nnvidia-smi\n```\n\n## CUDA Installation\n\n### 1. CUDA Toolkit\n```bash\n# Download CUDA installer\nwget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/12.3.0/local_installers/cuda_12.3.0_545.23.06_linux.run\n\n# Make installer executable\nchmod +x cuda_12.3.0_545.23.06_linux.run\n\n# Run installer\nsudo ./cuda_12.3.0_545.23.06_linux.run\n```\n\n### 2. Environment Setup\n```bash\n# Add CUDA paths to ~/.bashrc\necho &#x27;export PATH=/usr/local/cuda/bin:$PATH&#x27; &gt;&gt; ~/.bashrc\necho &#x27;export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH&#x27; &gt;&gt; ~/.bashrc\nsource ~/.bashrc\n\n# Verify CUDA installation\nnvcc --version\n```\n\n## Python Environment Setup\n\n### 1. Conda Environment\n```bash\n# Create conda environment\nconda create -n cuda-env python=3.10\nconda activate cuda-env\n\n# Install CUDA toolkit\nconda install cudatoolkit cudnn\n```\n\n### 2. PyTorch Installation\n```bash\n# Install PyTorch with CUDA support\npip3 install torch torchvision torchaudio --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121\n```\n\n## Basic CUDA Operations\n\n### 1. CUDA Device Information\n```python\nimport torch\n\ndef print_cuda_info():\n    print(f&quot;CUDA available: {torch.cuda.is_available()}&quot;)\n    print(f&quot;CUDA device count: {torch.cuda.device_count()}&quot;)\n    print(f&quot;Current CUDA device: {torch.cuda.current_device()}&quot;)\n    print(f&quot;CUDA device name: {torch.cuda.get_device_name(0)}&quot;)\n\nprint_cuda_info()\n```\n\n### 2. Basic Tensor Operations\n```python\nimport torch\n\n# Create tensor on GPU\ndevice = torch.device(&quot;cuda&quot; if torch.cuda.is_available() else &quot;cpu&quot;)\nx = torch.randn(1000, 1000).to(device)\ny = torch.randn(1000, 1000).to(device)\n\n# Perform operations\nz = torch.matmul(x, y)\nprint(f&quot;Result shape: {z.shape}&quot;)\nprint(f&quot;Device: {z.device}&quot;)\n```\n\n## Deep Learning Example\n\n### 1. Simple Neural Network\n```python\nimport torch\nimport torch.nn as nn\nimport torch.optim as optim\n\nclass SimpleNet(nn.Module):\n    def __init__(self):\n        super(SimpleNet, self).__init__()\n        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(784, 128)\n        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(128, 10)\n        self.relu = nn.ReLU()\n        \n    def forward(self, x):\n        x = self.relu(self.fc1(x))\n        x = self.fc2(x)\n        return x\n\n# Create model and move to GPU\ndevice = torch.device(&quot;cuda&quot; if torch.cuda.is_available() else &quot;cpu&quot;)\nmodel = SimpleNet().to(device)\ncriterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()\noptimizer = optim.Adam(model.parameters())\n\n# Training loop example\ndef train(model, data, labels):\n    model.train()\n    data, labels = data.to(device), labels.to(device)\n    \n    optimizer.zero_grad()\n    output = model(data)\n    loss = criterion(output, labels)\n    loss.backward()\n    optimizer.step()\n    \n    return loss.item()\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Memory Management\n```python\nimport torch\n\ndef optimize_memory():\n    # Clear GPU cache\n    torch.cuda.empty_cache()\n    \n    # Get memory statistics\n    print(torch.cuda.memory_summary())\n    \n    # Use memory pinning for faster host-to-device transfer\n    pinned_data = torch.tensor([1, 2, 3]).pin_memory()\n    pinned_data = pinned_data.to(device, non_blocking=True)\n\n# Example of batch processing\ndef process_in_batches(data, batch_size=32):\n    for i in range(0, len(data), batch_size):\n        batch = data[i:i+batch_size].to(device)\n        # Process batch\n        torch.cuda.empty_cache()\n```\n\n### 2. Multi-GPU Training\n```python\nimport torch.nn as nn\n\nclass ParallelModel(nn.Module):\n    def __init__(self):\n        super(ParallelModel, self).__init__()\n        self.model = SimpleNet()\n        if torch.cuda.device_count() &gt; 1:\n            self.model = nn.DataParallel(self.model)\n        self.model.to(device)\n    \n    def forward(self, x):\n        return self.model(x)\n```\n\n## Debugging and Profiling\n\n### 1. CUDA Error Handling\n```python\nimport torch\n\ndef cuda_error_handling():\n    try:\n        # CUDA operation\n        result = torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1000, 1000)\n    except RuntimeError as e:\n        print(f&quot;CUDA error: {e}&quot;)\n    finally:\n        # Clean up\n        torch.cuda.empty_cache()\n```\n\n### 2. Performance Profiling\n```python\nfrom torch.profiler import profile, record_function, ProfilerActivity\n\ndef profile_model(model, input_data):\n    with profile(activities=[ProfilerActivity.CPU, ProfilerActivity.CUDA],\n                profile_memory=True, record_shapes=True) as prof:\n        with record_function(&quot;model_inference&quot;):\n            model(input_data)\n    \n    print(prof.key_averages().table(sort_by=&quot;cuda_time_total&quot;))\n```\n\n## Common Issues and Solutions\n\n1. Out of Memory Errors\n   - Reduce batch size\n   - Use gradient checkpointing\n   - Implement proper memory cleanup\n\n2. CUDA Version Mismatch\n   - Check compatibility matrix\n   - Use correct PyTorch wheels\n   - Verify driver versions\n\n3. Performance Issues\n   - Monitor GPU utilization\n   - Optimize data transfers\n   - Use appropriate batch sizes\n\n## Best Practices\n\n1. Development Guidelines\n   - Always check CUDA availability\n   - Use proper error handling\n   - Implement memory management\n   - Profile performance regularly\n\n2. Production Deployment\n   - Version control CUDA dependencies\n   - Monitor GPU usage\n   - Implement proper logging\n   - Use appropriate container solutions\n\nRemember to regularly update drivers and CUDA toolkit for optimal performance and compatibility.</div>

                <div class="prompt-text"># HTMX Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides best practices and patterns for modern web development using HTMX, a powerful library that allows you to access modern browser features directly from HTML, rather than using JavaScript.\n\n## Core Technologies\n- HTMX (latest version)\n- HTML5 with semantic markup\n- Server-side templating (Jinja2, Handlebars)\n- CSS for styling\n- Optional JavaScript for enhancements\n\n## Project Structure\n```\nsrc/\n  templates/          # Server-side templates\n    layouts/          # Base templates and layouts\n    components/       # Reusable HTMX components\n    pages/           # Page-specific templates\n  static/\n    css/             # Stylesheets\n    js/              # Optional JavaScript enhancements\n    htmx/            # HTMX extensions\n  app.py             # Server application\n```\n\n## HTMX Best Practices\n\n### Basic Attributes\n```html\n&lt;!-- GET Request Example --&gt;\n&lt;button hx-get=&quot;/api/data&quot;\n        hx-target=&quot;#result&quot;\n        hx-swap=&quot;outerHTML&quot;\n        hx-trigger=&quot;click&quot;&gt;\n  Load Data\n&lt;/button&gt;\n\n&lt;!-- POST Request Example --&gt;\n&lt;form hx-post=&quot;/api/submit&quot;\n      hx-target=&quot;#response&quot;\n      hx-swap=&quot;innerHTML&quot;\n      hx-indicator=&quot;#loading&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;username&quot; required&gt;\n  &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Submit&lt;/button&gt;\n  &lt;div id=&quot;loading&quot; class=&quot;htmx-indicator&quot;&gt;Loading...&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n```\n\n### CSRF Protection\n```html\n&lt;!-- Add CSRF Token to Headers --&gt;\n&lt;meta name=&quot;csrf-token&quot; content=&quot;{{ csrf_token }}&quot;&gt;\n&lt;script&gt;\n  document.body.addEventListener(&#x27;htmx:configRequest&#x27;, function(evt) {\n    evt.detail.headers[&#x27;X-CSRF-Token&#x27;] = document.querySelector(&#x27;meta[name=&quot;csrf-token&quot;]&#x27;).content;\n  });\n&lt;/script&gt;\n```\n\n### Loading States\n```html\n&lt;!-- Using Indicators --&gt;\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/data&quot;\n     hx-trigger=&quot;load&quot;\n     hx-indicator=&quot;#spinner&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div id=&quot;spinner&quot; class=&quot;htmx-indicator&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;spinner&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;style&gt;\n.htmx-indicator {\n  display: none;\n}\n.htmx-request .htmx-indicator {\n  display: block;\n}\n.htmx-request.htmx-indicator {\n  display: block;\n}\n&lt;/style&gt;\n```\n\n### Progressive Enhancement\n```html\n&lt;!-- Basic Form with Progressive Enhancement --&gt;\n&lt;form action=&quot;/submit&quot; method=&quot;post&quot;\n      hx-post=&quot;/submit&quot;\n      hx-target=&quot;#response&quot;\n      hx-swap=&quot;outerHTML&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;!-- Works without JavaScript --&gt;\n  &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;query&quot; required&gt;\n  &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Search&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n&lt;!-- Enhanced Navigation --&gt;\n&lt;a href=&quot;/page&quot;\n   hx-get=&quot;/page&quot;\n   hx-push-url=&quot;true&quot;\n   hx-target=&quot;body&quot;&gt;\n  Navigate with HTMX\n&lt;/a&gt;\n```\n\n### Server-Side Integration (Python/Flask Example)\n```python\nfrom flask import Flask, render_template, request\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route(&#x27;/api/data&#x27;)\ndef get_data():\n    # Check if request is HTMX\n    is_htmx = request.headers.get(&#x27;HX-Request&#x27;) == &#x27;true&#x27;\n    \n    if is_htmx:\n        # Return partial template for HTMX request\n        return render_template(&#x27;partials/data.html&#x27;, data=data)\n    \n    # Return full page for regular request\n    return render_template(&#x27;pages/data.html&#x27;, data=data)\n```\n\n### Error Handling\n```html\n&lt;!-- Client-side Error Handling --&gt;\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/data&quot;\n     hx-trigger=&quot;load&quot;\n     hx-target=&quot;#content&quot;\n     hx-error-target=&quot;#error&quot;\n     hx-on::after-request=&quot;handleError(event)&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div id=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;div id=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\nfunction handleError(event) {\n  if (event.detail.failed) {\n    console.error(&#x27;Request failed:&#x27;, event.detail.error);\n  }\n}\n&lt;/script&gt;\n```\n\n## HTMX Extensions\n\n### Using Extensions\n```html\n&lt;!-- Include Extension --&gt;\n&lt;script src=&quot;/static/htmx/ext/json-enc.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n\n&lt;!-- Use Extension in Element --&gt;\n&lt;form hx-post=&quot;/api/submit&quot;\n      hx-ext=&quot;json-enc&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;data&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Submit as JSON&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n```\n\n### Common Extensions\n1. `json-enc` - JSON encoding of form data\n2. `loading-states` - Advanced loading state management\n3. `morphdom-swap` - Enhanced content swapping\n4. `client-side-templates` - Client-side templating\n5. `path-deps` - Path-based dependencies\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Request Optimization\n```html\n&lt;!-- Debounce Input --&gt;\n&lt;input type=&quot;text&quot;\n       name=&quot;search&quot;\n       hx-get=&quot;/api/search&quot;\n       hx-trigger=&quot;keyup changed delay:500ms&quot;\n       hx-target=&quot;#search-results&quot;&gt;\n\n&lt;!-- Cache GET Requests --&gt;\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/data&quot;\n     hx-trigger=&quot;load&quot;\n     hx-target=&quot;#content&quot;\n     hx-cache=&quot;true&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n### Content Swapping\n```html\n&lt;!-- Efficient Content Updates --&gt;\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/updates&quot;\n     hx-trigger=&quot;every 10s&quot;\n     hx-target=&quot;find .content&quot;\n     hx-select=&quot;.updated-content&quot;\n     hx-swap=&quot;outerHTML&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;!-- Content to be updated --&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [HTMX Documentation](https://htmx.org/docs/)\n- [HTMX Examples](https://htmx.org/examples/)\n- [HTMX Extensions](https://htmx.org/extensions/)\n- [HTMX Server-Side Integration](https://htmx.org/server-side/)\n- [HTMX Discord Community](https://htmx.org/discord)</div>

Basic Go Server Setup\n```go\npackage main\n\nimport (\n    &quot;html/template&quot;\n    &quot;log&quot;\n    &quot;net/http&quot;\n)\n\nfunc main() {\n    mux := http.NewServeMux()\n    \n    // Serve static files\n    fs := http.FileServer(http.Dir(&quot;static&quot;))\n    mux.Handle(&quot;/static/&quot;, http.StripPrefix(&quot;/static/&quot;, fs))\n    \n    // Setup routes\n    mux.HandleFunc(&quot;/&quot;, handleHome)\n    \n    log.Fatal(http.ListenAndServe(&quot;:8080&quot;, mux))\n}\n```\n\n## Common Patterns\n\n### 1. Partial Template Rendering\n```go\nfunc handlePartial(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n    tmpl := template.Must(template.ParseFiles(&quot;templates/partial.html&quot;))\n    data := map[string]interface{}{\n        &quot;Items&quot;: []string{&quot;Item 1&quot;, &quot;Item 2&quot;, &quot;Item 3&quot;},\n    }\n    tmpl.Execute(w, data)\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Form Handling\n```go\nfunc handleForm(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n    if r.Method != &quot;POST&quot; {\n        http.Error(w, &quot;Method not allowed&quot;, http.StatusMethodNotAllowed)\n        return\n    }\n    \n    // Parse form\n    err := r.ParseForm()\n    if err != nil {\n        http.Error(w, &quot;Error parsing form&quot;, http.StatusBadRequest)\n        return\n    }\n    \n    // Process form data\n    name := r.FormValue(&quot;name&quot;)\n    \n    // Return partial template\n    tmpl := template.Must(template.ParseFiles(&quot;templates/response.html&quot;))\n    tmpl.Execute(w, map[string]string{&quot;name&quot;: name})\n}\n```\n\n### 3. Dynamic Content Loading\n```go\nfunc handleDynamicContent(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n    // Add HTMX-specific headers\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;HX-Trigger&quot;, &quot;contentLoaded&quot;)\n    \n    tmpl := template.Must(template.ParseFiles(&quot;templates/dynamic.html&quot;))\n    data := fetchDynamicData()\n    tmpl.Execute(w, data)\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1. Response Headers\n```go\n// Helper function for HTMX responses\nfunc htmxResponse(w http.ResponseWriter) {\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;Content-Type&quot;, &quot;text/html; charset=utf-8&quot;)\n    // Optional HTMX-specific headers\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;HX-Push-Url&quot;, &quot;false&quot;)\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Error Handling\n```go\nfunc handleWithHTMXError(w http.ResponseWriter, err error) {\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;HX-Retarget&quot;, &quot;#error-message&quot;)\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;HX-Reswap&quot;, &quot;innerHTML&quot;)\n    w.WriteHeader(http.StatusBadRequest)\n    tmpl := template.Must(template.ParseFiles(&quot;templates/error.html&quot;))\n    tmpl.Execute(w, map[string]string{&quot;error&quot;: err.Error()})\n}\n```\n\n### 3. Server-Sent Events\n```go\nfunc handleSSE(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n    // Set headers for SSE\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;Content-Type&quot;, &quot;text/event-stream&quot;)\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;Cache-Control&quot;, &quot;no-cache&quot;)\n    w.Header().Set(&quot;Connection&quot;, &quot;keep-alive&quot;)\n    \n    // Send events\n    for {\n        fmt.Fprintf(w, &quot;data: %s\n\n&quot;, time.Now().String())\n        w.(http.Flusher).Flush()\n        time.Sleep(1 * time.Second)\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### 2. WebSocket Integration\n```go\nfunc handleWebSocket(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n    upgrader := websocket.Upgrader{\n        ReadBufferSize:  1024,\n        WriteBufferSize: 1024,\n    }\n    \n    conn, err := upgrader.Upgrade(w, r, nil)\n    if err != nil {\n        log.Println(err)\n        return\n    }\n    defer conn.Close()\n    \n    // Handle WebSocket communication\n}\n```\n\n## Security Considerations\n\n1. CSRF Protection\n```go\nfunc csrfMiddleware(next http.HandlerFunc) http.HandlerFunc {\n    return func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n        // Verify CSRF token\n        if !verifyCSRFToken(r) {\n            http.Error(w, &quot;Invalid CSRF token&quot;, http.StatusForbidden)\n            return\n        }\n        next(w, r)\n    }\n}\n```\n\n2. Input Validation\n```go\nfunc validateInput(input string) error {\n    if len(input) &gt; 100 {\n        return errors.New(&quot;input too long&quot;)\n    }\n    // Add more validation rules\n    return nil\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n1. Template Caching\n```go\nvar templates = template.Must(template.ParseGlob(&quot;templates/*.html&quot;))\n\nfunc renderTemplate(w http.ResponseWriter, name string, data interface{}) {\n    templates.ExecuteTemplate(w, name, data)\n}\n```\n\n2. Response Compression\n```go\nfunc compressionMiddleware(next http.Handler) http.Handler {\n    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n        if strings.Contains(r.Header.Get(&quot;Accept-Encoding&quot;), &quot;gzip&quot;) {\n            gz := gzip.NewWriter(w)\n            defer gz.Close()\n            w.Header().Set(&quot;Content-Encoding&quot;, &quot;gzip&quot;)\n            next.ServeHTTP(gzipResponseWriter{ResponseWriter: w, Writer: gz}, r)\n            return\n        }\n        next.ServeHTTP(w, r)\n    })\n}\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n1. HTMX Attributes\n- `hx-get`: Make GET request\n- `hx-post`: Make POST request\n- `hx-put`: Make PUT request\n- `hx-delete`: Make DELETE request\n- `hx-trigger`: Define when to trigger the request\n- `hx-target`: Where to place the response\n- `hx-swap`: How to swap the response\n\n### 2. Basic Setup\n```html\n&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;script src=&quot;https://unpkg.com/htmx.org@1.9.10&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n&lt;body&gt;\n    &lt;!-- Your HTMX-enhanced HTML here --&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n```\n\n### 3. Common Patterns\n\n#### Simple Button Click\n```html\n&lt;button hx-post=&quot;/api/action&quot; \n        hx-trigger=&quot;click&quot;\n        hx-target=&quot;#result&quot;&gt;\n    Click Me\n&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;div id=&quot;result&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n#### Form Submission\n```html\n&lt;form hx-post=&quot;/api/submit&quot; \n      hx-target=&quot;#response&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;username&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Submit&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n&lt;div id=&quot;response&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n#### Dynamic Loading\n```html\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/data&quot; \n     hx-trigger=&quot;load&quot;\n     hx-swap=&quot;outerHTML&quot;&gt;\n    Loading...\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n1. Progressive Enhancement\n   - Always provide fallback behavior for non-JavaScript environments\n   - Use semantic HTML elements\n   - Ensure core functionality works without HTMX\n\n2. Performance Optimization\n   - Use appropriate swap strategies\n   - Implement proper caching headers\n   - Minimize payload size\n\n3. Error Handling\n   - Implement proper error responses\n   - Provide user feedback\n   - Handle network failures gracefully\n\n4. Security Considerations\n   - Validate all inputs server-side\n   - Implement CSRF protection\n   - Use appropriate Content Security Policy\n\n## Common Use Cases\n\n1. Infinite Scroll\n```html\n&lt;div hx-get=&quot;/api/more&quot; \n     hx-trigger=&quot;revealed&quot;\n     hx-swap=&quot;beforeend&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;!-- Content --&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n2. Live Search\n```html\n&lt;input type=&quot;search&quot; \n       name=&quot;q&quot; \n       hx-get=&quot;/api/search&quot; \n       hx-trigger=&quot;keyup changed delay:500ms&quot;\n       hx-target=&quot;#search-results&quot;&gt;\n&lt;div id=&quot;search-results&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n3.                 <div class="prompt-text"># Data Analysis with Pandas and scikit-learn Guide\n\n## Overview\n\nThis guide provides a comprehensive framework for data analysis and machine learning using Python&#x27;s Pandas and scikit-learn libraries. It focuses on best practices, performance optimization, and effective visualization techniques.\n\n## Core Technologies\n\n- Python 3.10+\n- Pandas\n- scikit-learn\n- NumPy\n- Matplotlib\n- Seaborn\n- Jupyter Notebooks\n\n## Project Structure\n\n```bash\nproject_root/\n├── notebooks/\n│   ├── exploratory/\n│   │   ├── data_exploration.ipynb\n│   │   └── feature_analysis.ipynb\n│   └── modeling/\n│       ├── model_training.ipynb\n│       └── model_evaluation.ipynb\n├── src/\n│   ├── __init__.py\n│   ├── data/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   ├── loader.py\n│   │   └── preprocessor.py\n│   ├── features/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   └── engineering.py\n│   ├── visualization/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   └── plots.py\n│   └── models/\n│       ├── __init__.py\n│       └── trainer.py\n├── data/\n│   ├── raw/\n│   ├── processed/\n│   └── models/\n├── requirements.txt\n└── README.md\n```\n\n## Data Analysis Best Practices\n\n### 1. Data Loading and Exploration\n\n```python\n# src/data/loader.py\nimport pandas as pd\nimport numpy as np\n\nclass DataLoader:\n    def __init__(self, filepath):\n        self.filepath = filepath\n        \n    def load_data(self):\n        try:\n            # Load data with appropriate data types\n            df = pd.read_csv(\n                self.filepath,\n                dtype={\n                    &#x27;categorical_col&#x27;: &#x27;category&#x27;,\n                    &#x27;numeric_col&#x27;: np.float32\n                }\n            )\n            return df\n        except Exception as e:\n            raise Exception(f&quot;Failed to load data: {str(e)}&quot;)\n            \n    def get_summary_stats(self, df):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Generate comprehensive summary statistics.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        summary = {\n            &#x27;basic_stats&#x27;: df.describe(),\n            &#x27;missing_values&#x27;: df.isnull().sum(),\n            &#x27;data_types&#x27;: df.dtypes,\n            &#x27;memory_usage&#x27;: df.memory_usage(deep=True)\n        }\n        return summary\n```\n\n### 2. Data Preprocessing\n\n```python\n# src/data/preprocessor.py\nfrom sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder\nimport pandas as pd\n\nclass DataPreprocessor:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.scalers = {}\n        self.encoders = {}\n        \n    def handle_missing_values(self, df, strategy=&#x27;mean&#x27;):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Handle missing values with specified strategy.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        if strategy == &#x27;mean&#x27;:\n            return df.fillna(df.mean())\n        elif strategy == &#x27;median&#x27;:\n            return df.fillna(df.median())\n        elif strategy == &#x27;mode&#x27;:\n            return df.fillna(df.mode().iloc[0])\n        else:\n            return df.dropna()\n            \n    def scale_features(self, df, columns):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Scale numerical features.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        for col in columns:\n            if col not in self.scalers:\n                self.scalers[col] = StandardScaler()\n                df[col] = self.scalers[col].fit_transform(df[[col]])\n            else:\n                df[col] = self.scalers[col].transform(df[[col]])\n        return df\n```\n\n### 3. Feature Engineering\n\n```python\n# src/features/engineering.py\nimport pandas as pd\nimport numpy as np\n\ndef create_date_features(df, date_column):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Extract useful features from date columns.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    df[f&#x27;{date_column}_year&#x27;] = df[date_column].dt.year\n    df[f&#x27;{date_column}_month&#x27;] = df[date_column].dt.month\n    df[f&#x27;{date_column}_day&#x27;] = df[date_column].dt.day\n    df[f&#x27;{date_column}_dayofweek&#x27;] = df[date_column].dt.dayofweek\n    return df\n\ndef create_interaction_features(df, col1, col2, operation=&#x27;multiply&#x27;):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Create interaction features between columns.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    if operation == &#x27;multiply&#x27;:\n        df[f&#x27;{col1}_{col2}_interaction&#x27;] = df[col1] * df[col2]\n    elif operation == &#x27;divide&#x27;:\n        df[f&#x27;{col1}_{col2}_ratio&#x27;] = df[col1] / df[col2]\n    return df\n```\n\n### 4. Visualization\n\n```python\n# src/visualization/plots.py\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\nimport seaborn as sns\n\ndef set_plotting_style():\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Set consistent plotting style.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    plt.style.use(&#x27;seaborn&#x27;)\n    sns.set_palette(&#x27;husl&#x27;)\n    plt.rcParams[&#x27;figure.figsize&#x27;] = (10, 6)\n    plt.rcParams[&#x27;font.size&#x27;] = 12\n\ndef plot_correlation_matrix(df, figsize=(12, 8)):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Plot correlation matrix with proper styling.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    plt.figure(figsize=figsize)\n    sns.heatmap(\n        df.corr(),\n        annot=True,\n        cmap=&#x27;coolwarm&#x27;,\n        center=0,\n        fmt=&#x27;.2f&#x27;\n    )\n    plt.title(&#x27;Feature Correlation Matrix&#x27;)\n    return plt.gcf()\n\ndef plot_feature_importance(importance, features, title=&#x27;Feature Importance&#x27;):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Plot feature importance from model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))\n    sns.barplot(x=importance, y=features)\n    plt.title(title)\n    plt.xlabel(&#x27;Importance Score&#x27;)\n    plt.ylabel(&#x27;Features&#x27;)\n    return plt.gcf()\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Memory Efficiency\n\n```python\ndef optimize_dataframe_memory(df):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Optimize DataFrame memory usage by adjusting data types.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    numerics = [&#x27;int16&#x27;, &#x27;int32&#x27;, &#x27;int64&#x27;, &#x27;float16&#x27;, &#x27;float32&#x27;, &#x27;float64&#x27;]\n    \n    for col in df.select_dtypes(include=numerics).columns:\n        col_type = df[col].dtype\n        \n        if col_type in [&#x27;int64&#x27;, &#x27;float64&#x27;]:\n            col_min = df[col].min()\n            col_max = df[col].max()\n            \n            if col_type == &#x27;int64&#x27;:\n                if col_min &gt; np.iinfo(np.int8).min and col_max &lt; np.iinfo(np.int8).max:\n                    df[col] = df[col].astype(np.int8)\n                elif col_min &gt; np.iinfo(np.int16).min and col_max &lt; np.iinfo(np.int16).max:\n                    df[col] = df[col].astype(np.int16)\n                elif col_min &gt; np.iinfo(np.int32).min and col_max &lt; np.iinfo(np.int32).max:\n                    df[col] = df[col].astype(np.int32)\n            else:\n                if col_min &gt; np.finfo(np.float16).min and col_max &lt; np.finfo(np.float16).max:\n                    df[col] = df[col].astype(np.float16)\n                elif col_min &gt; np.finfo(np.float32).min and col_max &lt; np.finfo(np.float32).max:\n                    df[col] = df[col].astype(np.float32)\n    \n    return df\n```\n\n### 2. Vectorized Operations\n\n```python\n# Use vectorized operations instead of loops\n# Bad:\nfor i in range(len(df)):\n    df.iloc[i, &#x27;new_col&#x27;] = df.iloc[i, &#x27;col1&#x27;] + df.iloc[i, &#x27;col2&#x27;]\n\n# Good:\ndf[&#x27;new_col&#x27;] = df[&#x27;col1&#x27;] + df[&#x27;col2&#x27;]\n\n# Use numpy operations for complex calculations\ndf[&#x27;complex_calc&#x27;] = np.where(\n    df[&#x27;condition&#x27;],\n    df[&#x27;value1&#x27;] * df[&#x27;value2&#x27;],\n    df[&#x27;value3&#x27;] + df[&#x27;value4&#x27;]\n)\n```\n\n## Model Training and Evaluation\n\n```python\n# src/models/trainer.py\nfrom sklearn.model_selection import cross_val_score\nfrom sklearn.metrics import make_scorer\nimport numpy as np\n\nclass ModelTrainer:\n    def __init__(self, model, scoring=&#x27;accuracy&#x27;):\n        self.model = model\n        self.scoring = scoring\n        \n    def train_with_cv(self, X, y, cv=5):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Train model with cross-validation.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        scores = cross_val_score(\n            self.model, X, y,\n            cv=cv,\n            scoring=self.scoring,\n            n_jobs=-1\n        )\n        return {\n            &#x27;mean_score&#x27;: scores.mean(),\n            &#x27;std_score&#x27;: scores.std(),\n            &#x27;scores&#x27;: scores\n        }\n        \n    def train_final_model(self, X, y):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Train final model on full dataset.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.model.fit(X, y)\n        return self.model\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n1. **Data Exploration**\n   - Always start with exploratory data analysis (EDA)\n   - Check for missing values and outliers\n   - Understand feature distributions and relationships\n\n2. **Performance Optimization**\n   - Use appropriate data types to minimize memory usage\n   - Leverage vectorized operations\n   - Profile code to identify bottlenecks\n   - Use chunking for large datasets\n\n3. **Code Organization**\n   - Keep notebooks clean and well-documented\n   - Use modular functions for reusability\n   - Follow consistent naming conventions\n   - Implement proper error handling\n\n4. **Visualization**\n   - Create informative and clear visualizations\n   - Use appropriate plot types for different data types\n   - Include proper labels and titles\n   - Consider accessibility in color choices\n\n## Resources\n\n- [Pandas Documentation](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/)\n- [scikit-learn Documentation](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/documentation.html)\n- [Seaborn Documentation](https://seaborn.pydata.org/)\n- [Python Data Science Handbook](https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/)</div>
