                <div class="prompt-text"># PyTorch and Scikit-learn Development Guide\n\n## Core Principles\n- Model development\n- Data preprocessing\n- Training pipelines\n- Model evaluation\n- Deployment strategies\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### Directory Structure\n```\nml_project/\n├── src/\n│   ├── data/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   ├── dataset.py\n│   │   └── preprocessing.py\n│   ├── models/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   ├── pytorch/\n│   │   └── sklearn/\n│   ├── training/\n│   │   ├── __init__.py\n│   │   ├── trainer.py\n│   │   └── metrics.py\n│   └── utils/\n│       ├── __init__.py\n│       └── visualization.py\n├── notebooks/\n│   ├── exploration.ipynb\n│   └── evaluation.ipynb\n├── tests/\n│   ├── __init__.py\n│   └── test_models.py\n├── configs/\n│   └── model_config.yaml\n├── pyproject.toml\n└── README.md\n```\n\n### Dependencies Setup\n```toml\n# pyproject.toml\n[project]\nname = &quot;ml-project&quot;\nversion = &quot;0.1.0&quot;\ndescription = &quot;Machine learning project&quot;\nrequires-python = &quot;&gt;=3.12&quot;\n\ndependencies = [\n    &quot;torch&gt;=2.1.0&quot;,\n    &quot;scikit-learn&gt;=1.3.2&quot;,\n    &quot;numpy&gt;=1.26.0&quot;,\n    &quot;pandas&gt;=2.1.2&quot;,\n    &quot;matplotlib&gt;=3.8.1&quot;,\n    &quot;seaborn&gt;=0.13.0&quot;,\n]\n\n[project.optional-dependencies]\ndev = [\n    &quot;pytest&gt;=7.4.0&quot;,\n    &quot;black&gt;=23.10.0&quot;,\n    &quot;ruff&gt;=0.1.3&quot;,\n    &quot;jupyter&gt;=1.0.0&quot;,\n]\n```\n\n## Data Processing\n\n### Dataset Implementation\n```python\n# src/data/dataset.py\nfrom torch.utils.data import Dataset\nimport torch\nimport numpy as np\nfrom typing import Tuple\n\nclass CustomDataset(Dataset):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Custom PyTorch dataset.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        data: np.ndarray,\n        targets: np.ndarray,\n        transform = None\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Initialize dataset.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.data = torch.FloatTensor(data)\n        self.targets = torch.FloatTensor(targets)\n        self.transform = transform\n    \n    def __len__(self) -&gt; int:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Get dataset length.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return len(self.data)\n    \n    def __getitem__(\n        self,\n        idx: int\n    ) -&gt; Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Get item by index.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        x = self.data[idx]\n        y = self.targets[idx]\n        \n        if self.transform:\n            x = self.transform(x)\n        \n        return x, y\n```\n\n### Data Preprocessing\n```python\n# src/data/preprocessing.py\nfrom sklearn.base import BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin\nfrom sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler\nimport numpy as np\nfrom typing import Optional\n\nclass CustomPreprocessor(BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Custom scikit-learn preprocessor.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self, feature_range: Optional[tuple] = None):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Initialize preprocessor.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.feature_range = feature_range\n        self.scaler = StandardScaler()\n    \n    def fit(self, X: np.ndarray, y=None):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Fit preprocessor.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.scaler.fit(X)\n        return self\n    \n    def transform(self, X: np.ndarray) -&gt; np.ndarray:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Transform data.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        X_scaled = self.scaler.transform(X)\n        \n        if self.feature_range:\n            min_val, max_val = self.feature_range\n            X_scaled = (X_scaled - X_scaled.min()) / (\n                X_scaled.max() - X_scaled.min()\n            )\n            X_scaled = X_scaled * (max_val - min_val) + min_val\n        \n        return X_scaled\n```\n\n## Model Development\n\n### PyTorch Model\n```python\n# src/models/pytorch/model.py\nimport torch\nimport torch.nn as nn\nfrom typing import List\n\nclass NeuralNetwork(nn.Module):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Neural network model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        input_size: int,\n        hidden_sizes: List[int],\n        output_size: int,\n        dropout: float = 0.2\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Initialize model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        super().__init__()\n        \n        layers = []\n        prev_size = input_size\n        \n        for hidden_size in hidden_sizes:\n            layers.extend([\n                nn.Linear(prev_size, hidden_size),\n                nn.ReLU(),\n                nn.BatchNorm1d(hidden_size),\n                nn.Dropout(dropout)\n            ])\n            prev_size = hidden_size\n        \n        layers.append(nn.Linear(prev_size, output_size))\n        self.model = nn.Sequential(*layers)\n    \n    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -&gt; torch.Tensor:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Forward pass.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return self.model(x)\n```\n\n### Scikit-learn Model\n```python\n# src/models/sklearn/model.py\nfrom sklearn.base import BaseEstimator, ClassifierMixin\nfrom sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder\nimport numpy as np\nfrom typing import Optional\n\nclass CustomClassifier(BaseEstimator, ClassifierMixin):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Custom scikit-learn classifier.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        learning_rate: float = 0.01,\n        n_iterations: int = 1000\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Initialize classifier.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.learning_rate = learning_rate\n        self.n_iterations = n_iterations\n        self.label_encoder = LabelEncoder()\n    \n    def fit(\n        self,\n        X: np.ndarray,\n        y: np.ndarray\n    ) -&gt; &quot;CustomClassifier&quot;:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Fit classifier.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        y_encoded = self.label_encoder.fit_transform(y)\n        self.classes_ = self.label_encoder.classes_\n        \n        n_samples, n_features = X.shape\n        self.weights = np.zeros(n_features)\n        self.bias = 0\n        \n        for _ in range(self.n_iterations):\n            linear_model = np.dot(X, self.weights) + self.bias\n            predictions = self._sigmoid(linear_model)\n            \n            dw = (1 / n_samples) * np.dot(X.T, (predictions - y_encoded))\n            db = (1 / n_samples) * np.sum(predictions - y_encoded)\n            \n            self.weights -= self.learning_rate * dw\n            self.bias -= self.learning_rate * db\n        \n        return self\n    \n    def predict(self, X: np.ndarray) -&gt; np.ndarray:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Predict classes.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        linear_model = np.dot(X, self.weights) + self.bias\n        predictions = self._sigmoid(linear_model)\n        return self.label_encoder.inverse_transform(\n            (predictions &gt;= 0.5).astype(int)\n        )\n    \n    def _sigmoid(self, x: np.ndarray) -&gt; np.ndarray:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Sigmoid activation function.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x))\n```\n\n## Training Pipeline\n\n### PyTorch Trainer\n```python\n# src/training/trainer.py\nimport torch\nimport torch.nn as nn\nfrom torch.utils.data import DataLoader\nfrom typing import Optional, Callable\nimport numpy as np\nfrom tqdm import tqdm\n\nclass PyTorchTrainer:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;PyTorch model trainer.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        model: nn.Module,\n        criterion: nn.Module,\n        optimizer: torch.optim.Optimizer,\n        device: str = &quot;cuda&quot; if torch.cuda.is_available() else &quot;cpu&quot;\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Initialize trainer.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.model = model.to(device)\n        self.criterion = criterion\n        self.optimizer = optimizer\n        self.device = device\n    \n    def train_epoch(\n        self,\n        train_loader: DataLoader,\n        epoch: int,\n        scheduler: Optional[torch.optim.lr_scheduler._LRScheduler] = None\n    ) -&gt; float:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Train one epoch.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.model.train()\n        total_loss = 0\n        \n        with tqdm(train_loader, desc=f&quot;Epoch {epoch}&quot;) as pbar:\n            for batch_idx, (data, target) in enumerate(pbar):\n                data, target = data.to(self.device), target.to(self.device)\n                \n                self.optimizer.zero_grad()\n                output = self.model(data)\n                loss = self.criterion(output, target)\n                \n                loss.backward()\n                self.optimizer.step()\n                \n                if scheduler is not None:\n                    scheduler.step()\n                \n                total_loss += loss.item()\n                pbar.set_postfix({&quot;loss&quot;: loss.item()})\n        \n        return total_loss / len(train_loader)\n    \n    @torch.no_grad()\n    def evaluate(\n        self,\n        val_loader: DataLoader,\n        metric_fn: Optional[Callable] = None\n    ) -&gt; tuple[float, Optional[float]]:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Evaluate model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.model.eval()\n        total_loss = 0\n        predictions = []\n        targets = []\n        \n        for data, target in val_loader:\n            data, target = data.to(self.device), target.to(self.device)\n            output = self.model(data)\n            loss = self.criterion(output, target)\n            \n            total_loss += loss.item()\n            predictions.append(output.cpu().numpy())\n            targets.append(target.cpu().numpy())\n        \n        avg_loss = total_loss / len(val_loader)\n        metric = None\n        \n        if metric_fn is not None:\n            predictions = np.concatenate(predictions)\n            targets = np.concatenate(targets)\n            metric = metric_fn(targets, predictions)\n        \n        return avg_loss, metric\n```\n\n### Training Metrics\n```python\n# src/training/metrics.py\nimport numpy as np\nfrom sklearn.metrics import (\n    accuracy_score,\n    precision_score,\n    recall_score,\n    f1_score\n)\nfrom typing import Dict, Any\n\ndef calculate_metrics(\n    y_true: np.ndarray,\n    y_pred: np.ndarray\n) -&gt; Dict[str, float]:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Calculate classification metrics.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    return {\n        &quot;accuracy&quot;: accuracy_score(y_true, y_pred),\n        &quot;precision&quot;: precision_score(y_true, y_pred, average=&quot;weighted&quot;),\n        &quot;recall&quot;: recall_score(y_true, y_pred, average=&quot;weighted&quot;),\n        &quot;f1&quot;: f1_score(y_true, y_pred, average=&quot;weighted&quot;)\n    }\n\ndef calculate_regression_metrics(\n    y_true: np.ndarray,\n    y_pred: np.ndarray\n) -&gt; Dict[str, float]:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Calculate regression metrics.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    return {\n        &quot;mse&quot;: np.mean((y_true - y_pred) ** 2),\n        &quot;rmse&quot;: np.sqrt(np.mean((y_true - y_pred) ** 2)),\n        &quot;mae&quot;: np.mean(np.abs(y_true - y_pred)),\n        &quot;r2&quot;: 1 - (\n            np.sum((y_true - y_pred) ** 2) /\n            np.sum((y_true - np.mean(y_true)) ** 2)\n        )\n    }\n```\n\n## Model Evaluation\n\n### Visualization\n```python\n# src/utils/visualization.py\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\nimport seaborn as sns\nfrom typing import List, Dict, Any\n\ndef plot_training_history(\n    history: Dict[str, List[float]],\n    figsize: tuple = (10, 6)\n) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Plot training history.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    plt.figure(figsize=figsize)\n    \n    for metric, values in history.items():\n        plt.plot(values, label=metric)\n    \n    plt.title(&quot;Training History&quot;)\n    plt.xlabel(&quot;Epoch&quot;)\n    plt.ylabel(&quot;Value&quot;)\n    plt.legend()\n    plt.grid(True)\n    plt.show()\n\ndef plot_confusion_matrix(\n    y_true: np.ndarray,\n    y_pred: np.ndarray,\n    labels: List[str],\n    figsize: tuple = (8, 6)\n) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Plot confusion matrix.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    cm = confusion_matrix(y_true, y_pred)\n    \n    plt.figure(figsize=figsize)\n    sns.heatmap(\n        cm,\n        annot=True,\n        fmt=&quot;d&quot;,\n        cmap=&quot;Blues&quot;,\n        xticklabels=labels,\n        yticklabels=labels\n    )\n    plt.title(&quot;Confusion Matrix&quot;)\n    plt.xlabel(&quot;Predicted&quot;)\n    plt.ylabel(&quot;True&quot;)\n    plt.show()\n```\n\n## Model Deployment\n\n### Model Export\n```python\n# src/models/export.py\nimport torch\nimport pickle\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any\n\ndef save_pytorch_model(\n    model: torch.nn.Module,\n    path: str | Path,\n    save_jit: bool = True\n) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Save PyTorch model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    path = Path(path)\n    path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n    \n    if save_jit:\n        model.eval()\n        traced_model = torch.jit.script(model)\n        torch.jit.save(traced_model, str(path))\n    else:\n        torch.save(model.state_dict(), path)\n\ndef save_sklearn_model(\n    model: Any,\n    path: str | Path\n) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Save scikit-learn model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    path = Path(path)\n    path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n    \n    with open(path, &quot;wb&quot;) as f:\n        pickle.dump(model, f)\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Development\n1. Param (Reactive Parameters)\n- Langchain (LLM Integration)\n- CSS (Styling)\n\n## Project Architecture\n\n### Component-Based Design\n```python\nfrom abc import ABC, abstractmethod\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, List\n\nclass Component(ABC):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Base class for all components in the application.\n    \n    Components are the building blocks of the application, consisting\n    of a Model for data/logic and Views for UI representation.\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.model = self.create_model()\n        self.views = self.create_views()\n    \n    @abstractmethod\n    def create_model(self) -&gt; Any:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Create and return the component&#x27;s model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        pass\n    \n    @abstractmethod\n    def create_views(self) -&gt; List[Any]:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Create and return the component&#x27;s views.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        pass\n\nclass Element(Component):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;A specialized component that can connect to other elements.\n    \n    Elements are components that can be connected through ports to\n    form a processing graph.\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        super().__init__()\n        self.input_ports = {}\n        self.output_ports = {}\n    \n    def add_input_port(self, name: str, payload_type: type):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Add an input port to the element.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.input_ports[name] = InputPort(name, payload_type)\n    \n    def add_output_port(self, name: str, payload_type: type):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Add an output port to the element.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.output_ports[name] = OutputPort(name, payload_type)\n```\n\n### Port System\n```python\nfrom typing import Generic, TypeVar\nfrom abc import ABC, abstractmethod\n\nT = TypeVar(&#x27;T&#x27;)\n\nclass Port(Generic[T], ABC):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Base class for input and output ports.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self, name: str, payload_type: type):\n        self.name = name\n        self.payload_type = payload_type\n        self.connections = []\n\nclass InputPort(Port[T]):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Port that receives payloads from output ports.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def receive(self, payload: T):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Handle incoming payload.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        if not isinstance(payload, self.payload_type):\n            raise TypeError(f&quot;Expected {self.payload_type}, got {type(payload)}&quot;)\n        self.handle_payload(payload)\n    \n    @abstractmethod\n    def handle_payload(self, payload: T):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Process the received payload.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        pass\n\nclass OutputPort(Port[T]):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Port that sends payloads to input ports.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def connect(self, input_port: InputPort):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Connect to an input port.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        if input_port.payload_type != self.payload_type:\n            raise TypeError(&quot;Incompatible payload types&quot;)\n        self.connections.append(input_port)\n    \n    def send(self, payload: T):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Send payload to all connected input ports.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        if not isinstance(payload, self.payload_type):\n            raise TypeError(f&quot;Expected {self.payload_type}, got {type(payload)}&quot;)\n        for port in self.connections:\n            port.receive(payload)\n```\n\n## Element Implementation\n\n### Chat Interface Element\n```python\nimport param\nimport panel as pn\nfrom typing import List\n\nclass ChatMessage:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Represents a single chat &quot;&quot;&quot;Model for the chat interface element.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    messages = param.List(default=[])\n    input_text = param.String(default=&quot;&quot;)\n    \n    def self.messages + [message]\n    \n    def clear_messages(self):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Clear all messages from the chat history.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        self.messages = []\n\nclass ChatInterfaceElement(Element):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Element for handling chat interactions.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def create_model(self) -&gt; ChatInterfaceModel:\n        return ChatInterfaceModel()\n    \n    def create_views(self) -&gt; List[pn.viewable.Viewable]:\n        # Create message display\n        message_display = pn.Column(\n            *(self.create_message_view(msg) for msg in self.model.messages),\n            scroll=True,\n            height=400\n        )\n        \n        # Create input area\n        input_area = pn.Row(\n            pn.widgets.TextAreaInput(\n                value=self.model.input_text,\n                placeholder=&quot;Type your message...&quot;,\n                height=100\n            ),\n            pn.widgets.Button(\n                name=&quot;Send&quot;,\n                button_type=&quot;primary&quot;,\n                width=100\n            )\n        )\n        \n        return [message_display, input_area]\n    \n    def create_message_view(self, message: ChatMessage) -&gt; pn.viewable.Viewable:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Create a view for a single message.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return pn.Card(\n            pn.Column(\n                pn.pane.Markdown(message.content),\n                pn.pane.HTML(f&quot;&lt;small&gt;{message.role}&lt;/small&gt;&quot;)\n            ),\n            css_classes=[f&quot;message-{message.role}&quot;]\n        )\n```\n\n### LLM Element\n```python\nfrom langchain.llms import BaseLLM\nfrom langchain.callbacks import BaseCallbackHandler\n\nclass LLMElement(Element):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Element for handling LLM interactions.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self, llm: BaseLLM):\n        self.llm = llm\n        super().__init__()\n        \n        # Add ports\n        self.add_input_port(&quot;prompt&quot;, str)\n        self.add_output_port(&quot;response&quot;, str)\n        self.add_output_port(&quot;error&quot;, Exception)\n    \n    def create_model(self):\n        return param.Parameterized()\n    \n    def create_views(self):\n        return [\n            pn.indicators.LoadingSpinner(value=False, visible=False),\n            pn.pane.Markdown(&quot;LLM Status: Ready&quot;)\n        ]\n    \n    async def handle_prompt(self, prompt: str):\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Handle incoming prompt and generate response.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        try:\n            # Show loading state\n            self.views[0].value = True\n            self.views[0].visible = True\n            self.views[1].object = &quot;LLM Status: Generating...&quot;\n            \n            # Generate response\n            response = await self.llm.agenerate([prompt])\n            \n            # Send response\n            self.output_ports[&quot;response&quot;].send(response.generations[0][0].text)\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            self.output_ports[&quot;error&quot;].send(e)\n        \n        finally:\n            # Hide loading state\n            self.views[0].value = False\n            self.views[0].visible = False\n            self.views[1].object = &quot;LLM Status: Ready&quot;\n```\n\n## Styling\n\n### CSS Organization\n```css\n/* buttons.css */\n.button-primary {\n    background-color: #4CAF50;\n    border: none;\n    color: white;\n    padding: 15px 32px;\n    text-align: center;\n    text-decoration: none;\n    display: inline-block;\n    font-size: 16px;\n layout\n    layout = pn.Column(\n        pn.pane.Markdown(&quot;# Chat Application&quot;),\n        chat.views[0],  # Message display\n        chat.views[1],  # Input area\n        llm.views[0],   # Loading spinner\n        llm.views[1]    # Status message\n    )\n    \n    return layout\n\n# Start application\napp = create_chat_application()\napp.servable()\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1. Dependency Management with Poetry\n```toml\n# pyproject.toml\n[tool.poetry]\nname = &quot;project-name&quot;\nversion = &quot;0.1.0&quot;\ndescription = &quot;Project description&quot;\nauthors = [&quot;Your Name &lt;your.email@example.com&gt;&quot;]\n\n[tool.poetry.dependencies]\npython = &quot;^3.12&quot;\nrequests = &quot;^2.31.0&quot;\npydantic = &quot;^2.5.0&quot;\n\n[tool.poetry.group.dev.dependencies]\npytest = &quot;^7.4.0&quot;\nblack = &quot;^23.10.0&quot;\nmypy = &quot;^1.6.0&quot;\nruff = &quot;^0.1.0&quot;\n```\n\n### 3. Project Structure\n```\nproject/\n├── src/\n│   └── package/\n│       ├── __init__.py\n│       ├── main.py\n│       └── utils/\n│           ├── __init__.py\n│           └── helpers.py\n├── tests/\n│   ├── __init__.py\n│   ├── conftest.py\n│   └── test_main.py\n├── docs/\n│   └── index.md\n├── pyproject.toml\n├── README.md\n└── .gitignore\n```\n\n## Development Workflow\n\n### 1. Debugging with pdb\n```python\ndef complex_function(data: dict) -&gt; int:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Complex function for demonstration.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    import pdb; pdb.set_trace()  # Start debugger\n    result = 0\n    for key, value in data.items():\n        if isinstance(value, int):\n            result += value\n    return result\n```\n\n### 2. Performance Profiling\n```python\nimport cProfile\nimport pstats\nfrom functools import wraps\nfrom typing import Callable, TypeVar\n\nT = TypeVar(&quot;T&quot;, bound=Callable)\n\ndef profile(func: T) -&gt; T:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Profile function execution.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    @wraps(func)\n    def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):\n        profile = cProfile.Profile()\n        try:\n            return profile.runcall(func, *args, **kwargs)\n        finally:\n            stats = pstats.Stats(profile)\n            stats.sort_stats(&quot;cumulative&quot;)\n            stats.print_stats()\n    return wrapper  # type: ignore\n\n@profile\ndef expensive_operation() -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Expensive operation to profile.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    result = sum(i * i for i in range(1000000))\n```\n\n## Documentation\n\n### 1. bool:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Validate data point values.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        try:\n            assert self.value &gt;= 0, &quot;Value must be non-negative&quot;\n            assert self.timestamp &lt;= datetime.now(), &quot;Timestamp cannot be in future&quot;\n            return True\n        except AssertionError as e:\n            logger.error(f&quot;Validation failed: {e}&quot;)\n            return False\n\n# Implement context manager\n@contextlib.contextmanager\ndef data_transaction(source: DataSource):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Context manager for data operations.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    logger.info(&quot;Starting data transaction&quot;)\n    try:\n        yield source\n        logger.info(&quot;Transaction completed successfully&quot;)\n    except Exception as e:\n        logger.error(f&quot;Transaction failed: {e}&quot;)\n        raise\n    finally:\n        logger.info(&quot;Cleaning up transaction&quot;)\n\n# Implement decorator for timing\ndef timing_decorator(func):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Decorator to measure function execution time.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    async def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):\n        start = datetime.now()\n        try:\n            result = await func(*args, **kwargs)\n            elapsed = datetime.now() - start\n            logger.info(f&quot;{func.__name__} took {elapsed.total_seconds():.2f} seconds&quot;)\n            return result\n        except Exception as e:\n            logger.error(f&quot;{func.__name__} failed after {elapsed.total_seconds():.2f} seconds&quot;)\n            raise\n    return wrapper\n\n# Implement data processor\nclass DataProcessor:\n    def __init__(self, source: DataSource):\n        self.source = source\n        self.data_points: List[DataPoint] = []\n    \n    @timing_decorator\n    async def process_data(self) -&gt; Optional[T]:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Get value from cache.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return self._data.get(key)\n    \n    def set(self, key: str, value: T) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Set value in cache.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        if len(self._data) &gt;= self.max_size:\n            self._data.pop(next(iter(self._data)))\n        self._data[key] = value\n```\n\n## Constraints and Limitations\n\nI will consider:\n1. shutil.rmtree(path)\n            else:\n                path.unlink()\n\ndef build_package():\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Build package distribution.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    subprocess.run(\n        [&quot;python&quot;, &quot;-m&quot;, &quot;build&quot;],\n        check=True\n    )\n\nif __name__ == &quot;__main__&quot;:\n    clean_build()\n    build_package()\n```\n\n### CI/CD Tkinter - Standard GUI Library\n```python\nimport tkinter as tk\nfrom tkinter import ttk\n\nclass ModernApp(tk.Tk):\n    def __init__(self):\n        super().__init__()\n        \n        self.title(&quot;Modern Tkinter Application&quot;)\n        self.geometry(&quot;800x600&quot;)\n        \n        # Configure modern styling\n        style = ttk.Style()\n        style.theme_use(&#x27;clam&#x27;)\n        \n        # Create main container\n        self.main_frame = ttk.Frame(self)\n        self.main_frame.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True, padx=10, pady=10)\n        \n        # Add widgets\n        self.create_widgets()\n    \n    def create_widgets(self):\n        # Header\n        header = ttk.Label(\n            self.main_frame, \n            text=&quot;Welcome&quot;, \n            font=(&#x27;Helvetica&#x27;, 24)\n        )\n        header.pack(pady=20)\n        \n        # Input field\n        self.input_var = tk.StringVar()\n        input_field = ttk.Entry(\n            self.main_frame,\n            textvariable=self.input_var\n        )\n        input_field.pack(fill=tk.X, pady=10)\n        \n        # Button\n        action_button = ttk.Button(\n            self.main_frame,\n            text=&quot;Submit&quot;,\n            command=self.handle_submit\n        )\n        action_button.pack(pady=10)\n    \n    def handle_submit(self):\n        value = self.input_var.get()\n        # Process input\n```\n\n### 2. PyQt6 - Modern and Professional\n```python\nfrom PyQt6.QtWidgets import QApplication, QMainWindow, QWidget, QVBoxLayout\nfrom PyQt6.QtCore import Qt\n\nclass MainWindow(QMainWindow):\n    def __init__(self):\n        super().__init__()\n        \n        self.setWindowTitle(&quot;Modern PyQt Application&quot;)\n        self.setMinimumSize(800, 600)\n        \n        # Create central widget and layout\n        central_widget = QWidget()\n        self.setCentralWidget(central_widget)\n        layout = QVBoxLayout(central_widget)\n        \n        # Add widgets\n        self.setup_ui(layout)\n    \n    def setup_ui(self, layout):\n        # Add widgets to layout\n        header = QLabel(&quot;Welcome&quot;)\n        header.setAlignment(Qt.AlignmentFlag.AlignCenter)\n        header.setStyleSheet(&quot;font-size: 24px;&quot;)\n        layout.addWidget(header)\n        \n        # Input field\n        self.input_field = QLineEdit()\n        layout.addWidget(self.input_field)\n        \n        # Button\n        submit_button = QPushButton(&quot;Submit&quot;)\n        submit_button.clicked.connect(self.handle_submit)\n        layout.addWidget(submit_button)\n    \n    def handle_submit(self):\n        value = self.input_field.text()\n        # Process input\n```\n\n### 3. Kivy - Modern and Mobile-Ready\n```python\nfrom kivy.app import App\nfrom kivy.uix.boxlayout import BoxLayout\nfrom kivy.uix.label import Label\nfrom kivy.uix.textinput import TextInput\nfrom kivy.uix.button import Button\n\nclass MainView(BoxLayout):\n    def __init__(self, **kwargs):\n        super().__init__(**kwargs)\n        self.orientation = &#x27;vertical&#x27;\n        self.padding = 20\n        self.spacing = 10\n        \n        # Add widgets\n        self.setup_ui()\n    \n    def setup_ui(self):\n        # Header\n        header = Label(\n            text=&quot;Welcome&quot;,\n            font_size=&#x27;24sp&#x27;\n        )\n        self.add_widget(header)\n        \n        # Input field\n        self.input_field = TextInput(\n            multiline=False,\n            size_hint_y=None,\n            height=&#x27;40dp&#x27;\n        )\n        self.add_widget(self.input_field)\n        \n        # Button\n        submit_button = Button(\n            text=&quot;Submit&quot;,\n            size_hint_y=None,\n            height=&#x27;40dp&#x27;\n        )\n        submit_button.bind(on_press=self.handle_submit)\n        self.add_widget(submit_button)\n    \n    def handle_submit(self, instance):\n        value = self.input_field.text\n        # Process input\n\nclass ModernApp(App):\n    def build(self):\n        return MainView()\n```\n\n## Architecture Patterns\n\n### 1. Model-View-Controller (MVC)\n```python\n# models.py\nclass UserModel:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.name = &quot;&quot;\n        self.email = &quot;&quot;\n        \n    def validate(self):\n        return bool(self.name and &#x27;@&#x27; in self.email)\n    \n    def save(self):\n        # Save to database\n        pass\n\n# views.py\nclass UserView:\n    def __init__(self, controller):\n        self.controller = controller\n        self.window = tk.Tk()\n        self.setup_ui()\n    \n    def setup_ui(self):\n        self.name_var = tk.StringVar()\n        self.email_var = tk.StringVar()\n        \n        # Create input fields\n        ttk.Entry(textvariable=self.name_var).pack()\n        ttk.Entry(textvariable=self.email_var).pack()\n        \n        # Create submit button\n        ttk.Button(\n            text=&quot;Save&quot;,\n            command=self.controller.save_user\n        ).pack()\n    \n    def get_input(self):\n        return {\n            &#x27;name&#x27;: self.name_var.get(),\n            &#x27;email&#x27;: self.email_var.get()\n        }\n    \n    def show_error(self, message):\n        messagebox.showerror(&quot;Error&quot;, message)\n\n# controllers.py\nclass UserController:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.model = UserModel()\n        self.view = UserView(self)\n    \n    def save_user(self):\n        data = self.view.get_input()\n        self.model.name = data[&#x27;name&#x27;]\n        self.model.email = data[&#x27;email&#x27;]\n        \n        if not self.model.validate():\n            self.view.show_error(&quot;Invalid input&quot;)\n            return\n        \n        self.model.save()\n```\n\n### 2. Event-Driven Architecture\n```python\nfrom typing import Callable\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom collections import defaultdict\n\n@dataclass\nclass Event:\n    name: str\n    data: dict\n\nclass EventBus:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.subscribers = defaultdict(list)\n    \n    def subscribe(self, event_name: str, callback: Callable):\n        self.subscribers[event_name].append(callback)\n    \n    def publish(self, event: Event):\n        for callback in self.subscribers[event.name]:\n            callback(event.data)\n\nclass Application:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.event_bus = EventBus()\n        self.setup_handlers()\n    \n    def setup_handlers(self):\n        self.event_bus.subscribe(&#x27;user_input&#x27;, self.handle_input)\n        self.event_bus.subscribe(&#x27;error&#x27;, self.show_error)\n    \n    def handle_input(self, data):\n        # Process input data\n        pass\n    \n    def show_error(self, data):\n        # Show error message\n        pass\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Lazy Loading\n```python\nclass LazyWidget:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self._widget = None\n    \n    @property\n    def widget(self):\n        if self._widget is None:\n            self._widget = self.create_widget()\n        return self._widget\n    \n    def create_widget(self):\n        # Create and return widget\n        pass\n```\n\n### 2. Resource Management\n```python\nclass ResourceManager:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.resources = {}\n    \n    def load_image(self, path: str):\n        if path not in self.resources:\n            self.resources[path] = Image.open(path)\n        return self.resources[path]\n    \n    def clear(self):\n        for resource in self.resources.values():\n            resource.close()\n        self.resources.clear()\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### 1. Unit Tests\n```python\nimport unittest\nfrom unittest.mock import Mock\n\nclass TestUserController(unittest.TestCase):\n    def setUp(self):\n        self.model = Mock()\n        self.view = Mock()\n        self.controller = UserController(self.model, self.view)\n    \n    def test_save_user_valid(self):\n        self.view.get_input.return_value = {\n            &#x27;name&#x27;: &#x27;John&#x27;,\n            &#x27;email&#x27;: &#x27;john@example.com&#x27;\n        }\n        self.model.validate.return_value = True\n        \n        self.controller.save_user()\n        \n        self.model.save.assert_called_once()\n        self.view.show_error.assert_not_called()\n    \n    def test_save_user_invalid(self):\n        self.view.get_input.return_value = {\n            &#x27;name&#x27;: &#x27;&#x27;,\n            &#x27;email&#x27;: &#x27;invalid&#x27;\n        }\n        self.model.validate.return_value = False\n        \n        self.controller.save_user()\n        \n        self.model.save.assert_not_called()\n        self.view.show_error.assert_called_once()\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1. Error Handling\n```python\nclass ApplicationError(Exception):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Base class for application errors&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    pass\n\nclass ValidationError(ApplicationError):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Raised when input validation fails&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    pass\n\ndef safe_operation(func):\n    def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):\n        try:\n            return func(*args, **kwargs)\n        except ApplicationError as e:\n            # Handle known errors\n            show_error_dialog(str(e))\n        except Exception as e:\n            # Handle unexpected errors\n            log_error(e)\n            show_error_dialog(&quot;An unexpected error occurred&quot;)\n    return wrapper\n```\n\n### 2. Accessibility\n```python\nclass AccessibleWidget:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.widget = ttk.Frame()\n        self.setup_accessibility()\n    \n    def setup_accessibility(self):\n        # Set ARIA labels\n        self.widget.attributes(&#x27;-aria-label&#x27;, &#x27;Main content&#x27;)\n        \n        # Add keyboard navigation\n        self.widget.bind(&#x27;&lt;Key&gt;&#x27;, self.handle_key)\n        \n        # Set tab order\n        self.widget.lift()\n    \n    def handle_key(self, event):\n        # Handle keyboard navigation\n        pass\n```\n\n## Deployment\n\n### 1. Packaging\n```python\nfrom setuptools import setup\n\nsetup(\n    name=&quot;modern-gui-app&quot;,\n    version=&quot;1.0.0&quot;,\n    packages=[&quot;modern_gui_app&quot;],\n    install_requires=[\n        &quot;PyQt6&gt;=6.0.0&quot;,\n        &quot;Pillow&gt;=9.0.0&quot;,\n    ],\n    entry_points={\n        &quot;console_scripts&quot;: [\n            &quot;modern-gui-app=modern_gui_app.main:main&quot;,\n        ],\n    },\n)\n```\n\n### 2. Distribution\n```python\n# pyinstaller.spec\nblock_cipher = None\n\na = Analysis(\n    [&#x27;main.py&#x27;],\n    pathex=[],\n    binaries=[],\n    datas=[(&#x27;assets&#x27;, &#x27;assets&#x27;)],\n    hiddenimports=[],\n    hookspath=[],\n    runtime_hooks=[],\n    excludes=[],\n    win_no_prefer_redirects=False,\n    win_private_assemblies=False,\n    cipher=block_cipher,\n    noarchive=False\n)\n\npyz = PYZ(\n    a.pure,\n    a.zipped_data,\n    cipher=block_cipher\n)\n\nexe = EXE(\n    pyz,\n    a.scripts,\n    a.binaries,\n    a.zipfiles,\n    a.datas,\n    name=&#x27;ModernApp&#x27;,\n    debug=False,\n    strip=False,\n    upx=True,\n    runtime_tmpdir=None,\n    console=False,\n    icon=&#x27;assets/icon.ico&#x27;\n)\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Tkinter Documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/library/tkinter.html)\n- [PyQt6 Documentation](https://www.riverbankcomputing.com/static/Docs/PyQt6/)\n- [Kivy Documentation](https://kivy.org/doc/stable/)\n- [Python GUI Programming Cookbook](https://www.packtpub.com/product/python-gui-programming-cookbook-third-edition/9781838827540)</div>

                <div class="prompt-text"># Chrome Extension Development Guide with TypeScript\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides comprehensive development guidelines for building Chrome Extensions using TypeScript, focusing on best practices, security, and performance optimization.\n\n## Project Structure\n\n### File Organization\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── manifest.json           # Extension manifest\n  ├── background/            # Background scripts\n  ├── content/              # Content scripts\n  ├── popup/               # Popup UI\n  ├── options/            # Options page\n  └── types/              # TypeScript types\n```\n\n### Naming Conventions\n- File names: lowercase with underscores (e.g., `content_script.ts`)\n- Functions/variables: camelCase\n- Classes: PascalCase\n- Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE\n\n## TypeScript Implementation\n\n### Type Safety\n```typescript\n// Message interfaces\ninterface ExtensionMessage {\n  type: &#x27;UPDATE&#x27; | &#x27;FETCH&#x27; | &#x27;DELETE&#x27;;\n  payload: unknown;\n}\n\n// API response types\ninterface ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; {\n  success: boolean;\n  data?: T;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\n// Runtime type guards\nfunction isUpdateMessage(msg: ExtensionMessage): msg is ExtensionMessage &amp; { type: &#x27;UPDATE&#x27; } {\n  return msg.type === &#x27;UPDATE&#x27;;\n}\n```\n\n### Configuration\n```typescript\n// tsconfig.json\n{\n  &quot;compilerOptions&quot;: {\n    &quot;target&quot;: &quot;ES2020&quot;,\n    &quot;module&quot;: &quot;ES2020&quot;,\n    &quot;strict&quot;: true,\n    &quot;esModuleInterop&quot;: true,\n    &quot;skipLibCheck&quot;: true,\n    &quot;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames&quot;: true,\n    &quot;moduleResolution&quot;: &quot;node&quot;,\n    &quot;resolveJsonModule&quot;: true,\n    &quot;isolatedModules&quot;: true,\n    &quot;noEmit&quot;: false,\n    &quot;outDir&quot;: &quot;./dist&quot;\n  },\n  &quot;include&quot;: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;],\n  &quot;exclude&quot;: [&quot;node_modules&quot;]\n}\n```\n\n## Extension Architecture\n\n### Manifest V3\n```json\n{\n  &quot;manifest_version&quot;: 3,\n  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Extension Name&quot;,\n  &quot;version&quot;: &quot;1.0.0&quot;,\n  &quot;description&quot;: &quot;Extension description&quot;,\n  &quot;permissions&quot;: [\n    &quot;storage&quot;,\n    &quot;activeTab&quot;\n  ],\n  &quot;host_permissions&quot;: [\n    &quot;https://*.example.com/*&quot;\n  ],\n  &quot;background&quot;: {\n    &quot;service_worker&quot;: &quot;background/worker.js&quot;\n  },\n  &quot;content_scripts&quot;: [{\n    &quot;matches&quot;: [&quot;&lt;all_urls&gt;&quot;],\n    &quot;js&quot;: [&quot;content/script.js&quot;]\n  }],\n  &quot;action&quot;: {\n    &quot;default_popup&quot;: &quot;popup/index.html&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Message Passing\n```typescript\n// Send message from content script\nchrome.runtime.sendMessage&lt;ExtensionMessage&gt;({\n  type: &#x27;UPDATE&#x27;,\n  payload: data\n});\n\n// Listen in background script\nchrome.runtime.onMessage.addListener((\n  message: ExtensionMessage,\n  sender,\n  sendResponse\n) =&gt; {\n  if (isUpdateMessage(message)) {\n    // Handle update message\n    sendResponse({ success: true });\n  }\n});\n```\n\n## Security Best Practices\n\n### Content Security Policy\n```json\n{\n  &quot;manifest_version&quot;: 3,\n  &quot;content_security_policy&quot;: {\n    &quot;extension_pages&quot;: &quot;script-src &#x27;self&#x27;; object-src &#x27;self&#x27;&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Data Sanitization\n```typescript\nfunction sanitizeInput(input: string): string {\n  const div = document.createElement(&#x27;div&#x27;);\n  div.textContent = input;\n  return div.innerHTML;\n}\n```\n\n### Error Handling\n```typescript\nasync function handleApiRequest&lt;T&gt;(\n  url: string,\n  options: RequestInit\n): Promise&lt;ApiResponse&lt;T&gt;&gt; {\n  try {\n    const response = await fetch(url, {\n      ...options,\n      headers: {\n        &#x27;Content-Type&#x27;: &#x27;application/json&#x27;,\n        ...options.headers,\n      },\n    });\n    \n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);\n    }\n    \n    const data = await response.json();\n    return { success: true, data };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(&#x27;API request failed:&#x27;, error);\n    return {\n      success: false,\n      error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#x27;Unknown error&#x27;\n    };\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Background Scripts\n```typescript\n// Use event pages instead of persistent background\nchrome.runtime.onInstalled.addListener(() =&gt; {\n  // Initialize extension\n});\n\n// Use alarms instead of setInterval\nchrome.alarms.create(&#x27;checkUpdates&#x27;, {\n  periodInMinutes: 60\n});\n\nchrome.alarms.onAlarm.addListener((alarm) =&gt; {\n  if (alarm.name === &#x27;checkUpdates&#x27;) {\n    // Perform update check\n  }\n});\n```\n\n### Content Script Optimization\n```typescript\n// Lazy loading\nconst observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) =&gt; {\n  entries.forEach(entry =&gt; {\n    if (entry.isIntersecting) {\n      // Load resource\n      observer.unobserve(entry.target);\n    }\n  });\n});\n\n// Efficient DOM manipulation\nconst fragment = document.createDocumentFragment();\nelements.forEach(el =&gt; fragment.appendChild(el));\ncontainer.appendChild(fragment);\n```\n\n## Testing and Debugging\n\n### Unit Testing\n```typescript\n// Using Jest\ndescribe(&#x27;Extension Utils&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  test(&#x27;sanitizeInput removes unsafe content&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    const input = &#x27;&lt;script&gt;alert(&quot;xss&quot;)&lt;/script&gt;Hello&#x27;;\n    expect(sanitizeInput(input)).toBe(&#x27;Hello&#x27;);\n  });\n});\n```\n\n### Development Tools\n- Chrome DevTools for Extensions\n- TypeScript compiler in watch mode\n- Source maps for debugging\n\n## Cross-browser Compatibility\n\n### WebExtensions API\n```typescript\n// Use browser namespace with chrome fallback\nconst browserAPI = typeof browser !== &#x27;undefined&#x27; ? browser : chrome;\n\nasync function getData(): Promise&lt;any&gt; {\n  try {\n    return await browserAPI.storage.local.get(&#x27;key&#x27;);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(&#x27;Storage API error:&#x27;, error);\n    return null;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Chrome Extensions Documentation](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions)\n- [TypeScript Documentation](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs)\n- [WebExtensions API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions)\n- [Chrome Extension Security Guidelines](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/security)</div>

                <div class="prompt-text"># Chrome Extension Development with TypeScript Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides detailed instructions and best practices for developing Chrome extensions using TypeScript, ensuring type safety, maintainability, and optimal performance.\n\n## Prerequisites\n- Node.js (v18 or higher)\n- TypeScript knowledge\n- Chrome browser\n- Code editor (VS Code recommended)\n- Basic understanding of browser extensions\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### 1. Initialize Project\n```bash\nmkdir my-chrome-extension\ncd my-chrome-extension\nnpm init -y\nnpm install --save-dev typescript @types/chrome webpack webpack-cli ts-loader\n```\n\n### 2. TypeScript Configuration\nCreate `tsconfig.json`:\n```json\n{\n  &quot;compilerOptions&quot;: {\n    &quot;target&quot;: &quot;ES2020&quot;,\n    &quot;module&quot;: &quot;ES2020&quot;,\n    &quot;strict&quot;: true,\n    &quot;esModuleInterop&quot;: true,\n    &quot;skipLibCheck&quot;: true,\n    &quot;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames&quot;: true,\n    &quot;moduleResolution&quot;: &quot;node&quot;,\n    &quot;resolveJsonModule&quot;: true,\n    &quot;isolatedModules&quot;: true,\n    &quot;noEmit&quot;: false,\n    &quot;outDir&quot;: &quot;./dist&quot;,\n    &quot;rootDir&quot;: &quot;./src&quot;,\n    &quot;baseUrl&quot;: &quot;.&quot;,\n    &quot;paths&quot;: {\n      &quot;@/*&quot;: [&quot;src/*&quot;]\n    }\n  },\n  &quot;include&quot;: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;],\n  &quot;exclude&quot;: [&quot;node_modules&quot;]\n}\n```\n\n### 3. Webpack Configuration\nCreate `webpack.config.js`:\n```javascript\nconst path = require(&#x27;path&#x27;);\n\nmodule.exports = {\n  mode: &#x27;production&#x27;,\n  entry: {\n    background: &#x27;./src/background/index.ts&#x27;,\n    content: &#x27;./src/content/index.ts&#x27;,\n    popup: &#x27;./src/popup/index.ts&#x27;\n  },\n  output: {\n    path: path.resolve(__dirname, &#x27;dist&#x27;),\n    filename: &#x27;[name].js&#x27;\n  },\n  module: {\n    rules: [\n      {\n        test: /\.tsx?$/,\n        use: &#x27;ts-loader&#x27;,\n        exclude: /node_modules/\n      }\n    ]\n  },\n  resolve: {\n    extensions: [&#x27;.ts&#x27;, &#x27;.tsx&#x27;, &#x27;.js&#x27;],\n    alias: {\n      &#x27;@&#x27;: path.resolve(__dirname, &#x27;src&#x27;)\n    }\n  }\n};\n```\n\n## Project Structure\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── background/        # Background scripts\n  │   └── index.ts\n  ├── content/          # Content scripts\n  │   └── index.ts\n  ├── popup/           # Popup UI\n  │   ├── components/\n  │   └── index.ts\n  ├── types/          # TypeScript types\n  │   └── index.ts\n  └── utils/         # Shared utilities\n      └── index.ts\n```\n\n## Type Definitions\n\n### 1. Message Types\n```typescript\n// src/types/messages.ts\nexport type MessageType = &#x27;UPDATE&#x27; | &#x27;FETCH&#x27; | &#x27;DELETE&#x27;;\n\nexport interface ExtensionMessage&lt;T = unknown&gt; {\n  type: MessageType;\n  payload: T;\n}\n\nexport interface MessageResponse&lt;T = unknown&gt; {\n  success: boolean;\n  data?: T;\n  error?: string;\n}\n```\n\n### 2. API Types\n```typescript\n// src/types/api.ts\nexport interface ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; {\n  success: boolean;\n  data?: T;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\nexport interface RequestOptions extends RequestInit {\n  timeout?: number;\n}\n```\n\n## Core Features Implementation\n\n### 1. Background Script\n```typescript\n// src/background/index.ts\nimport { ExtensionMessage, MessageResponse } from &#x27;@/types/messages&#x27;;\n\nchrome.runtime.onInstalled.addListener(() =&gt; {\n  // Initialize extension settings\n  chrome.storage.sync.set({ \n    enabled: true,\n    settings: {\n      theme: &#x27;light&#x27;,\n      notifications: true\n    }\n  });\n});\n\n// Message handling\nchrome.runtime.onMessage.addListener(\n  (\n    message: ExtensionMessage,\n    sender,\n    sendResponse: (response: MessageResponse) =&gt; void\n  ) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      switch (message.type) {\n        case &#x27;UPDATE&#x27;:\n          handleUpdate(message.payload, sendResponse);\n          break;\n        case &#x27;FETCH&#x27;:\n          handleFetch(message.payload, sendResponse);\n          break;\n        default:\n          throw new Error(`Unknown message type: ${message.type}`);\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      sendResponse({\n        success: false,\n        error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#x27;Unknown error&#x27;\n      });\n    }\n    return true; // Keep message channel open for async response\n  }\n);\n```\n\n### 2. Content Script\n```typescript\n// src/content/index.ts\nimport { ExtensionMessage, MessageResponse } from &#x27;@/types/messages&#x27;;\n\nclass ContentScript {\n  private observer: MutationObserver;\n\n  constructor() {\n    this.observer = new MutationObserver(this.handleDOMChanges.bind(this));\n    this.initialize();\n  }\n\n  private async initialize(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n    // Initialize content script\n    await this.injectStyles();\n    this.setupObserver();\n    this.addEventListeners();\n  }\n\n  private setupObserver(): void {\n    this.observer.observe(document.body, {\n      childList: true,\n      subtree: true\n    });\n  }\n\n  private handleDOMChanges(mutations: MutationRecord[]): void {\n    // Handle DOM changes\n    for (const mutation of mutations) {\n      // Process mutations\n    }\n  }\n\n  private addEventListeners(): void {\n    document.addEventListener(&#x27;click&#x27;, this.handleClick.bind(this));\n  }\n\n  private async handleClick(event: MouseEvent): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n    // Handle click events\n  }\n\n  private async injectStyles(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n    const style = document.createElement(&#x27;style&#x27;);\n    style.textContent = await this.loadStyles();\n    document.head.appendChild(style);\n  }\n\n  private async loadStyles(): Promise&lt;string&gt; {\n    // Load and return styles\n    return &#x27;&#x27;;\n  }\n}\n\nnew ContentScript();\n```\n\n### 3. Popup UI\n```typescript\n// src/popup/index.ts\nimport { ExtensionMessage, MessageResponse } from &#x27;@/types/messages&#x27;;\n\nclass PopupUI {\n  private form: HTMLFormElement;\n\n  constructor() {\n    this.form = document.querySelector(&#x27;form&#x27;)!;\n    this.initialize();\n  }\n\n  private initialize(): void {\n    this.loadSettings();\n    this.addEventListeners();\n  }\n\n  private async loadSettings(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n    const settings = await chrome.storage.sync.get(&#x27;settings&#x27;);\n    this.updateUI(settings);\n  }\n\n  private updateUI(settings: any): void {\n    // Update UI with settings\n  }\n\n  private addEventListeners(): void {\n    this.form.addEventListener(&#x27;submit&#x27;, this.handleSubmit.bind(this));\n  }\n\n  private async handleSubmit(event: Event): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n    event.preventDefault();\n    // Handle form submission\n  }\n}\n\nnew PopupUI();\n```\n\n## Utility Functions\n\n### 1. API Utilities\n```typescript\n// src/utils/api.ts\nimport { ApiResponse, RequestOptions } from &#x27;@/types/api&#x27;;\n\nexport async function fetchWithTimeout&lt;T&gt;(\n  url: string,\n  options: RequestOptions = {}\n): Promise&lt;ApiResponse&lt;T&gt;&gt; {\n  const { timeout = 5000, ...fetchOptions } = options;\n\n  try {\n    const controller = new AbortController();\n    const id = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), timeout);\n\n    const response = await fetch(url, {\n      ...fetchOptions,\n      signal: controller.signal\n    });\n    clearTimeout(id);\n\n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);\n    }\n\n    const data = await response.json();\n    return { success: true, data };\n  } catch (error) {\n    return {\n      success: false,\n      error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#x27;Unknown error&#x27;\n    };\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Storage Utilities\n```typescript\n// src/utils/storage.ts\nexport async function getStorageItem&lt;T&gt;(key: string): Promise&lt;T | undefined&gt; {\n  try {\n    const result = await chrome.storage.sync.get(key);\n    return result[key];\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(`Error getting storage item ${key}:`, error);\n    return undefined;\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function setStorageItem&lt;T&gt;(\n  key: string,\n  value: T\n): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n  try {\n    await chrome.storage.sync.set({ [key]: value });\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(`Error setting storage item ${key}:`, error);\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Event Page Pattern\n```typescript\n// src/background/index.ts\n// Use event pages instead of persistent background\nchrome.runtime.onInstalled.addListener(() =&gt; {\n  // Initialize only necessary data\n});\n\n// Use alarms for periodic tasks\nchrome.alarms.create(&#x27;checkUpdates&#x27;, {\n  periodInMinutes: 60\n});\n\nchrome.alarms.onAlarm.addListener((alarm) =&gt; {\n  if (alarm.name === &#x27;checkUpdates&#x27;) {\n    // Perform update check\n  }\n});\n```\n\n### 2. Content Script Optimization\n```typescript\n// src/content/index.ts\n// Lazy loading resources\nconst observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) =&gt; {\n  entries.forEach(entry =&gt; {\n    if (entry.isIntersecting) {\n      // Load resource\n      observer.unobserve(entry.target);\n    }\n  });\n});\n\n// Efficient DOM manipulation\nconst fragment = document.createDocumentFragment();\nelements.forEach(el =&gt; fragment.appendChild(el));\ncontainer.appendChild(fragment);\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### 1. Unit Testing\n```typescript\n// src/utils/__tests__/api.test.ts\nimport { fetchWithTimeout } from &#x27;../api&#x27;;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;API Utils&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  test(&#x27;fetchWithTimeout handles timeout&#x27;, async () =&gt; {\n    const result = await fetchWithTimeout(&#x27;http://example.com&#x27;, {\n      timeout: 1\n    });\n    expect(result.success).toBe(false);\n    expect(result.error).toContain(&#x27;timeout&#x27;);\n  });\n});\n```\n\n### 2. E2E Testing\n```typescript\n// e2e/extension.test.ts\ndescribe(&#x27;Extension E2E&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  beforeAll(async () =&gt; {\n    await browser.runtime.loadExtension(&#x27;./dist&#x27;);\n  });\n\n  test(&#x27;extension activates on target pages&#x27;, async () =&gt; {\n    await browser.url(&#x27;http://example.com&#x27;);\n    const element = await browser.$(&#x27;.extension-element&#x27;);\n    expect(await element.isDisplayed()).toBe(true);\n  });\n});\n```\n\n## Security Considerations\n\n### 1. Content Security Policy\n```json\n// manifest.json\n{\n  &quot;content_security_policy&quot;: {\n    &quot;extension_pages&quot;: &quot;script-src &#x27;self&#x27;; object-src &#x27;self&#x27;&quot;,\n    &quot;sandbox&quot;: &quot;sandbox allow-scripts allow-forms allow-popups allow-modals&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Data Sanitization\n```typescript\n// src/utils/security.ts\nexport function sanitizeHTML(input: string): string {\n  const div = document.createElement(&#x27;div&#x27;);\n  div.textContent = input;\n  return div.innerHTML;\n}\n\nexport function validateURL(url: string): boolean {\n  try {\n    new URL(url);\n    return true;\n  } catch {\n    return false;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Chrome Extension Documentation](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/)\n- [TypeScript Documentation](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/)\n- [Chrome Extension Manifest V3](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/intro/)\n- [Web Extensions API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions)</div>

Reusable Components\n```typescript\n// components/ui/button.tsx\nimport { cn } from &#x27;@/lib/utils&#x27;\nimport { ButtonHTMLAttributes, forwardRef } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface ButtonProps extends ButtonHTMLAttributes&lt;HTMLButtonElement&gt; {\n  variant?: &#x27;default&#x27; | &#x27;destructive&#x27; | &#x27;outline&#x27; | &#x27;ghost&#x27; | &#x27;link&#x27;\n  size?: &#x27;default&#x27; | &#x27;sm&#x27; | &#x27;lg&#x27;\n}\n\nconst Button = forwardRef&lt;HTMLButtonElement, ButtonProps&gt;(({\n  className,\n  variant = &#x27;default&#x27;,\n  size = &#x27;default&#x27;,\n  ...props\n}, ref) =&gt; {\n  return (\n    &lt;button\n      className={cn(\n        &#x27;inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-md font-medium transition-colors&#x27;,\n        &#x27;focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring&#x27;,\n        &#x27;disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50&#x27;,\n        {\n          &#x27;bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90&#x27;: variant === &#x27;default&#x27;,\n          &#x27;bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground hover:bg-destructive/90&#x27;: variant === &#x27;destructive&#x27;,\n          &#x27;border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground&#x27;: variant === &#x27;outline&#x27;,\n          &#x27;hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground&#x27;: variant === &#x27;ghost&#x27;,\n          &#x27;text-primary underline-offset-4 hover:underline&#x27;: variant === &#x27;link&#x27;,\n          &#x27;h-10 px-4 py-2&#x27;: size === &#x27;default&#x27;,\n          &#x27;h-9 rounded-md px-3&#x27;: size === &#x27;sm&#x27;,\n          &#x27;h-11 rounded-md px-8&#x27;: size === &#x27;lg&#x27;,\n        },\n        className\n      )}\n      ref={ref}\n      {...props}\n    /&gt;\n  )\n})\nButton.displayName = &#x27;Button&#x27;\n\nexport { Button }\n```\n\n### 3. Theme Configuration\n```typescript\n// components/theme-provider.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ntype Theme = &#x27;dark&#x27; | &#x27;light&#x27; | &#x27;system&#x27;\n\ninterface ThemeProviderProps {\n  children: React.ReactNode\n  defaultTheme?: Theme\n}\n\nconst ThemeContext = createContext&lt;{\n  theme: Theme\n  setTheme: (theme: Theme) =&gt; void\n}&gt;({\n  theme: &#x27;system&#x27;,\n  setTheme: () =&gt; null,\n})\n\nexport function ThemeProvider({\n  children,\n  defaultTheme = &#x27;system&#x27;,\n}: ThemeProviderProps) {\n  const [theme, setTheme] = useState&lt;Theme&gt;(defaultTheme)\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const root = window.document.documentElement\n    root.classList.remove(&#x27;light&#x27;, &#x27;dark&#x27;)\n\n    if (theme === &#x27;system&#x27;) {\n      const systemTheme = window.matchMedia(&#x27;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&#x27;)\n        .matches ? &#x27;dark&#x27; : &#x27;light&#x27;\n      root.classList.add(systemTheme)\n    } else {\n      root.classList.add(theme)\n    }\n  }, [theme])\n\n  return (\n    &lt;ThemeContext.Provider value={{ theme, setTheme }}&gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/ThemeContext.Provider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport const useTheme = () =&gt; {\n  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)\n  if (context === undefined) {\n    throw new Error(&#x27;useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider&#x27;)\n  }\n  return context\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1.             <div class="prompt-content">
                <div class="prompt-text"># Next.js Frontend Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides comprehensive development guidelines for building modern frontend applications using Next.js, React, TypeScript, and related technologies, focusing on best practices and performance optimization.\n\n## Core Technologies\n\n### Primary Stack\n- Next.js App Router\n- React Server Components\n- TypeScript\n- Zustand (State Management)\n- Shadcn UI / Radix UI\n- Tailwind CSS\n\n## Project Structure\n\n### Directory Organization\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── app/              # Next.js App Router\n  │   ├── (auth)/     # Auth-related routes\n  │   ├── (shop)/    # Shop-related routes\n  │   └── api/      # API routes\n  ├── components/  # React components\n  │   ├── ui/    # UI components\n  │   └── forms/ # Form components\n  ├── lib/      # Utility functions\n  ├── stores/  # Zustand stores\n  └── types/  # TypeScript types\n```\n\n## Code Style\n\n### TypeScript Best Practices\n```typescript\n// ✅ Good: Clear interfaces and type definitions\ninterface User {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  email: string;\n  preferences: UserPreferences;\n}\n\n// ✅ Good: Map instead of enum\nconst UserRole = {\n  ADMIN: &#x27;admin&#x27;,\n  USER: &#x27;user&#x27;,\n  GUEST: &#x27;guest&#x27;,\n} as const;\n\ntype UserRoleType = typeof UserRole[keyof typeof UserRole];\n\n// ❌ Bad: Avoid enums\nenum UserRoleEnum {\n  ADMIN = &#x27;admin&#x27;,\n  USER = &#x27;user&#x27;,\n  GUEST = &#x27;guest&#x27;,\n}\n```\n\n### Component Structure\n```typescript\n// components/ProductCard.tsx\nimport { type FC } from &#x27;react&#x27;;\nimport { cn } from &#x27;@/lib/utils&#x27;;\nimport { Card } from &#x27;@/components/ui/card&#x27;;\n\ninterface ProductCardProps {\n  title: string;\n  price: number;\n  image: string;\n  onAddToCart: () =&gt; void;\n  className?: string;\n}\n\nexport const ProductCard: FC&lt;ProductCardProps&gt; = ({\n  title,\n  price,\n  image,\n  onAddToCart,\n  className,\n}) =&gt; {\n  return (\n    &lt;Card className={cn(&#x27;overflow-hidden&#x27;, className)}&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;relative aspect-square&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;Image\n          src={image}\n          alt={title}\n          fill\n          className=&quot;object-cover&quot;\n          sizes=&quot;(max-width: 768px) 100vw, (max-width: 1200px) 50vw, 33vw&quot;\n        /&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;p-4&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;h3 className=&quot;text-lg font-semibold&quot;&gt;{title}&lt;/h3&gt;\n        &lt;p className=&quot;text-gray-600&quot;&gt;${price.toFixed(2)}&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;Button onClick={onAddToCart}&gt;Add to Cart&lt;/Button&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/Card&gt;\n  );\n};\n```\n\n## State Management\n\n### Zustand Store\n```typescript\n// stores/cart.ts\nimport { create } from &#x27;zustand&#x27;;\nimport { persist } from &#x27;zustand/middleware&#x27;;\n\ninterface CartItem {\n  id: string;\n  quantity: number;\n}\n\ninterface CartStore {\n  items: CartItem[];\n  addItem: (id: string) =&gt; void;\n  removeItem: (id: string) =&gt; void;\n  clearCart: () =&gt; void;\n}\n\nexport const useCartStore = create&lt;CartStore&gt;()(\n  persist(\n    (set) =&gt; ({\n      items: [],\n      addItem: (id) =&gt;\n        set((state) =&gt; ({\n          items: state.items.some((item) =&gt; item.id === id)\n            ? state.items.map((item) =&gt;\n                item.id === id\n                  ? { ...item, quantity: item.quantity + 1 }\n                  : item\n              )\n            : [...state.items, { id, quantity: 1 }],\n        })),\n      removeItem: (id) =&gt;\n        set((state) =&gt; ({\n          items: state.items.filter((item) =&gt; item.id !== id),\n        })),\n      clearCart: () =&gt; set({ items: [] }),\n    }),\n    {\n      name: &#x27;cart-storage&#x27;,\n    }\n  )\n);\n```\n\n## Server Components\n\n### Data Fetching\n```typescript\n// app/products/page.tsx\nimport { ProductCard } from &#x27;@/components/ProductCard&#x27;;\nimport { getProducts } from &#x27;@/lib/api&#x27;;\n\nexport default async function ProductsPage() {\n  const products = await getProducts();\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;container mx-auto py-8&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h1 className=&quot;text-3xl font-bold mb-6&quot;&gt;Products&lt;/h1&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-6&quot;&gt;\n        {products.map((product) =&gt; &#x27;@/types&#x27;;\n\nasync function getPosts(): Promise&lt;Post[]&gt; {\n  const res = await fetch(&#x27;https://api.example.com/posts&#x27;, {\n    next: { revalidate: 3600 } // Cache for 1 hour\n  });\n  \n  if (!res.ok) {\n    throw new Error(&#x27;Failed to fetch posts&#x27;);\n  }\n  \n  return res.json();\n}\n\nexport default async function BlogPage() {\n  const posts = await getPosts();\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;container mx-auto py-8&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h1 className=&quot;text-3xl font-bold mb-6&quot;&gt;Blog Posts&lt;/h1&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-6&quot;&gt;\n        {posts.map(post =&gt; (\n          &lt;PostCard key={post.id} post={post} /&gt;\n        ))}\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n```\n\n### Client Components\n```typescript\n// components/ui/ThemeToggle.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;;\n\nimport { useState, useEffect } from &#x27;react&#x27;;\nimport { useTheme } from setMounted(true);\n  }, []);\n\n  if (!mounted) return null;\n\n  return (\n    &lt;button\n      className=&quot;p-2 rounded-md hover:bg-gray-100 dark:hover:bg-gray-800&quot;\n      onClick={() =&gt;  &lt;p className=&quot;text-gray-600&quot;&gt;{user.email}&lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### Error Boundaries\n```typescript\n// app/error.tsx\n&#x27;use text-white rounded-md hover:bg-blue-600&quot;\n      &gt;\n        Try again\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## Loading States\n\n### Loading UI\n```typescript\n// { Metadata } from &#x27;next&#x27;;\n\nexport const metadata: Metadata = {\n  title: {\n    default: &#x27;My App&#x27;,\n    template: &#x27;%s | My App&#x27;,\n  },\n  description: &#x27;A modern return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;relative aspect-w-16 aspect-h-9&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;Image\n        src={src}\n        alt={alt}\n        width={width}\n        height={height}\n        priority={priority}\n        className=&quot;object-cover rounded-lg&quot;\n        sizes=&quot;(max-width: 768px) 100vw, (max-width: 1200px) 50vw, 33vw&quot;\n      /&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## API Routes\n\n### Route Handlers\n```typescript\n// app/api/posts/route.ts\nimport { NextResponse } from &#x27;next/server&#x27;;\nimport type { Post } from NextResponse.json(posts);\n  } catch (error) {\n    return NextResponse.json(\n      { error: &#x27;Failed to fetch posts&#x27; },\n      { status: 500 }\n    );\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function  \n    --card: 0 0% 100%;\n    --card-foreground: 222.2 84% 4.9%;\n    \n    --popover: 0 0% 100%;\n    --popover-foreground: 222.2 84% 4.9%;\n    \n    --primary: 222.2 47.4% 11.2%;\n Component Patterns\n\n### Button Component\n```typescript\n// src/components/ui/Button.tsx\nimport { cva, type VariantProps } from &#x27;class-variance-authority&#x27;\nimport { cn } from                 <div class="prompt-text"># Next.js 14 with Tailwind CSS and SEO Setup Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides detailed instructions for setting up a modern Next.js 14 project with Tailwind CSS, focusing on SEO optimization, performance, and development best practices using the App Router.\n\n## Prerequisites\n- Node.js (v18.17 or higher)\n- TypeScript knowledge\n- Basic understanding of React and Tailwind CSS\n- Code editor (VS Code recommended)\n\n## Tech Stack Benefits\n- **Next.js 14**: Server-first framework with built-in performance optimizations\n- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development\n- **TypeScript**: Enhanced developer experience with type safety\n- **App Router**: Enhanced routing with server components and nested layouts\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### 1. Project Initialization\n```bash\nnpx create-next-app@latest my-nextjs-app --typescript --tailwind --app --src-dir --import-alias &quot;@/*&quot;\n```\n\n### 2. Project Structure\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── app/                 # App Router pages and layouts\n  │   ├── layout.tsx      # Root layout\n  │   ├── page.tsx        # Home page\n  │   └── globals.css     # Global styles\n  ├── components/         # React components\n  │   ├── ui/            # UI components\n  │   └── shared/        # Shared components\n  ├── lib/               # Utility functions\n  ├── types/             # TypeScript types\n  └── styles/            # Additional styles\n```\n\n### 3. SEO Configuration\nCreate `src/app/layout.tsx`:\n```tsx\nimport type { Metadata } from &#x27;next&#x27;\nimport { Inter } from &#x27;next/font/google&#x27;\nimport &#x27;./globals.css&#x27;\n\nconst inter = Inter({ subsets: [&#x27;latin&#x27;] })\n\nexport const metadata: Metadata = {\n  title: {\n    template: &#x27;%s | My App&#x27;,\n    default: &#x27;My App&#x27;,\n  },\n  description: &#x27;Next.js application with SEO optimization&#x27;,\n  openGraph: {\n    title: &#x27;My App&#x27;,\n    description: &#x27;Next.js application with SEO optimization&#x27;,\n    url: &#x27;https://myapp.com&#x27;,\n    siteName: &#x27;My App&#x27;,\n    images: [\n      {\n        url: &#x27;https://myapp.com/og.png&#x27;,\n        width: 1200,\n        height: 630,\n      },\n    ],\n    locale: &#x27;en_US&#x27;,\n    type: &#x27;website&#x27;,\n  },\n  robots: {\n    index: true,\n    follow: true,\n    googleBot: {\n      index: true,\n      follow: true,\n      &#x27;max-video-preview&#x27;: -1,\n      &#x27;max-image-preview&#x27;: &#x27;large&#x27;,\n      &#x27;max-snippet&#x27;: -1,\n    },\n  },\n  verification: {\n    google: &#x27;your-google-verification-code&#x27;,\n  },\n}\n\nexport default function RootLayout({\n  children,\n}: {\n  children: React.ReactNode\n}) {\n  return (\n    &lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;body className={inter.className}&gt;{children}&lt;/body&gt;\n    &lt;/html&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 4. Tailwind Configuration\nUpdate `tailwind.config.ts`:\n```typescript\nimport type { Config } from &#x27;tailwindcss&#x27;\n\nconst config: Config = {\n  content: [\n    &#x27;./src/pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}&#x27;,\n    &#x27;./src/components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}&#x27;,\n    &#x27;./src/app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}&#x27;,\n  ],\n  theme: {\n    extend: {\n      colors: {\n        primary: {\n          50: &#x27;#f0f9ff&#x27;,\n          100: &#x27;#e0f2fe&#x27;,\n          // Add more shades\n        },\n      },\n      fontFamily: {\n        sans: [&#x27;Inter var&#x27;, &#x27;sans-serif&#x27;],\n      },\n    },\n  },\n  plugins: [],\n}\n\nexport default config\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Image Optimization\nCreate `src/components/ui/OptimizedImage.tsx`:\n```tsx\nimport Image from &#x27;next/image&#x27;\nimport { type ImageProps } from &#x27;next/image&#x27;\n\ninterface OptimizedImageProps extends Omit&lt;ImageProps, &#x27;alt&#x27;&gt; {\n  alt: string\n}\n\nexport function OptimizedImage({ alt, ...props }: OptimizedImageProps) {\n  return (\n    &lt;Image\n      alt={alt}\n      sizes=&quot;(max-width: 768px) 100vw, (max-width: 1200px) 50vw, 33vw&quot;\n      {...props}\n    /&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Route Segments\nCreate `src/app/loading.tsx`:\n```tsx\nexport default function Loading() {\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;flex min-h-screen items-center justify-center&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;h-8 w-8 animate-spin rounded-full border-4 border-primary-500 border-t-transparent&quot; /&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 3. Dynamic Imports\n```typescript\nimport dynamic from &#x27;next/dynamic&#x27;\n\nconst HeavyComponent = dynamic(() =&gt; import(&#x27;@/components/HeavyComponent&#x27;), {\n  loading: () =&gt; &lt;p&gt;Loading...&lt;/p&gt;,\n  ssr: false,\n})\n```\n\n## SEO Best Practices\n\n### 1. Dynamic Metadata\nCreate `src/app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx`:\n```tsx\nimport { type Metadata } from &#x27;next&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  params: { slug: string }\n}\n\nexport async function generateMetadata({ params }: Props): Promise&lt;Metadata&gt; {\n  const post = await getPost(params.slug)\n  \n  return {\n    title: post.title,\n    description: post.excerpt,\n    openGraph: {\n      title: post.title,\n      description: post.excerpt,\n      images: [post.image],\n    },\n  }\n}\n\nexport default function BlogPost({ params }: Props) {\n  // Component implementation\n}\n```\n\n### 2. Structured Data\nCreate `src/lib/generateStructuredData.ts`:\n```typescript\nexport function generateStructuredData({\n  title,\n  description,\n  image,\n  datePublished,\n  author,\n}: {\n  title: string\n  description: string\n  image: string\n  datePublished: string\n  author: string\n}) {\n  return {\n    &#x27;@context&#x27;: &#x27;https://schema.org&#x27;,\n    &#x27;@type&#x27;: &#x27;Article&#x27;,\n    headline: title,\n    description,\n    image,\n    datePublished,\n    author: {\n      &#x27;@type&#x27;: &#x27;Person&#x27;,\n      name: author,\n    },\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Development Workflow\n\n### 1. Type Safety\nCreate `src/types/index.ts`:\n```typescript\nexport interface Post {\n  id: string\n  title: string\n  slug: string\n  excerpt: string\n  content: string\n  image: string\n  author: {\n    name: string\n    avatar: string\n  }\n  datePublished: string\n}\n\nexport type ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; = {\n  data: T\n  meta: {\n    total: number\n    page: number\n    perPage: number\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### 2. API Integration\nCreate `src/lib/api.ts`:\n```typescript\nimport { type ApiResponse, type Post } from &#x27;@/types&#x27;\n\nexport async function getPosts(): Promise&lt;ApiResponse&lt;Post[]&gt;&gt; {\n  const res = await fetch(&#x27;https://api.example.com/posts&#x27;, {\n    next: { revalidate: 3600 }, // Cache for 1 hour\n  })\n  \n  if (!res.ok) {\n    throw new Error(&#x27;Failed to fetch posts&#x27;)\n  }\n  \n  return res.json()\n}\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### 1. Error Boundaries\nCreate `src/app/error.tsx`:\n```tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { useEffect } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\nexport default function Error({\n  error,\n  reset,\n}: {\n  error: Error &amp; { digest?: string }\n  reset: () =&gt; void\n}) {\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    console.error(error)\n  }, [error])\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;flex min-h-screen flex-col items-center justify-center&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h2 className=&quot;text-2xl font-bold&quot;&gt;Something went wrong!&lt;/h2&gt;\n      &lt;button\n        onClick={reset}\n        className=&quot;mt-4 rounded-md bg-primary-500 px-4 py-2 text-white&quot;\n      &gt;\n        Try again\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Testing Setup\n\n### 1. Component Testing\nInstall dependencies:\n```bash\nnpm install -D @testing-library/react @testing-library/jest-dom jest jest-environment-jsdom\n```\n\nCreate `src/components/ui/__tests__/Button.test.tsx`:\n```tsx\nimport { render, screen } from &#x27;@testing-library/react&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;../Button&#x27;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;Button&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  it(&#x27;renders correctly&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n    render(&lt;Button&gt;Click me&lt;/Button&gt;)\n    expect(screen.getByRole(&#x27;button&#x27;)).toHaveTextContent(&#x27;Click me&#x27;)\n  })\n})\n```\n\n## Deployment Considerations\n\n### 1. Environment Variables\nCreate `.env.local`:\n```plaintext\nNEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=https://api.example.com\nNEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=https://myapp.com\n```\n\n### 2. Build Optimization\nUpdate `next.config.js`:\n```javascript\n/** @type {import(&#x27;next&#x27;).NextConfig} */\nconst nextConfig = {\n  images: {\n    domains: [&#x27;images.example.com&#x27;],\n  },\n  experimental: {\n    optimizeCss: true,\n  },\n  headers: async () =&gt; [\n    {\n      source: &#x27;/:path*&#x27;,\n      headers: [\n        {\n          key: &#x27;X-DNS-Prefetch-Control&#x27;,\n          value: &#x27;on&#x27;,\n        },\n      ],\n    },\n  ],\n}\n\nmodule.exports = nextConfig\n```\n\n## Common Issues &amp; Solutions\n\n### Build Errors\n- Clear `.next` directory\n- Update dependencies\n- Check TypeScript configuration\n\n### Performance Issues\n- Use React DevTools profiler\n- Implement proper code splitting\n- Optimize images and fonts\n\n### SEO Problems\n- Verify metadata implementation\n- Check robots.txt configuration\n- Use Lighthouse for auditing\n\n## Resources\n- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs)\n- [Tailwind CSS Documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs)\n- [Google SEO Guide](https://developers.google.com/search/docs)\n- [Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/)</div>
