            <div class="prompt-content">
                <div class="prompt-text"># Next.js Frontend Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides comprehensive patterns and best practices for developing frontend applications using Next.js, focusing on modern development approaches, component architecture, and maintainable code structure.\n\n## Core Concepts\n\n### 1. Component Architecture\n\n#### Atomic Design Pattern\n```typescript\nsrc/\n  components/\n    atoms/         # Basic building blocks\n      Button/\n        index.tsx\n        types.ts\n        styles.module.css\n    molecules/     # Simple component combinations\n      SearchBar/\n        index.tsx\n        types.ts\n    organisms/     # Complex component combinations\n      Header/\n        index.tsx\n        types.ts\n    templates/     # Page layouts\n      DashboardLayout/\n        index.tsx\n        types.ts\n```\n\n### 2. State Management\n\n#### Local State with Hooks\n```typescript\n// src/components/molecules/Counter/index.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { useState, useCallback } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;@/components/atoms/Button&#x27;\n\nexport function Counter() {\n  const [count, setCount] = useState(0)\n  \n  const increment = useCallback(() =&gt; {\n    setCount(prev =&gt; prev + 1)\n  }, [])\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;flex items-center gap-4&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;span className=&quot;text-lg font-bold&quot;&gt;{count}&lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;Button onClick={increment}&gt;Increment&lt;/Button&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n#### Global State with Zustand\n```typescript\n// src/store/auth.ts\nimport { create } from &#x27;zustand&#x27;\nimport { persist } from &#x27;zustand/middleware&#x27;\n\ninterface AuthState {\n  user: User | null\n  token: string | null\n  login: (credentials: Credentials) =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;\n  logout: () =&gt; void\n}\n\nexport const useAuthStore = create&lt;AuthState&gt;()(\n  persist(\n    (set) =&gt; ({\n      user: null,\n      token: null,\n      login: async (credentials) =&gt; {\n        const { user, token } = await loginApi(credentials)\n        set({ user, token })\n      },\n      logout: () =&gt; set({ user: null, token: null }),\n    }),\n    {\n      name: &#x27;auth-storage&#x27;,\n    }\n  )\n)\n```\n\n### 3. Data Fetching\n\n#### Server Components\n```typescript\n// src/app/posts/page.tsx\nimport { PostCard } from &#x27;@/components/molecules/PostCard&#x27;\nimport { getPosts } from &#x27;@/lib/api&#x27;\n\nexport default async function PostsPage() {\n  const posts = await getPosts()\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3&quot;&gt;\n      {posts.map(post =&gt; (\n        &lt;PostCard key={post.id} post={post} /&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n#### Client Components with SWR\n```typescript\n// src/components/organisms/PostList/index.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport useSWR from &#x27;swr&#x27;\nimport { PostCard } from &#x27;@/components/molecules/PostCard&#x27;\nimport { Spinner } from &#x27;@/components/atoms/Spinner&#x27;\n\nexport function PostList() {\n  const { data: posts, error, isLoading } = useSWR(&#x27;/api/posts&#x27;)\n  \n  if (isLoading) return &lt;Spinner /&gt;\n  if (error) return &lt;div&gt;Failed to load posts&lt;/div&gt;\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3&quot;&gt;\n      {posts.map(post =&gt; (\n        &lt;PostCard key={post.id} post={post} /&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 4. Form Handling\n\n#### Form Management with React Hook Form\n```typescript\n// src/components/organisms/ContactForm/index.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { useForm } from &#x27;react-hook-form&#x27;\nimport { zodResolver } from &#x27;@hookform/resolvers/zod&#x27;\nimport { z } from &#x27;zod&#x27;\nimport { Button } from &#x27;@/components/atoms/Button&#x27;\nimport { Input } from &#x27;@/components/atoms/Input&#x27;\n\nconst schema = z.object({\n  name: z.string().min(2, &#x27;Name must be at least 2 characters&#x27;),\n  email: z.string().email(&#x27;Invalid email address&#x27;),\n  message: z.string().min(10, &#x27;Message must be at least 10 characters&#x27;),\n})\n\ntype FormData = z.infer&lt;typeof schema&gt;\n\nexport function ContactForm() {\n  const {\n    register,\n    handleSubmit,\n    formState: { errors, isSubmitting },\n  } = useForm&lt;FormData&gt;({\n    resolver: zodResolver(schema),\n  })\n  \n  const onSubmit = async (data: FormData) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      await fetch(&#x27;/api/contact&#x27;, {\n        method: &#x27;POST&#x27;,\n        body: JSON.stringify(data),\n      })\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(&#x27;Failed to submit form:&#x27;, error)\n    }\n  }\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)} className=&quot;space-y-6&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;Input\n        label=&quot;Name&quot;\n        error={errors.name?.message}\n        {...register(&#x27;name&#x27;)}\n      /&gt;\n      &lt;Input\n        label=&quot;Email&quot;\n        type=&quot;email&quot;\n        error={errors.email?.message}\n        {...register(&#x27;email&#x27;)}\n      /&gt;\n      &lt;Input\n        label=&quot;Message&quot;\n        as=&quot;textarea&quot;\n        error={errors.message?.message}\n        {...register(&#x27;message&#x27;)}\n      /&gt;\n      &lt;Button type=&quot;submit&quot; disabled={isSubmitting}&gt;\n        {isSubmitting ? &#x27;Sending...&#x27; : &#x27;Send Message&#x27;}\n      &lt;/Button&gt;\n    &lt;/form&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 5. Routing and Navigation\n\n#### Dynamic Routes\n```typescript\n// src/app/posts/[slug]/page.tsx\nimport { notFound } from &#x27;next/navigation&#x27;\nimport { getPost } from &#x27;@/lib/api&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  params: { slug: string }\n}\n\nexport default async function PostPage({ params }: Props) {\n  const post = await getPost(params.slug)\n  \n  if (!post) {\n    notFound()\n  }\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;article className=&quot;prose prose-lg mx-auto&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h1&gt;{post.title}&lt;/h1&gt;\n      &lt;div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: post.content }} /&gt;\n    &lt;/article&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n#### Client-Side Navigation\n```typescript\n// src/components/molecules/PostCard/index.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport Link from &#x27;next/link&#x27;\nimport { useRouter } from &#x27;next/navigation&#x27;\nimport { type Post } from &#x27;@/types&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  post: Post\n}\n\nexport function PostCard({ post }: Props) {\n  const router = useRouter()\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;rounded-lg border p-6&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h2 className=&quot;text-xl font-bold&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;Link href={`/posts/${post.slug}`}&gt;{post.title}&lt;/Link&gt;\n      &lt;/h2&gt;\n      &lt;p className=&quot;mt-2 text-gray-600&quot;&gt;{post.excerpt}&lt;/p&gt;\n      &lt;button\n        onClick={() =&gt; router.push(`/posts/${post.slug}/edit`)}\n        className=&quot;mt-4 text-blue-500 hover:underline&quot;\n      &gt;\n        Edit Post\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n### 6. Authentication\n\n#### Protected Routes\n```typescript\n// src/middleware.ts\nimport { NextResponse } from &#x27;next/server&#x27;\nimport type { NextRequest } from &#x27;next/server&#x27;\n\nexport function middleware(request: NextRequest) {\n  const token = request.cookies.get(&#x27;token&#x27;)\n  \n  if (!token &amp;&amp; request.nextUrl.pathname.startsWith(&#x27;/dashboard&#x27;)) {\n    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(&#x27;/login&#x27;, request.url))\n  }\n  \n  return NextResponse.next()\n}\n\nexport const config = {\n  matcher: &#x27;/dashboard/:path*&#x27;,\n}\n```\n\n#### Auth Provider\n```typescript\n// src/providers/AuthProvider.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { createContext, useContext, useEffect } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { useAuthStore } from &#x27;@/store/auth&#x27;\n\nconst AuthContext = createContext&lt;ReturnType&lt;typeof useAuthStore&gt;&gt;(null!)\n\nexport function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {\n  const store = useAuthStore()\n  \n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    // Check token validity on mount\n    if (store.token) {\n      store.validateToken()\n    }\n  }, [store])\n  \n  return (\n    &lt;AuthContext.Provider value={store}&gt;\n      {children}\n    &lt;/AuthContext.Provider&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport const useAuth = () =&gt; useContext(AuthContext)\n```\n\n### 7. Error Handling\n\n#### Error Boundaries\n```typescript\n// src/components/ErrorBoundary.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { Component, type ErrorInfo, type ReactNode } from &#x27;react&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  children: ReactNode\n  fallback: ReactNode\n}\n\ninterface State {\n  hasError: boolean\n}\n\nexport class ErrorBoundary extends Component&lt;Props, State&gt; {\n  state = { hasError: false }\n  \n  static getDerivedStateFromError() {\n    return { hasError: true }\n  }\n  \n  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo) {\n    console.error(&#x27;Error caught by boundary:&#x27;, error, errorInfo)\n  }\n  \n  render() {\n    if (this.state.hasError) {\n      return this.props.fallback\n    }\n    \n    return this.props.children\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### 8. Performance Optimization\n\n#### Component Memoization\n```typescript\n// src/components/molecules/ExpensiveList/index.tsx\n&#x27;use client&#x27;\n\nimport { memo } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport { type Item } from &#x27;@/types&#x27;\n\ninterface Props {\n  items: Item[]\n  onItemClick: (id: string) =&gt; void\n}\n\nfunction ExpensiveListBase({ items, onItemClick }: Props) {\n  return (\n    &lt;ul className=&quot;space-y-4&quot;&gt;\n      {items.map(item =&gt; (\n        &lt;li\n          key={item.id}\n          onClick={() =&gt; onItemClick(item.id)}\n          className=&quot;cursor-pointer p-4 hover:bg-gray-50&quot;\n        &gt;\n          {item.title}\n        &lt;/li&gt;\n      ))}\n    &lt;/ul&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport const ExpensiveList = memo(ExpensiveListBase)\n```\n\n#### Dynamic Imports with Suspense\n```typescript\n// src/app/dashboard/page.tsx\nimport { Suspense } from &#x27;react&#x27;\nimport dynamic from &#x27;next/dynamic&#x27;\nimport { Spinner } from &#x27;@/components/atoms/Spinner&#x27;\n\nconst DashboardChart = dynamic(\n  () =&gt; import(&#x27;@/components/organisms/DashboardChart&#x27;),\n  {\n    loading: () =&gt; &lt;Spinner /&gt;,\n    ssr: false,\n  }\n)\n\nexport default function DashboardPage() {\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;space-y-8&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h1 className=&quot;text-3xl font-bold&quot;&gt;Dashboard&lt;/h1&gt;\n      &lt;Suspense fallback={&lt;Spinner /&gt;}&gt;\n        &lt;DashboardChart /&gt;\n      &lt;/Suspense&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n```\n\n## Development Workflow\n\n### 1. Project Organization\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── app/           # App Router pages\n  ├── components/    # UI components\n  ├── hooks/         # Custom hooks\n  ├── lib/           # Utility functions\n  ├── providers/     # Context providers\n  ├── store/         # State management\n  ├── styles/        # Global styles\n  └── types/         # TypeScript types\n```\n\n### 2. Code Quality\n- Use ESLint and Prettier\n- Implement Git hooks with Husky\n- Write unit tests with Jest and Testing Library\n- Follow TypeScript best practices\n\n### 3. Performance Monitoring\n- Use Lighthouse for auditing\n- Monitor Core Web Vitals\n- Implement error tracking\n- Use performance profiling tools\n\n## Resources\n- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs)\n- [React Documentation](https://react.dev)\n- [TypeScript Handbook](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook)\n- [Testing Library](https://testing-library.com/docs)</div>

It emphasizes code readability, maintainability, and modern development practices.\n\n## Core Technologies\n- HTML5 with semantic markup\n- Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling\n- Vanilla JavaScript (ES2022+)\n\n## HTML Best Practices\n\n### Semantic Structure\n```html\n&lt;header&gt;\n  &lt;nav&gt;\n    &lt;ul&gt;\n      &lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;#home&quot;&gt;Home&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;\n      &lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;#about&quot;&gt;About&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;\n    &lt;/ul&gt;\n  &lt;/nav&gt;\n&lt;/header&gt;\n\n&lt;main&gt;\n  &lt;article&gt;\n    &lt;h1&gt;Main Content&lt;/h1&gt;\n    &lt;section&gt;\n      &lt;h2&gt;Section Title&lt;/h2&gt;\n      &lt;p&gt;Content goes here...&lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;/section&gt;\n  &lt;/article&gt;\n&lt;/main&gt;\n\n&lt;footer&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;&amp;copy; 2024 Your Company&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;/footer&gt;\n```\n\n### Accessibility\n- Use ARIA labels when necessary\n- Maintain proper heading hierarchy\n- Ensure sufficient color contrast\n- Provide alt text for images\n\n## Tailwind CSS Implementation\n\n### Base Configuration\n```javascript\n// tailwind.config.js\nmodule.exports = {\n  content: [\n    &quot;./src/**/*.{html,js}&quot;,\n  ],\n  theme: {\n    extend: {\n      colors: {\n        primary: &#x27;#3b82f6&#x27;,\n        secondary: &#x27;#64748b&#x27;,\n      },\n      spacing: {\n        &#x27;128&#x27;: &#x27;32rem&#x27;,\n      },\n    },\n  },\n  plugins: [],\n}\n```\n\n### Component Examples\n```html\n&lt;!-- Card Component --&gt;\n&lt;div class=&quot;max-w-sm rounded-lg shadow-lg bg-white&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;img class=&quot;w-full h-48 object-cover rounded-t-lg&quot; src=&quot;image.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Card image&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;p-6&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h2 class=&quot;text-xl font-bold mb-2&quot;&gt;Card Title&lt;/h2&gt;\n    &lt;p class=&quot;text-gray-700&quot;&gt;Card content goes here...&lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;button class=&quot;mt-4 px-4 py-2 bg-primary text-white rounded hover:bg-primary/90 transition&quot;&gt;\n      Action\n    &lt;/button&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;!-- Form Component --&gt;\n&lt;form class=&quot;max-w-md mx-auto space-y-4&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div&gt;\n    &lt;label class=&quot;block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700&quot;&gt;Email&lt;/label&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;email&quot; \n           class=&quot;mt-1 block w-full rounded-md border-gray-300 shadow-sm focus:border-primary focus:ring-primary&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot; \n          class=&quot;w-full py-2 px-4 bg-primary text-white rounded-md hover:bg-primary/90 transition&quot;&gt;\n    Submit\n  &lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n```\n\n## JavaScript Best Practices\n\n### Modern JavaScript Features\n```javascript\n// Use const and let appropriately\nconst API_URL = &#x27;https://api.example.com&#x27;;\nlet currentPage = 1;\n\n// Async/await for API calls\nasync function fetchData() {\n  try {\n    const response = await fetch(API_URL);\n    const data = await response.json();\n    return data;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(&#x27;Error fetching data:&#x27;, error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Event delegation for better performance\ndocument.querySelector(&#x27;.list&#x27;).addEventListener(&#x27;click&#x27;, (e) =&gt; {\n  if (e.target.matches(&#x27;.list-item&#x27;)) {\n    handleItemClick(e.target);\n  }\n});\n\n// Use optional chaining and nullish coalescing\nconst userPreference = user?.settings?.theme ?? &#x27;light&#x27;;\n```\n\n### DOM Manipulation\n```javascript\n// Efficient DOM manipulation\nconst createCard = ({ title, content, imageUrl }) =&gt; {\n  const card = document.createElement(&#x27;div&#x27;);\n  card.className = &#x27;max-w-sm rounded-lg shadow-lg bg-white&#x27;;\n  \n  card.innerHTML = `\n    &lt;img class=&quot;w-full h-48 object-cover rounded-t-lg&quot; src=&quot;${imageUrl}&quot; alt=&quot;${title}&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;p-6&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;h2 class=&quot;text-xl font-bold mb-2&quot;&gt;${title}&lt;/h2&gt;\n      &lt;p class=&quot;text-gray-700&quot;&gt;${content}&lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  `;\n  \n  return card;\n};\n\n// Batch DOM updates\nconst updateList = (items) =&gt; {\n  const fragment = document.createDocumentFragment();\n  items.forEach(item =&gt; {\n    fragment.appendChild(createCard(item));\n  });\n  document.querySelector(&#x27;.card-container&#x27;).appendChild(fragment);\n};\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Loading Performance\n- Use `defer` for non-critical JavaScript\n- Implement lazy loading for images\n- Minimize render-blocking resources\n\n```html\n&lt;script defer src=&quot;app.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;img loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;image.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Lazy loaded image&quot;&gt;\n```\n\n### JavaScript Performance\n```javascript\n// Debounce function for performance\nconst debounce = (fn, delay) =&gt; {\n  let timeoutId;\n  return (...args) =&gt; {\n    clearTimeout(timeoutId);\n    timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; fn(...args), delay);\n  };\n};\n\n// Use for expensive operations\nconst handleSearch = debounce((query) =&gt; {\n  performSearch(query);\n}, 300);\n\n// Use IntersectionObserver for scroll-based operations\nconst observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) =&gt; {\n  entries.forEach(entry =&gt; {\n    if (entry.isIntersecting) {\n      loadMoreContent();\n    }\n  });\n});\n\nobserver.observe(document.querySelector(&#x27;.load-more-trigger&#x27;));\n```\n\n## Error Handling and Debugging\n\n### Error Handling\n```javascript\n// Custom error class\nclass APIError extends Error {\n  constructor(message, status) {\n    super(message);\n    this.name = &#x27;APIError&#x27;;\n    this.status = status;\n  }\n}\n\n// Error handling in async functions\nasync function fetchUserData(userId) {\n  try {\n    const response = await fetch(`/api/users/${userId}`);\n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new APIError(&#x27;Failed to fetch user data&#x27;, response.status);\n    }\n    return await response.json();\n  } catch (error) {\n    if (error instanceof APIError) {\n      // Handle API-specific errors\n      handleAPIError(error);\n    } else {\n      // Handle other errors\n      console.error(&#x27;Unexpected error:&#x27;, error);\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [HTML Living Standard](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/)\n- [Tailwind CSS Documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs)\n- [MDN Web Docs - JavaScript](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)\n- [Web.dev - Performance](https://web.dev/learn/performance)\n- [ARIA Authoring Practices Guide](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/)</div>

      ├── rateLimit.ts\n        └── validation.ts\n```\n\n## LLM Integration\n\n### OpenAI Client\n```typescript\n// lib/llm/openai.ts\nimport OpenAI from &#x27;openai&#x27;\nimport { env } from }\n}\n```\n\n### Anthropic Client\n```typescript\n// lib/llm/anthropic.ts\nimport Anthropic from &#x27;@anthropic-ai/sdk&#x27;\nimport { env } from &#x27;@/config/env&#x27;\nimport { ChatMessage, score: number\n  metadata?: Record&lt;string, any&gt;\n}\n```\n\n## Caching Layer\n\n### Redis Integration\n```typescript\n// lib/cache/redis.ts\nimport { Redis } from &#x27;ioredis&#x27;\nimport { env } from &#x27;@/config/env&#x27;\nimport { CacheOptions } from &#x27;./types&#x27;\n\nexport class RedisCache {\n  private client: Redis\n\n  constructor() {\n    this.client = new Redis(env.REDIS_URL!)\n  }\n\n  async get&lt;T&gt;(key: string): Promise&lt;T | null&gt; {\n    const value = await this.client.get(key)\n    return value ? JSON.parse(value) : null\n  }\n\n  async set&lt;T&gt;(\n    key: string,\n    value: T,\n    options: CacheOptions = {}\n  ) {\n    const serialized = JSON.stringify(value)\n    \n    if (options.ttl) {\n      await this.client.setex(key, options.ttl, serialized)\n    } else {\n      await this.client.set(key, serialized)\n    }\n  }\n\n  async delete(key: string) {\n    await this.client.del(key)\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Service Layer\n\n### Completion Service\n```typescript\n// services/completion/service.ts\nimport { OpenAIClient } from &#x27;@/lib/llm/openai&#x27;\nimport { AnthropicClient } from &#x27;@/lib/llm/anthropic&#x27;\nimport { RedisCache } from &#x27;@/lib/cache/redis&#x27;\nimport {\n  CompletionRequest,\n  CompletionResponse,\n} from &#x27;./types&#x27;\n\nexport class CompletionService {\n  private openai: OpenAIClient\n  private anthropic: AnthropicClient\n  private cache: RedisCache\n\n  constructor() {\n    this.openai = new OpenAIClient()\n    this.anthropic = new AnthropicClient()\n    this.cache = new RedisCache()\n  }\n\n  async complete(\n    request: CompletionRequest\n  ): Promise&lt;CompletionResponse&gt; {\n    const cacheKey = this.getCacheKey(request)\n    const cached = await this.cache.get&lt;CompletionResponse&gt;(cacheKey)\n\n    if (cached) {\n      return cached\n    }\n\n    const client = request.provider === &#x27;anthropic&#x27;\n      ? this.anthropic\n      : this.openai\n\n    const response = await client.complete(\n      request.messages,\n      request.options\n    )\n\n    await this.cache.set(cacheKey, response, { ttl: 3600 })\n\n    return response\n  }\n\n  private getCacheKey(request: CompletionRequest): string {\n    return `completion:${JSON.stringify(request)}`\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### RAG Service\n```typescript\n// services/rag/service.ts\nimport { OpenAIClient } from &#x27;@/lib/llm/openai&#x27;\nimport { PineconeStore } from &#x27;@/lib/vectorstore/pinecone&#x27;\nimport { RedisCache } from &#x27;@/lib/cache/redis&#x27;\nimport { RAGRequest, RAGResponse } from &#x27;./types&#x27;\n\nexport class RAGService {\n  private llm: OpenAIClient\n  private vectorstore: PineconeStore\n  private cache: RedisCache\n\n  constructor() {\n    this.llm = new OpenAIClient()\n    this.vectorstore = new PineconeStore(&#x27;your-index-name&#x27;)\n    this.cache = new RedisCache()\n  }\n\n  async process(request: RAGRequest): Promise&lt;RAGResponse&gt; {\n    const cacheKey = this.getCacheKey(request)\n    const cached = await this.cache.get&lt;RAGResponse&gt;(cacheKey)\n\n    if (cached) {\n      return cached\n    }\n\n    // Generate embedding for the query\n    const queryEmbedding = await this.llm.embed(request.query)\n\n    // Retrieve relevant documents\n    const results = await this.vectorstore.query(\n      queryEmbedding,\n      { topK: request.topK }\n    )\n\n    // Generate completion with context\n    const completion = await this.llm.complete([\n      {\n        role: &#x27;system&#x27;,\n        content: &#x27;Use the following context to answer the question:\n\n&#x27; +\n          results.map(r =&gt; r.metadata?.text).join(&#x27;\n\n&#x27;),\n      },\n      {\n        role: &#x27;user&#x27;,\n        content: request.query,\n      },\n    ])\n\n    const response = {\n      answer: completion.choices[0].message.content,\n      sources: results.map(r =&gt; ({\n        id: r.id,\n        score: r.score,\n        metadata: r.metadata,\n      })),\n    }\n\n    await this.cache.set(cacheKey, response, { ttl: 3600 })\n\n    return response\n  }\n\n  private getCacheKey(request: RAGRequest): string {\n    return `rag:${JSON.stringify(request)}`\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## API Layer\n\n### Rate Limiting\n```typescript\n// api/middleware/rateLimit.ts\nimport rateLimit from &#x27;express-rate-limit&#x27;\nimport RedisStore from &#x27;rate-limit-redis&#x27;\nimport { RedisCache } from &#x27;@/lib/cache/redis&#x27;\n\nexport const createRateLimiter = (\n  windowMs: number,\n  max: number\n) =&gt; {\n  const cache = new RedisCache()\n\n  return rateLimit({\n    windowMs,\n    max,\n    standardHeaders: true,\n    store: new RedisStore({\n      sendCommand: (...args: string[]) =&gt; cache.client.call(...args),\n    }),\n  })\n}\n```\n\n### Validation Middleware\n```typescript\n// api/middleware/validation.ts\nimport { z } from &#x27;zod&#x27;\nimport { Request, Response, NextFunction } from &#x27;express&#x27;\n\nexport const validate = (schema: z.ZodSchema) =&gt; {\n  return async (\n    req: Request,\n    res: Response,\n    next: NextFunction\n  ) =&gt; {\n    try {\n      const validated = await schema.parseAsync({\n        body: req.body,\n        query: req.query,\n        params: req.params,\n      })\n\n      req.body = validated.body\n      req.query = validated.query\n      req.params = validated.params\n\n      next()\n    } catch (error) {\n      if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {\n        res.status(400).json({\n          error: &#x27;Validation failed&#x27;,\n          details: error.errors,\n        })\n      } else {\n        next(error)\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Error Handling\n1. Audit logging\n\n### Monitoring\n- Request metrics\n- Error tracking\n- Performance monitoring\n- Cost tracking\n- Usage analytics\n\n## Resources\n- OpenAI documentation\n- Anthropic documentation\n- Pinecone documentation\n- TypeScript guides\n- Security best practices</div>

                <div class="prompt-text"># JavaScript, Astro, and Tailwind CSS Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides comprehensive development guidelines for building modern web applications using Astro, JavaScript, and Tailwind CSS, with a focus on performance optimization and best practices.\n\n## Project Structure\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── components/     # Reusable Astro components\n  │   ├── ui/        # UI components\n  │   └── layout/    # Layout components\n  ├── layouts/       # Page layouts\n  ├── pages/         # File-based routing\n  │   └── [...slug]  # Dynamic routes\n  └── styles/        # Global styles\npublic/             # Static assets\nastro.config.mjs    # Astro configuration\ntailwind.config.cjs # Tailwind configuration\n```\n\n## Component Development\n\n### Astro Component Example\n```astro\n---\n// Header.astro\ninterface Props {\n  title: string;\n  description?: string;\n}\n\nconst { title, description } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;header class=&quot;bg-white shadow-sm&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 py-6&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h1 class=&quot;text-3xl font-bold text-gray-900&quot;&gt;\n      {title}\n    &lt;/h1&gt;\n    {description &amp;&amp; (\n      &lt;p class=&quot;mt-2 text-gray-600&quot;&gt;\n        {description}\n      &lt;/p&gt;\n    )}\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/header&gt;\n```\n\n### Page Component Example\n```astro\n---\n// src/pages/blog/[...slug].astro\nimport Layout from &#x27;../../layouts/BlogLayout.astro&#x27;;\nimport { getCollection } from &#x27;astro:content&#x27;;\n\nexport async function getStaticPaths() {\n  const posts = await getCollection(&#x27;blog&#x27;);\n  return posts.map(post =&gt; ({\n    params: { slug: post.slug },\n    props: { post },\n  }));\n}\n\nconst { post } = Astro.props;\nconst { Content } = await post.render();\n---\n\n&lt;Layout title={post.data.title}&gt;\n  &lt;article class=&quot;prose lg:prose-xl mx-auto&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h1&gt;{post.data.title}&lt;/h1&gt;\n    &lt;Content /&gt;\n  &lt;/article&gt;\n&lt;/Layout&gt;\n```\n\n## Routing and Navigation\n\n### Dynamic Routes\n```astro\n---\n// src/pages/products/[category]/[id].astro\nexport async function getStaticPaths() {\n  const products = await getProducts();\n  return products.map(product =&gt; ({\n    params: { \n      category: product.category,\n      id: product.id \n    },\n    props: { product },\n  }));\n}\n\nconst { product } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;Layout title={product.name}&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;product-details&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h1 class=&quot;text-2xl font-bold&quot;&gt;{product.name}&lt;/h1&gt;\n    &lt;p class=&quot;text-gray-600&quot;&gt;{product.description}&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/Layout&gt;\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Partial Hydration\n```astro\n---\n// Interactive component with selective hydration\nimport InteractiveCounter from &#x27;../components/InteractiveCounter&#x27;;\n---\n\n&lt;div class=&quot;page-content&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;!-- Static content --&gt;\n  &lt;h1&gt;Welcome&lt;/h1&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Hydrated only when visible --&gt;\n  &lt;InteractiveCounter client:visible /&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Hydrated after main content --&gt;\n  &lt;Comments client:idle /&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Hydrated immediately --&gt;\n  &lt;SearchBar client:load /&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n### Image Optimization\n```astro\n---\nimport { Image } from &#x27;@astrojs/image/components&#x27;;\n---\n\n&lt;Image \n  src={import(&#x27;../assets/hero.jpg&#x27;)} \n  alt=&quot;Hero image&quot;\n  width={800}\n  height={600}\n  format=&quot;webp&quot;\n  loading=&quot;lazy&quot;\n  class=&quot;rounded-lg shadow-md&quot;\n/&gt;\n```\n\n## Styling with Tailwind CSS\n\n### Configuration\n```javascript\n// tailwind.config.cjs\nmodule.exports = {\n  content: [&#x27;./src/**/*.{astro,html,js,jsx,md,mdx,svelte,ts,tsx,vue}&#x27;],\n  theme: {\n    extend: {\n      colors: {\n        primary: &#x27;#3b82f6&#x27;,\n        secondary: &#x27;#64748b&#x27;,\n      },\n      typography: {\n        DEFAULT: {\n          css: {\n            maxWidth: &#x27;65ch&#x27;,\n            color: &#x27;#1f2937&#x27;,\n            a: {\n              color: &#x27;#3b82f6&#x27;,\n              &#x27;&amp;:hover&#x27;: {\n                color: &#x27;#2563eb&#x27;,\n              },\n            },\n          },\n        },\n      },\n    },\n  },\n  plugins: [\n    require(&#x27;@tailwindcss/typography&#x27;),\n    require(&#x27;@tailwindcss/forms&#x27;),\n  ],\n}\n```\n\n### Component Styling\n```astro\n---\n// Card.astro\ninterface Props {\n  title: string;\n  content: string;\n}\n\nconst { title, content } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;div class=&quot;rounded-lg shadow-md bg-white overflow-hidden hover:shadow-lg transition&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;px-6 py-4&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h3 class=&quot;text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 mb-2&quot;&gt;\n      {title}\n    &lt;/h3&gt;\n    &lt;p class=&quot;text-gray-600&quot;&gt;\n      {content}\n    &lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;px-6 py-4 bg-gray-50&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;slot name=&quot;footer&quot; /&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n```\n\n## SEO and Meta Tags\n\n### SEO Component\n```astro\n---\n// components/SEO.astro\ninterface Props {\n  title: string;\n  description: string;\n  image?: string;\n  canonicalURL?: string;\n}\n\nconst {\n  title,\n  description,\n  image = &#x27;/default-og.png&#x27;,\n  canonicalURL = Astro.url,\n} = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;head&gt;\n  &lt;title&gt;{title}&lt;/title&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;description&quot; content={description} /&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Open Graph --&gt;\n  &lt;meta property=&quot;og:title&quot; content={title} /&gt;\n  &lt;meta property=&quot;og:description&quot; content={description} /&gt;\n  &lt;meta property=&quot;og:image&quot; content={image} /&gt;\n  &lt;meta property=&quot;og:url&quot; content={canonicalURL} /&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Twitter --&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;twitter:card&quot; content=&quot;summary_large_image&quot; /&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;twitter:title&quot; content={title} /&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;twitter:description&quot; content={description} /&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;twitter:image&quot; content={image} /&gt;\n  \n  &lt;!-- Canonical URL --&gt;\n  &lt;link rel=&quot;canonical&quot; href={canonicalURL} /&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n```\n\n## Data Management\n\n### Content Collections\n```typescript\n// src/content/config.ts\nimport { defineCollection, z } from &#x27;astro:content&#x27;;\n\nconst blog = z.array(z.string()),\n  }),\n});\n\nexport const collections = {\n  blog,\n};\n```\n\n## Testing and Accessibility\n\n### Component Testing\n```typescript\n// Card.test.ts\nimport { describe, it, expect } from &#x27;vitest&#x27;;\nimport { render } from &#x27;@testing-library/astro&#x27;;\nimport Card from &#x27;../components/Card.astro&#x27;;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;Card&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  it(&#x27;renders title and content correctly&#x27;, async () =&gt; {\n    const { getByText } = await render(Card, {\n      title: &#x27;Test Title&#x27;,\n      content: &#x27;Test Content&#x27;,\n    });\n    \n    expect(getByText(&#x27;Test Title&#x27;)).toBeDefined();\n    expect(getByText(&#x27;Test Content&#x27;)).toBeDefined();\n  });\n});\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Astro File Headers\n   - Include path/filename as one-line comment\n   - Add brief description of component purpose\n   - List any dependencies or requirements\n\n2. Comments and Documentation\n   - Describe purpose, not implementation\n   - Document complex type definitions\n   - Explain non-obvious design decisions\n\n3. Code Quality\n   - Follow DRY principles\n   - Prioritize modularity\n   - Focus on performance\n   - Maintain type safety\n\n## Git Workflow\n\n### Commit Message Guidelines\nFollow the Conventional Commits specification:\n\n```bash\n&lt;type&gt;[optional scope]: &lt;description&gt;\n\n[optional body]\n\n[optional footer(s)]\n```\n\n#### Types\n- feat: New features\n- fix: Bug fixes\n- docs: Documentation changes\n- style: Code style changes\n- refactor: Code refactoring\n- test: Adding/modifying tests\n- chore: Maintenance tasks\n\n#### Examples\n```bash\ngit commit -m &#x27;feat: add responsive navbar with TailwindCSS&#x27;\ngit commit -m &#x27;fix(types): correct type definition for props&#x27;\ngit commit -m &#x27;docs: update component usage examples&#x27;\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1. Maintainability\n- Write clear documentation\n- Follow consistent naming\n- Implement proper testing\n- Use version control effectively\n\n## Development Tools\n\n### 1. Required Extensions\n- TypeScript Language Server\n- Astro Language Support\n- TailwindCSS IntelliSense\n- ESLint/Prettier Integration\n\n### 2. Add dark mode toggle functionality:\n```typescript\n// src/components/ThemeToggle.astro\n---\n---\n&lt;button id=&quot;themeToggle&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;svg width=&quot;20&quot; height=&quot;20&quot; fill=&quot;currentColor&quot; class=&quot;dark:hidden&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;!-- Sun icon --&gt;\n  &lt;/svg&gt;\n  &lt;svg width=&quot;20&quot; height=&quot;20&quot; fill=&quot;currentColor&quot; class=&quot;hidden dark:block&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;!-- Moon icon --&gt;\n  &lt;/svg&gt;\n&lt;/button&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\n  const theme = (() =&gt; {\n    if (typeof localStorage !== &#x27;undefined&#x27; &amp;&amp; localStorage.getItem(&#x27;theme&#x27;)) {\n      return localStorage.getItem(&#x27;theme&#x27;);\n    }\n    if (window.matchMedia(&#x27;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&#x27;).matches) {\n      return &#x27;dark&#x27;;\n    }\n    return &#x27;light&#x27;;\n  })();\n      \n  if (theme === &#x27;light&#x27;) {\n    document.documentElement.classList.remove(&#x27;dark&#x27;);\n  } else {\n    document.documentElement.classList.add(&#x27;dark&#x27;);\n  }\n\n  window.localStorage.setItem(&#x27;theme&#x27;, theme);\n&lt;/script&gt;\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### 1.                 <div class="prompt-text"># Astro with TypeScript Development Guide\n\n## Overview\nThis guide provides comprehensive development guidelines for building type-safe Astro applications using TypeScript, focusing on best practices, performance optimization, and maintainable code structure.\n\n## Prerequisites\n- Node.js (v18.14.1 or higher)\n- TypeScript knowledge\n- Code editor with TypeScript support (VS Code recommended)\n- Basic understanding of Astro concepts\n\n## Project Setup\n\n### 1. Create New Project\n```bash\nnpm create astro@latest my-astro-app -- --template basics --typescript strict\n```\n\n### 2. TypeScript Configuration\nCreate or update `tsconfig.json`:\n```json\n{\n  &quot;extends&quot;: &quot;astro/tsconfig/strict&quot;,\n  &quot;compilerOptions&quot;: {\n    &quot;baseUrl&quot;: &quot;.&quot;,\n    &quot;paths&quot;: {\n      &quot;@/*&quot;: [&quot;src/*&quot;]\n    },\n    &quot;jsx&quot;: &quot;preserve&quot;,\n    &quot;jsxImportSource&quot;: &quot;react&quot;,\n    &quot;strict&quot;: true,\n    &quot;skipLibCheck&quot;: true,\n    &quot;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames&quot;: true\n  },\n  &quot;include&quot;: [&quot;src/**/*.ts&quot;, &quot;src/**/*.tsx&quot;, &quot;src/**/*.astro&quot;],\n  &quot;exclude&quot;: [&quot;node_modules&quot;]\n}\n```\n\n## Project Structure\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── components/     # Reusable components\n  │   ├── ui/        # UI components\n  │   └── layouts/   # Layout components\n  ├── content/       # Content collections\n  │   └── config.ts  # Content configuration\n  ├── layouts/       # Page layouts\n  ├── pages/         # File-based routing\n  ├── types/         # TypeScript types/interfaces\n  └── utils/         # Utility functions\n```\n\n## TypeScript Best Practices\n\n### 1. Component Types\n```typescript\n// src/types/components.ts\nexport interface Props {\n  title: string;\n  description?: string;\n  image?: {\n    src: string;\n    alt: string;\n  };\n}\n\n// src/components/Card.astro\n---\nimport type { Props } from &#x27;../types/components&#x27;;\n\nconst { title, description, image } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;article class=&quot;card&quot;&gt;\n  {image &amp;&amp; &lt;img src={image.src} alt={image.alt} /&gt;}\n  &lt;h2&gt;{title}&lt;/h2&gt;\n  {description &amp;&amp; &lt;p&gt;{description}&lt;/p&gt;}\n&lt;/article&gt;\n```\n\n### 2. Content Collections\n```typescript\n// src/content/config.ts\nimport { defineCollection, z } from &#x27;astro:content&#x27;;\n\nconst blog = defineCollection({\n  schema: z.object({\n    title: z.string(),\n    publishDate: z.date(),\n    author: z.string(),\n    tags: z.array(z.string()),\n    image: z.object({\n      src: z.string(),\n      alt: z.string()\n    }).optional()\n  })\n});\n\nexport const collections = { blog };\n```\n\n### 3. API Integration\n```typescript\n// src/types/api.ts\nexport interface ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; {\n  data: T;\n  status: number;\n  message: string;\n}\n\n// src/utils/api.ts\nexport async function fetchData&lt;T&gt;(url: string): Promise&lt;ApiResponse&lt;T&gt;&gt; {\n  const response = await fetch(url);\n  if (!response.ok) {\n    throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);\n  }\n  return await response.json();\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### 1. Type-Safe Image Handling\n```typescript\n// src/components/OptimizedImage.astro\n---\nimport { Image } from &#x27;@astrojs/image/components&#x27;;\nimport type { ImageMetadata } from &#x27;astro&#x27;;\n\ninterface Props {\n  src: ImageMetadata;\n  alt: string;\n  width?: number;\n  height?: number;\n}\n\nconst { src, alt, width, height } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;Image \n  src={src}\n  alt={alt}\n  width={width}\n  height={height}\n  format=&quot;webp&quot;\n  loading=&quot;lazy&quot;\n/&gt;\n```\n\n### 2. Dynamic Imports\n```typescript\n// src/pages/[slug].astro\n---\nimport type { GetStaticPaths } from &#x27;astro&#x27;;\nimport { getCollection } from &#x27;astro:content&#x27;;\n\nexport const getStaticPaths = (async () =&gt; {\n  const posts = await getCollection(&#x27;blog&#x27;);\n  return posts.map(post =&gt; ({\n    params: { slug: post.slug },\n    props: { post },\n  }));\n}) satisfies GetStaticPaths;\n\nconst { post } = Astro.props;\nconst { Content } = await post.render();\n---\n\n&lt;article&gt;\n  &lt;Content /&gt;\n&lt;/article&gt;\n```\n\n## Development Workflow\n\n### 1. Type Checking\n```bash\n# Run type checking\nnpm run astro check\n\n# Watch mode for development\nnpm run astro check --watch\n```\n\n### 2. ESLint Configuration\n```javascript\n// .eslintrc.cjs\nmodule.exports = {\n  extends: [\n    &#x27;plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended&#x27;,\n    &#x27;plugin:astro/recommended&#x27;,\n  ],\n  parser: &#x27;@typescript-eslint/parser&#x27;,\n  plugins: [&#x27;@typescript-eslint&#x27;],\n  root: true,\n  overrides: [\n    {\n      files: [&#x27;*.astro&#x27;],\n      parser: &#x27;astro-eslint-parser&#x27;,\n      parserOptions: {\n        parser: &#x27;@typescript-eslint/parser&#x27;,\n        extraFileExtensions: [&#x27;.astro&#x27;],\n      },\n    },\n  ],\n};\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### 1. Type-Safe Error Boundaries\n```typescript\n// src/components/ErrorBoundary.tsx\nimport type { Component } from &#x27;solid-js&#x27;;\nimport { ErrorBoundary as SolidErrorBoundary } from &#x27;solid-js&#x27;;\n\ninterface ErrorBoundaryProps {\n  fallback: Component;\n  children: any;\n}\n\nexport const ErrorBoundary: Component&lt;ErrorBoundaryProps&gt; = (props) =&gt; {\n  return (\n    &lt;SolidErrorBoundary fallback={props.fallback}&gt;\n      {props.children}\n    &lt;/SolidErrorBoundary&gt;\n  );\n};\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### 1. Component Testing\n```typescript\n// src/components/__tests__/Card.test.ts\nimport { describe, it, expect } from &#x27;vitest&#x27;;\nimport { render } from &#x27;@testing-library/astro&#x27;;\nimport Card from &#x27;../Card.astro&#x27;;\n\ndescribe(&#x27;Card&#x27;, () =&gt; {\n  it(&#x27;renders with required props&#x27;, async () =&gt; {\n    const { getByText } = await render(Card, {\n      title: &#x27;Test Card&#x27;,\n    });\n    \n    expect(getByText(&#x27;Test Card&#x27;)).toBeDefined();\n  });\n});\n```\n\n## Deployment Considerations\n\n### 1. Environment Variables\n```typescript\n// src/env.d.ts\n/// &lt;reference types=&quot;astro/client&quot; /&gt;\n\ninterface ImportMetaEnv {\n  readonly PUBLIC_API_URL: string;\n  readonly DATABASE_URL: string;\n}\n\ninterface ImportMeta {\n  readonly env: ImportMetaEnv;\n}\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Astro TypeScript Documentation](https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/typescript/)\n- [TypeScript Documentation](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/)\n- [Astro Content Collections](https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/content-collections/)\n- [Testing in Astro](https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/testing/)</div>

Project Initialization\n```bash\nbunx create-astro@latest ./ --template minimal --install --git --yes\n```\n\n### 2. Tailwind CSS Integration\n```bash\nnpx astro add tailwind --yes\n```\n\n### 3. Configure Tailwind\nCreate `src/styles/globals.css`:\n```css\n@tailwind base;\n@tailwind components;\n@tailwind utilities;\n```\n\n### 4. Update Astro Config\nModify `astro.config.mjs`:\n```javascript\nimport { defineConfig } from &#x27;astro/config&#x27;;\nimport tailwind from &#x27;@astrojs/tailwind&#x27;;\n\nexport default defineConfig({\n  integrations: [\n    tailwind({\n      // Disable injecting a basic `base.css` import\n      applyBaseStyles: false,\n    }),\n  ],\n});\n```\n\n### 5. Create Base Layout\nCreate `src/layouts/BaseLayout.astro`:\n```astro\n---\nimport &#x27;../styles/globals.css&#x27;;\n\ninterface Props {\n  title: string;\n  description?: string;\n}\n\nconst { title, description = &#x27;Astro site with Tailwind CSS&#x27; } = Astro.props;\n---\n\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;utf-8&quot; /&gt;\n    &lt;meta name=&quot;viewport&quot; content=&quot;width=device-width, initial-scale=1&quot; /&gt;\n    &lt;meta name=&quot;description&quot; content={description} /&gt;\n    &lt;title&gt;{title}&lt;/title&gt;\n  &lt;/head&gt;\n  &lt;body class=&quot;min-h-screen bg-white dark:bg-gray-900&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;slot /&gt;\n  &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n```\n\n### 6. Update Index Page\nModify `src/pages/index.astro`:\n```astro\n---\nimport BaseLayout from &#x27;../layouts/BaseLayout.astro&#x27;;\n---\n\n&lt;BaseLayout title=&quot;Welcome&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;main class=&quot;container mx-auto px-4 py-8&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;h1 class=&quot;text-4xl font-bold text-gray-900 dark:text-white&quot;&gt;\n      Welcome to Astro + Tailwind CSS\n    &lt;/h1&gt;\n    &lt;p class=&quot;mt-4 text-lg text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300&quot;&gt;\n      Start building your content-focused website\n    &lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;/main&gt;\n&lt;/BaseLayout&gt;\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Performance Optimization\n- Use `client:load` sparingly\n- Implement proper code splitting\n- Optimize images using Astro&#x27;s image integration\n- Minimize unused Tailwind classes\n\n### Development Workflow\n- Follow component-driven development\n- Implement proper TypeScript types\n- Use Git for version control\n- Document component usage\n\n### Code Organization\n```\nsrc/\n  ├── components/    # Reusable components\n  ├── layouts/       # Page layouts\n  ├── pages/         # Astro pages\n  └── styles/        # Global styles\n```\n\n## Verification\nStart the development server:\n```bash\nbun run dev\n```\n\nVisit `http://localhost:4321` to verify the setup.\n\n## Common Issues &amp; Solutions\n\n### Styles Not Applying\n- Verify globals.css is imported\n- Check Tailwind configuration\n- Clear build cache\n\n### Build Performance\n- Enable build caching\n- Optimize dependencies\n- Use proper content configuration\n\n### Type Support\n- Ensure proper TypeScript configuration\n- Use Astro&#x27;s built-in types\n- Keep dependencies updated</div>

                <div class="prompt-text"># FastAPI Best Practices Guide\n\n## Core Principles\n- Type safety and validation\n- Performance optimization\n- Clean architecture\n- Security best practices\n- Modern Python features\n\n## Project Organization\n\n### Directory Structure\n```\nproject/\n├── app/\n│   ├── api/\n│   │   ├── deps.py\n│   │   ├── errors.py\n│   │   └── routes/\n│   ├── core/\n│   │   ├── config.py\n│   │   └── security.py\n│   ├── db/\n│   │   ├── events.py\n│   │   └── session.py\n│   ├── models/\n│   │   └── domain/\n│   └── services/\n│       └── domain/\n├── tests/\n│   ├── conftest.py\n│   └── api/\n└── main.py\n```\n\n## Type Safety\n\n### Pydantic Models\n```python\n# app/schemas/user.py\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel, EmailStr, Field, ConfigDict\nfrom typing import Annotated\n\nclass UserBase(BaseModel):\n    model_config = ConfigDict(from_attributes=True)\n    \n    email: Annotated[\n        EmailStr,\n        Field(description=&quot;User&#x27;s email address&quot;)\n    ]\n    full_name: Annotated[\n        str,\n        Field(min_length=1, max_length=100)\n    ]\n    is_active: Annotated[\n        bool,\n        Field(default=True)\n    ]\n\nclass UserCreate(UserBase):\n    password: Annotated[\n        str,\n        Field(min_length=8, pattern=r&quot;^(?=.*[A-Za-z])(?=.*\d)&quot;)\n    ]\n\nclass UserResponse(UserBase):\n    id: int\n```\n\n### Type Hints\n```python\n# app/services/user.py\nfrom collections.abc import Sequence\nfrom typing import Annotated, TypeVar, Generic\n\nT = TypeVar(&quot;T&quot;)\n\nclass Repository(Generic[T]):\n    async def get_by_id(\n        self,\n        id: Annotated[int, Field(gt=0)]\n    ) -&gt; T | None:\n        ...\n    \n    async def get_all(\n        self,\n        skip: Annotated[int, Field(ge=0)] = 0,\n        limit: Annotated[int, Field(gt=0)] = 100\n    ) -&gt; Sequence[T]:\n        ...\n```\n\n## Dependency Injection\n\n### Dependencies\n```python\n# app/api/deps.py\nfrom typing import Annotated\nfrom fastapi import Depends, Security\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession\n\nfrom app.core.security import oauth2_scheme\nfrom app.db.session import async_session\nfrom app.services.user import UserService\n\nasync def get_db() -&gt; AsyncSession:\n    async with async_session() as session:\n        try:\n            yield session\n            await session.commit()\n        except Exception:\n            await session.rollback()\n            raise\n        finally:\n            await session.close()\n\nasync def get_current_user(\n    token: Annotated[str, Security(oauth2_scheme)],\n    db: Annotated[AsyncSession, Depends(get_db)]\n) -&gt; User:\n    return await UserService(db).get_current_user(token)\n\nDBDep = Annotated[AsyncSession, Depends(get_db)]\nCurrentUser = Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### Exception Classes\n```python\n# app/api/errors.py\nfrom fastapi import HTTPException, status\nfrom typing import Any\n\nclass APIError(HTTPException):\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        status_code: int,\n        detail: str,\n        headers: dict[str, Any] | None = None\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        super().__init__(status_code, detail, headers)\n\nclass NotFoundError(APIError):\n    def __init__(self, resource: str, id: int) -&gt; None:\n        super().__init__(\n            status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,\n            detail=f&quot;{resource} with id {id} not found&quot;\n        )\n\nclass ValidationError(APIError):\n    def __init__(self, detail: str) -&gt; None:\n        super().__init__(\n            status_code=status.HTTP_422_UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY,\n            detail=detail\n        )\n```\n\n### Error Handlers\n```python\n# app/api/errors/handlers.py\nfrom fastapi import FastAPI, Request\nfrom fastapi.responses import JSONResponse\nfrom sqlalchemy.exc import IntegrityError\n\ndef add_error_handlers(app: FastAPI) -&gt; None:\n    @app.exception_handler(APIError)\n    async def api_error_handler(\n        request: Request,\n        exc: APIError\n    ) -&gt; JSONResponse:\n        return JSONResponse(\n            status_code=exc.status_code,\n            content={&quot;detail&quot;: exc.detail},\n            headers=exc.headers\n        )\n    \n    @app.exception_handler(IntegrityError)\n    async def integrity_error_handler(\n        request: Request,\n        exc: IntegrityError\n    ) -&gt; JSONResponse:\n        return JSONResponse(\n            status_code=status.HTTP_409_CONFLICT,\n            content={&quot;detail&quot;: &quot;Database integrity error&quot;}\n        )\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Async Database Operations\n```python\n# app/db/session.py\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import (\n    create_async_engine,\n    async_sessionmaker,\n    AsyncSession\n)\n\nfrom app.core.config import settings\n\nengine = create_async_engine(\n    settings.DATABASE_URL,\n    echo=settings.DEBUG,\n    pool_size=settings.DB_POOL_SIZE,\n    max_overflow=settings.DB_MAX_OVERFLOW,\n    pool_pre_ping=True\n)\n\nasync_session = async_sessionmaker(\n    engine,\n    class_=AsyncSession,\n    expire_on_commit=False\n)\n```\n\n### Caching\n```python\n# app/core/cache.py\nfrom functools import wraps\nfrom typing import Any, Callable\nimport redis.asyncio as redis\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel\n\nfrom app.core.config import settings\n\nredis_client = redis.from_url(\n    settings.REDIS_URL,\n    encoding=&quot;utf-8&quot;,\n    decode_responses=True\n)\n\nclass CacheConfig(BaseModel):\n    prefix: str\n    ttl: int = 3600\n    \n    def get_key(self, *args, **kwargs) -&gt; str:\n        return f&quot;{self.prefix}:{str(args)}:{str(kwargs)}&quot;\n\ndef cached(config: CacheConfig):\n    def decorator(func: Callable):\n        @wraps(func)\n        async def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):\n            key = config.get_key(*args, **kwargs)\n            \n            # Try cache\n            if cached_data := await redis_client.get(key):\n                return cached_data\n            \n            # Get fresh data\n            result = await func(*args, **kwargs)\n            \n            # Cache result\n            await redis_client.setex(\n                key,\n                config.ttl,\n                result\n            )\n            \n            return result\n        return wrapper\n    return decorator\n```\n\n## Security\n\n### Authentication\n```python\n# app/core/security.py\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta\nfrom typing import Any\nfrom jose import jwt\nfrom passlib.context import CryptContext\n\nfrom app.core.config import settings\n\npwd_context = CryptContext(\n    schemes=[&quot;bcrypt&quot;],\n    deprecated=&quot;auto&quot;\n)\n\ndef create_access_token(\n    subject: str | Any,\n    expires_delta: timedelta | None = None\n) -&gt; str:\n    if expires_delta:\n        expire = datetime.utcnow() + expires_delta\n    else:\n        expire = datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(\n            minutes=settings.ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES\n        )\n    \n    to_encode = {\n        &quot;exp&quot;: expire,\n        &quot;sub&quot;: str(subject),\n        &quot;type&quot;: &quot;access&quot;\n    }\n    \n    return jwt.encode(\n        to_encode,\n        settings.SECRET_KEY,\n        algorithm=settings.JWT_ALGORITHM\n    )\n\ndef verify_password(\n    plain_password: str,\n    hashed_password: str\n) -&gt; bool:\n    return pwd_context.verify(plain_password, hashed_password)\n\ndef get_password_hash(password: str) -&gt; str:\n    return pwd_context.hash(password)\n```\n\n## Testing\n\n### Fixtures\n```python\n# tests/conftest.py\nimport pytest\nfrom httpx import AsyncClient\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession\nfrom typing import AsyncGenerator\n\nfrom app.main import app\nfrom app.db.session import async_session\n\n@pytest.fixture\nasync def db() -&gt; dict[str, str]:\n    token = create_access_token(user.id)\n    return {&quot;Authorization&quot;: f&quot;Bearer {token}&quot;}\n```\n\n### API Tests\n```python\n# tests/api/test_users.py\nimport pytest\nfrom httpx import AsyncClient\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession\n\npytestmark = pytest.mark.asyncio\n\nasync def test_create_user(\n    client: AsyncClient,\n    db: AsyncSession\n):\n    response = await client.post(\n        &quot;/api/v1/users&quot;,\n        json={\n            &quot;email&quot;: &quot;test@example.com&quot;,\n            &quot;password&quot;: &quot;password123&quot;,\n            &quot;full_name&quot;: &quot;Test User&quot;\n        }\n    )\n    \n    assert response.status_code == 201\n    data = response.json()\n    assert data[&quot;email&quot;] == &quot;test@example.com&quot;\n    assert &quot;id&quot; in data\n```\n\n## Middleware\n\n### Request ID\n```python\n# app/middleware/request_id.py\nfrom fastapi import Request\nfrom starlette.middleware.base import BaseHTTPMiddleware\nimport uuid\n\nclass RequestIDMiddleware(BaseHTTPMiddleware):\n    async def dispatch(\n        self,\n        request: Request,\n        call_next\n    ):\n        request_id = str(uuid.uuid4())\n        request.state.request_id = request_id\n        \n        response = await call_next(request)\n        response.headers[&quot;X-Request-ID&quot;] = request_id\n        \n        return response\n```\n\n## Logging\n\n### Logger Setup\n```python\n# app/core/logging.py\nimport logging\nimport sys\nfrom typing import Any\n\nfrom app.core.config import settings\n\ndef setup_logging() -&gt; None:\n    logging.basicConfig(\n        level=settings.LOG_LEVEL,\n        format=(\n            &quot;%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - &quot;\n            &quot;%(message)s [%(request_id)s]&quot;\n        ),\n        handlers=[\n            logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)\n        ]\n    )\n\nclass RequestIDFilter(logging.Filter):\n    def filter(self, record: Any) -&gt; bool:\n        record.request_id = getattr(\n            record,\n            &quot;request_id&quot;,\n            &quot;no_request_id&quot;\n        )\n        return True\n\nlogger = logging.getLogger(&quot;app&quot;)\nlogger.addFilter(RequestIDFilter())\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Code Organization\n1.                 <div class="prompt-text"># FastAPI Scalable API Guide\n\n## Core Principles\n- Scalable architecture\n- Performance optimization\n- Resource management\n- Monitoring and observability\n- Maintainable codebase\n\n## Architecture Design\n\n### Domain-Driven Design\n```python\n# app/domain/models/user.py\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom typing import NewType\n\nUserId = NewType(&quot;UserId&quot;, int)\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass User:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;User domain model.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    id: UserId\n    email: str\n    created_at: datetime\n    \n    @classmethod\n    def create(cls, email: str) -&gt; &quot;User&quot;:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Create new user.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        return cls(\n            id=UserId(0),  # Placeholder until persisted\n            email=email,\n            created_at=datetime.utcnow()\n        )\n```\n\n### Repository Pattern\n```python\n# app/infrastructure/repositories/user.py\nfrom typing import Protocol, runtime_checkable\nfrom sqlalchemy import select\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession\n\nfrom app.domain.models.user import User, UserId\n\n@runtime_checkable\nclass UserRepository(Protocol):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;User repository interface.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    async def get_by_id(self, id: UserId) -&gt; User | None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Get user by ID.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        ...\n    \n    async def save(self, user: User) -&gt; User:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Save user.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        ...\n\nclass SQLAlchemyUserRepository:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;SQLAlchemy implementation of user repository.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(self, session: AsyncSession) -&gt; None:\n        self._session = session\n    \n    async def get_by_id(self, id: UserId) -&gt; User | None:\n        result = await self._session.execute(\n            select(UserModel).where(UserModel.id == id)\n        )\n        user_model = result.scalar_one_or_none()\n        return user_model.to_domain() if user_model else None\n    \n    async def save(self, user: User) -&gt; User:\n        user_model = UserModel.from_domain(user)\n        self._session.add(user_model)\n        await self._session.flush()\n        await self._session.refresh(user_model)\n        return user_model.to_domain()\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Caching Layer\n```python\n# app/infrastructure/cache/redis.py\nfrom typing import Any, TypeVar, Generic\nfrom redis.asyncio import Redis\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel\n\nT = TypeVar(&quot;T&quot;, bound=BaseModel)\n\nclass RedisCache(Generic[T]):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Redis cache implementation.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        redis: Redis,\n        prefix: str,\n        model: type[T],\n        ttl: int = 3600\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        self._redis = redis\n        self._prefix = prefix\n        self._model = model\n        self._ttl = ttl\n    \n    def _key(self, id: str) -&gt; str:\n        return f&quot;{self._prefix}:{id}&quot;\n    \n    async def get(self, id: str) -&gt; T | None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Get item from cache.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        data = await self._redis.get(self._key(id))\n        if not data:\n            return None\n        return self._model.model_validate_json(data)\n    \n    async def set(self, id: str, item: T) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Set item in cache.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        await self._redis.setex(\n            self._key(id),\n            self._ttl,\n            item.model_dump_json()\n        )\n    \n    async def delete(self, id: str) -&gt; None:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Delete item from cache.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        await self._redis.delete(self._key(id))\n```\n\n### Database Optimization\n```python\n# app/infrastructure/database/session.py\nfrom contextlib import asynccontextmanager\nfrom sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import (\n    create_async_engine,\n    AsyncSession,\n    async_sessionmaker\n)\nfrom sqlalchemy.pool import AsyncAdaptedQueuePool\n\ndef create_engine(url: str, pool_size: int = 5):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Create database engine with connection pooling.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    return create_async_engine(\n        url,\n        poolclass=AsyncAdaptedQueuePool,\n        pool_size=pool_size,\n        max_overflow=10,\n        pool_timeout=30,\n        pool_pre_ping=True,\n        pool_recycle=1800\n    )\n\n@asynccontextmanager\nasync def transaction():\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Transaction context manager.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    async with AsyncSession() as session:\n        async with session.begin():\n            try:\n                yield session\n                await session.commit()\n            except Exception:\n                await session.rollback()\n                raise\n```\n\n## Load Balancing\n\n### Rate Limiting\n```python\n# app/api/middleware/rate_limit.py\nfrom fastapi import Request, HTTPException\nfrom redis.asyncio import Redis\nimport time\n\nclass RateLimiter:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Rate limiter using sliding window.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        redis: Redis,\n        window_seconds: int = 60,\n        max_requests: int = 100\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        self._redis = redis\n        self._window = window_seconds\n        self._max = max_requests\n    \n    async def check_rate_limit(\n        self,\n        key: str\n    ) -&gt; tuple[bool, int]:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Check if request is within rate limit.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        now = int(time.time())\n        window_start = now - self._window\n        \n        async with self._redis.pipeline() as pipe:\n            # Remove old requests\n            await pipe.zremrangebyscore(key, 0, window_start)\n            # Add new request\n            await pipe.zadd(key, {str(now): now})\n            # Count requests in window\n            await pipe.zcount(key, window_start, now)\n            # Set key expiration\n            await pipe.expire(key, self._window)\n            _, _, count, _ = await pipe.execute()\n        \n        return count &lt;= self._max, count\n\nclass RateLimitMiddleware:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Rate limit middleware.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        redis: Redis,\n        window_seconds: int = 60,\n        max_requests: int = 100\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        self._limiter = RateLimiter(\n            redis,\n            window_seconds,\n            max_requests\n        )\n    \n    async def __call__(\n        self,\n        request: Request,\n        call_next\n    ):\n        key = f&quot;rate_limit:{request.client.host}&quot;\n        allowed, count = await self._limiter.check_rate_limit(key)\n        \n        if not allowed:\n            raise HTTPException(\n                status_code=429,\n                detail=&quot;Too many requests&quot;\n            )\n        \n        response = await call_next(request)\n        response.headers[&quot;X-RateLimit-Limit&quot;] = str(self._limiter._max)\n        response.headers[&quot;X-RateLimit-Remaining&quot;] = str(\n            self._limiter._max - count\n        )\n        \n        return response\n```\n\n## Monitoring\n\n### Metrics Collection\n```python\n# app/infrastructure/metrics/prometheus.py\nfrom prometheus_client import (\n    Counter,\n    Histogram,\n    generate_latest\n)\nfrom fastapi import FastAPI, Response\nfrom time import time\n\n# Metrics\nREQUEST_COUNT = Counter(\n    &quot;http_requests_total&quot;,\n    &quot;Total HTTP requests&quot;,\n    [&quot;method&quot;, &quot;endpoint&quot;, &quot;status&quot;]\n)\n\nREQUEST_LATENCY = Histogram(\n    &quot;http_request_duration_seconds&quot;,\n    &quot;HTTP request duration&quot;,\n    [&quot;method&quot;, &quot;endpoint&quot;]\n)\n\ndef setup_metrics(app: FastAPI) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Setup metrics collection.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    @app.middleware(&quot;http&quot;)\n    async def metrics_middleware(request, call_next):\n        start_time = time()\n        \n        response = await call_next(request)\n        \n        REQUEST_COUNT.labels(\n            method=request.method,\n            endpoint=request.url.path,\n            status=response.status_code\n        ).inc()\n        \n        REQUEST_LATENCY.labels(\n            method=request.method,\n            endpoint=request.url.path\n        ).observe(time() - start_time)\n        \n        return response\n    \n    @app.get(&quot;/metrics&quot;)\n    def metrics():\n        return Response(\n            generate_latest(),\n            media_type=&quot;text/plain&quot;\n        )\n```\n\n### Logging\n```python\n# app/infrastructure/logging/config.py\nimport logging\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom typing import Any\n\nclass JSONFormatter(logging.Formatter):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;JSON log formatter.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def format(self, record: logging.LogRecord) -&gt; str:\n        &quot;&quot;&quot;Format log record as JSON.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n        log_data = {\n            &quot;timestamp&quot;: datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n            &quot;level&quot;: record.levelname,\n            &quot;message&quot;: record.getMessage(),\n            &quot;module&quot;: record.module,\n            &quot;function&quot;: record.funcName,\n            &quot;line&quot;: record.lineno\n        }\n        \n        if hasattr(record, &quot;request_id&quot;):\n            log_data[&quot;request_id&quot;] = record.request_id\n        \n        if record.exc_info:\n            log_data[&quot;exception&quot;] = self.formatException(\n                record.exc_info\n            )\n        \n        return json.dumps(log_data)\n\ndef setup_logging() -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Setup logging configuration.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    logger = logging.getLogger()\n    handler = logging.StreamHandler()\n    handler.setFormatter(JSONFormatter())\n    logger.addHandler(handler)\n    logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### Exception Handling\n```python\n# app/api/errors/handlers.py\nfrom fastapi import FastAPI, Request\nfrom fastapi.responses import JSONResponse\nfrom typing import Any\n\nclass AppError(Exception):\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Base application error.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        message: str,\n        code: str,\n        status_code: int = 400,\n        details: dict[str, Any] | None = None\n    ) -&gt; None:\n        self.message = message\n        self.code = code\n        self.status_code = status_code\n        self.details = details or {}\n\ndef setup_error_handlers(app: FastAPI) -&gt; None:\n    &quot;&quot;&quot;Setup error handlers.&quot;&quot;&quot;\n    \n    @app.exception_handler(AppError)\n    async def app_error_handler(\n        request: Request,\n        error: AppError\n    ) -&gt; JSONResponse:\n        return JSONResponse(\n            status_code=error.status_code,\n            content={\n                &quot;error&quot;: {\n                    &quot;code&quot;: error.code,\n                    &quot;message&quot;: error.message,\n                    &quot;details&quot;: error.details\n                }\n            }\n        )\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n### Architecture\n1. ├── grpc/        # gRPC services\n  │   └── rest/       # REST endpoints\n  ├── internal/       # Private application code\n  │   ├── config/    # Configuration\n  │   ├── models/   # Data models\n  │ Definition\n```protobuf\nsyntax = &quot;proto3&quot;;\npackage service;\n\noption go_package = &quot;./pb&quot;;\n\nservice UserService {\n  rpc GetUser(GetUserRequest) returns (User) {}\n  rpc ListUsers(ListUsersRequest) returns (stream User) {}\n  rpc UpdateUser(UpdateUserRequest) returns (User) {}\n}\n\nmessage User {\n  string id = 1;\n  string name = 2;\n  string email = 3;\n  repeated string roles = 4;\n}\n\nmessage GetUserRequest {\n  string id = 1;\n}\n\nmessage ListUsersRequest {\n  int32 page_size = 1;\n  string page_token = 2;\n}\n\nmessage UpdateUserRequest {\n  User user = 1;\n  repeated string update_mask = 2;\n}\n```\n\n### gRPC Server Implementation\n```go\npackage service\n\nimport (\n    &quot;context&quot;\n    &quot;google.golang.org/grpc/codes&quot;\n    &quot;google.golang.org/grpc/status&quot;\n    pb &quot;myapp/pb&quot;\n)\n\ntype UserServer struct {\n    pb.UnimplementedUserServiceServer\n    db Database\n    cache Cache\n}\n\nfunc NewUserServer(db Database, cache Cache) *UserServer {\n    return &amp;UserServer{\n        db: db,\n        cache: cache,\n    }\n}\n\nfunc (s *UserServer) GetUser(ctx context.Context, req *pb.GetUserRequest) (*pb.User, error) {\n    // Try cache first\n    if user, err := s.cache.GetUser(ctx, req.Id); err == nil {\n        return user, nil\n    }\n\n    // Fetch from database\n    user, err := s.db.GetUser(ctx, req.Id)\n    if err != nil {\n        return nil, status.Errorf(codes.NotFound, &quot;user not found: %v&quot;, err)\n    }\n\n    // Cache the result\n    if err := s.cache.SetUser(ctx, user); err != nil {\n        log.Printf(&quot;failed to cache user: %v&quot;, err)\n    }\n\n    return user, nil\n}\n```\n\n## Database Management\n\n### Connection Pool\n```go\npackage database\n\nimport (\n    &quot;context&quot;\n    &quot;database/sql&quot;\n    _ &quot;github.com/lib/pq&quot;\n)\n\ntype Config struct {\n    MaxOpenConns    int\n    MaxIdleConns    int\n    ConnMaxLifetime time.Duration\n}\n\nfunc NewDB(dsn string, cfg Config) (*sql.DB, error) {\n    db, err := sql.Open(&quot;postgres&quot;, dsn)\n    if err != nil {\n        return nil, fmt.Errorf(&quot;failed to open database: %w&quot;, err)\n    }\n\n    db.SetMaxOpenConns(cfg.MaxOpenConns)\n    db.SetMaxIdleConns(cfg.MaxIdleConns)\n    db.SetConnMaxLifetime(cfg.ConnMaxLifetime)\n\n    if err := db.PingContext(context.Background()); err != nil {\n        return nil, fmt.Errorf(&quot;failed to ping database: %w&quot;, err)\n    }\n\n    return db, nil\n}\n```\n\n## Caching Strategy\n\n### Redis Implementation\n```go\npackage cache\n\nimport (\n    &quot;context&quot;\n    &quot;encoding/json&quot;\n    &quot;github.com/go-redis/redis/v8&quot;\n    &quot;time&quot;\n)\n\ntype Cache struct {\n    client *redis.Client\n}\n\nfunc NewCache(addr string) *Cache {\n    client := redis.NewClient(&amp;redis.Options{\n        Addr: addr,\n        DB:   0,\n    })\n    return &amp;Cache{client: client}\n}\n\nfunc (c *Cache) Get(ctx context.Context, key string, value interface{}) error {\n    data, err := c.client.Get(ctx, key).Bytes()\n    if err != nil {\n        return err\n    }\n    return json.Unmarshal(data, value)\n}\n\nfunc (c *Cache) Set(ctx context.Context, key string, value interface{}, expiration time.Duration) error {\n    data, err := json.Marshal(value)\n    if err != nil {\n        return err\n    }\n    return c.client.Set(ctx, key, data, expiration).Err()\n}\n```\n\n## Load Balancing\n\n### Service Discovery\n```go\npackage discovery\n\nimport (\n    &quot;google.golang.org/grpc&quot;\n    &quot;google.golang.org/grpc/resolver&quot;\n)\n\ntype ServiceRegistry struct {\n    services map[string][]string\n}\n\nfunc NewServiceRegistry() *ServiceRegistry {\n    return &amp;ServiceRegistry{\n        services: make(map[string][]string),\n    }\n}\n\nfunc (r *ServiceRegistry) Register(serviceName, endpoint string) {\n    r.services[serviceName] = append(r.services[serviceName], endpoint)\n}\n\nfunc (r *ServiceRegistry) Resolve(serviceName string) []string {\n    return r.services[serviceName]\n}\n\n// Client-side load balancing\nfunc NewClient(target string) (*grpc.ClientConn, error) {\n    return grpc.Dial(\n        target,\n        grpc.WithDefaultServiceConfig(`{&quot;loadBalancingPolicy&quot;:&quot;round_robin&quot;}`),\n        grpc.WithInsecure(),\n    )\n}\n```\n\n## Performance Optimization\n\n### Goroutine Pool\n```go\npackage worker\n\nimport (\n    &quot;context&quot;\n    &quot;sync&quot;\n)\n\ntype Pool struct {\n    tasks chan func()\n    wg    sync.WaitGroup\n}\n\nfunc NewPool(size int) *Pool {\n    p := &amp;Pool{\n        tasks: make(chan func(), size),\n    }\n\n    for i := 0; i &lt; size; i++ {\n        p.wg.Add(1)\n        go func() {\n            defer p.wg.Done()\n            for task := range p.tasks {\n                task()\n            }\n        }()\n    }\n\n    return p\n}\n\nfunc (p *Pool) Submit(task func()) {\n    p.tasks &lt;- task\n}\n\nfunc (p *Pool) Close() {\n    close(p.tasks)\n    p.wg.Wait()\n}\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### Custom Error Types\n```go\npackage errors\n\nimport (\n    &quot;fmt&quot;\n    &quot;net/http&quot;\n)\n\ntype Error struct {\n    Code    int\n    Message string\n    Err     error\n}\n\nfunc (e *Error) Error() string {\n    if e.Err != nil {\n        return fmt.Sprintf(&quot;%s: %v&quot;, e.Message, e.Err)\n    }\n    return e.Message\n}\n\nfunc NewNotFound(resource string, err error) *Error {\n    return &amp;Error{\n        Code:    http.StatusNotFound,\n        Message: fmt.Sprintf(&quot;%s not found&quot;, resource),\n        Err:     err,\n    }\n}\n\nfunc NewInvalidInput(message string, err error) *Error {\n    return &amp;Error{\n        Code:    http.StatusBadRequest,\n        Message: message,\n        Err:     err,\n    }\n}\n```\n\n## Monitoring and Metrics\n\n### Prometheus Integration\n```go\npackage metrics\n\nimport (\n    &quot;github.com/prometheus/client_golang/prometheus&quot;\n    &quot;github.com/prometheus/client_golang/prometheus/promauto&quot;\n)\n\nvar (\n    RequestDuration = promauto.NewHistogramVec(\n        prometheus.HistogramOpts{\n            Name: &quot;http_request_duration_seconds&quot;,\n            Help: &quot;Duration of HTTP requests&quot;,\n        },\n        []string{&quot;method&quot;, &quot;path&quot;},\n    )\n\n    ErrorCount = promauto.NewCounterVec(\n        prometheus.CounterOpts{\n            Name: &quot;error_total&quot;,\n            Help: &quot;Total number of errors&quot;,\n        },\n        []string{&quot;type&quot;},\n    )\n)\n\nfunc RecordRequest(method, path string, duration float64) {\n    RequestDuration.WithLabelValues(method, path).Observe(duration)\n}\n\nfunc RecordError(errorType string) {\n    ErrorCount.WithLabelValues(errorType).Inc()\n}\n```\n\n## Resources\n- [Go &quot;:8080&quot;,\n        Handler:      mux,\n        ReadTimeout:  15 * time.Second,\n        WriteTimeout: 15 * time.Second,\n        IdleTimeout:  60 * time.Second,\n    }\n\n    // Start }\n}\n\nfunc registerRoutes(mux *http.ServeMux) {\n    // API routes\n    mux.HandleFunc(&quot;GET /api/v1/users&quot;, handleGetUsers)\n    mux.HandleFunc(&quot;POST /api/v1/users&quot;, ID    string `json:&quot;id&quot;`\n    Name  string `json:&quot;name&quot;`\n    Email string `json:&quot;email&quot;`\n}\n\ntype UserService interface {\n    GetUser(id string) (*User, error)\n    CreateUser(user *User) error\n    UpdateUser(user *User) error\n    DeleteUser(id string) error\n    ListUsers() ([]*User, error)\n}\n\ntype UserHandler struct {\n    service UserService\n}\n\nfunc middleware\n\nimport (\n    &quot;log&quot;\n    &quot;net/http&quot;\n    &quot;time&quot;\n)\n\nfunc LoggingMiddleware(next http.Handler) http.Handler {\n    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n        start := time.Now()\n\n        // Create response wrapper to capture status code\n        rw := NewResponseWriter(w)\n\n        // Call next handler\n          time.Since(start),\n        )\n    })\n}\n\ntype ResponseWriter struct {\n    http.ResponseWriter\n    statusCode int\n}\n\nfunc NewResponseWriter(w http.ResponseWriter) *ResponseWriter {\n    return &amp;ResponseWriter{w, http.StatusOK}\n}\n\nfunc (rw *ResponseWriter) WriteHeader(code int) {\n    rw.statusCode = code\n    rw.ResponseWriter.WriteHeader(code)\n}\n```\n\n### Authentication string\n}\n\nfunc AuthMiddleware(next http.Handler) http.Handler {\n    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {\n        // Get token from header\n        authHeader := r.Header.Get(&quot;Authorization&quot;)\n        if authHeader == &quot;&quot; {\n            http.Error(w, &quot;missing authorization header&quot;, http.StatusUnauthorized)\n            return\n        }\n\n        // Extract token\n        token := strings.TrimPrefix(authHeader, &quot;Bearer &quot;)\n        if token == &quot;&quot; {\n            http.Error(w, &quot;invalid token format&quot;, nil\n}\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\n### Custom Error Types\n```go\npackage errors\n\nimport (\n    &quot;fmt&quot;\n    &quot;net/http&quot;\n)\n\ntype APIError struct {\n    Status  int NewNotFound(resource string) *APIError {\n    return &amp;APIError{\n        Status:  http.StatusNotFound,\n        Message: fmt.Sprintf(&quot;%s not found&quot;, resource),\n        Code:    &quot;NOT_FOUND&quot;,\n    }\n}\n\nfunc NewBadRequest(message string) *APIError {\n    return &amp;APIError{\n        Status:  http.StatusBadRequest,\n        Message: message,\n        Code:    &quot;BAD_REQUEST&quot;,\n    }\n}\n```\n\n## Rate Limiting\n\n### Token Bucket Implementation\n```go\npackage middleware\n\nimport (\n    &quot;net/http&quot;\n    &quot;sync&quot;\n    &quot;time&quot;\n)\n\ntype RateLimiter struct {\n    tokens     float64\n    capacity   float64\n    rate       float64\n    lastUpdate time.Time\n    mu         sync.Mutex\n}\n\nfunc NewRateLimiter(rate float64, capacity float64) *RateLimiter {\n    return &amp;RateLimiter{\n        tokens:     capacity,\n        capacity:   capacity,\n        rate:       rate,\n        lastUpdate: time.Now(),\n    }\n}\n\nfunc (rl *RateLimiter) Allow() bool {\n    rl.mu.Lock()\n    defer rl.mu.Unlock()\n\n    now := time.Now()\n    elapsed := now.Sub(rl.lastUpdate).Seconds()\n    rl.tokens = min(rl.capacity, rl.tokens+(elapsed*rl.rate))\n    rl.lastUpdate = now\n\n    if rl.tokens &gt;= 1 {\n        rl.tokens--\n        return true\n    }\n    return false\n}\n\nfunc
